"Hey John, what're you listening to?" Jessie asked, still fascinated by every single thing about you and anything on your scale.

"Some of the songs from the transformers series, the soundtrack for the movies rocked." You answered, at the moment you were listening to a remake of the transformers theme song, this one a hybrid of rock and rap.

"What's that?" Jessie persisted, apparently Transformers had never managed to make it to Anthro theatres or tv's. Which seemed kind of odd and ironic, anthros were after all quite similar to the transformers, at least size wise. Other than that there were no real similarities.

"A tv series that spread out to a few movies" you continued to answer, "it was about giant robots coming to earth and taking on disguises as human things like cars, trucks, tanks, planes and boats. It was all part of their civil war. Different movies and shows had different reasons for their coming along with different relationships with us."

"Sounds like humans and anthros" Kim cut in, thinking about the giant part, but really there were no other similarities.

"Not really" you say, "they came here on a specific mission each time, they were mechanical and they were warriors. One group was peaceful the other knew only war, and not all of them were giants, some of them were on human scale and some were actually smaller."

"Interesting" Kim replied, she seemed interested in this, then again, she did seem quite curious about a lot of things. "can we watch any of it."

That was a puzzling question, you did have one method, albeit that'd take a while as you didn't have the movie with you, or any of the TV Series. "I'd have to get someone to send it out from home" you answered, that'd take a while, a while, especially with you not knowing when you'd be coming back out here. Tonight would probably be the last night.

The chatter died down for now, and you resumed working on your homework and trying to find a solution to your problem with the giant paper. After a while you finially finished off everything you had, everyone...
1132121211121222222111111111121111112.title: Skip to after dinner

11321212111212222221111111111211111121.content:
The giants all around you had finished off their homework for now, a rather annoying over-dose in your mind, something from everywhere. Everyone needed a break and something to clear their minds, after a bit of talking far overhead they concluded to head outside.

Rather annoying was that no one asked for your opinion on the matter, but for now you'd have to live with that and talk to Melanie about it later. Before she could get up and leave you up here, you climbed up on her knee and started you way up to her shoulder. You reached your spot just as she stood up, the motion nearly threw you off, but luckily you managed to stay on.

One by one they filed out of the room, Melanie was the last to walk out, she headed down the stairs, at the bottom she headed right and alongside the stairs to a glass slidding door. Before she got that far, both of you were stopped by Melanie's dad, "John, you parents called. We've still got them on the line."

He held out his hand and you jumped on, you watched Melanie walk on outside while her dad took you into the kitchen and to a huge phone sitting on the counter, luckily you hearing was good or else this'd be a work out. The giant sat you down and you walked out to the mouth piece.

"Hi mom, hi dad! How's it going" you say, hoping the phone's sensitive enough to pick you up, then you listened carefully to the other end.

"Hi sweetie, how's school" you here your mom say, it was kind of hard to hear it, but you managed.

"Pretty good" you answer, "I've got a few new friends."

"That's nice, we've got some news for you" mom says, "your going to be staying out with Melanie for the whole school year, you'll be safest that way."

Earlier you'd had a feeling that there'd be some bad news, or at least semi-bad news. You weren't particularly looking forward to another tongue bath or being dumped in that storage thing in the desk. Though it did seem a good idea considering how school was and it'd certainly be better to be with Melanie from the start than to make it to homeroom in the morning on your own.

"Listen, we'll be out tonight with some of your stuff" mom said, "we've gotta go, its a long drive you know, can you put one of Melanie's parents on."

"Sure mom, hang on" you say glumly. None of the anthros were in sight. With a thought the plate on your back formed itself into wings with jets on your legs and in each of your palms. Rocketing upward you look around for one of the older tigers, and eventually find Melanie's dad. "My parents wanna talk with you" you say, still sort of upset.

"Don't worry, it'll all work out" the tiger says, from the way he talks, you were willing to bet he was a psychologist of some sort; or at the least could be one if he wanted.

You nod an aknowledgement and head for the huge glass door, still open. As soon as you got outside you saw your friends in the middle of a game of soccer, this greatly cheered you up, it was a tad late to intervene though, at least during this round.

Spotting a huge tree outside you go full speed ahead, level out on your belly for a bit and ring the corner of the soccer 'field' heading for the tree. Right under a branch you pull up and gently hover down to land on the branch. Sitting up here, you looked back at the house, trying to find the 'silver lining' so far you found nothing, but an idea did come to mind.

There was enough wood here to at least build a better bed, though right now you had no matress. The idea seemed good, and the matress would be for later, much, much, later. Out in front of you a few 'smaller' branches were sticking out, you sliced them up using a saw from that nice suit of yours. Each one you fell, you layed between your current branch and another one, it took a bit as these were still the 'short' branches.

You worked away for a bit, waiting on the game below to end for you to join in...
11321212111212222221111111111211111121.title: Twists, turns, a trip with a whole lot of burns

113212121112122222211111111112111111211.content:
Time must've shot on by, you'd been working away, doing what you could to build a bed; the next time you looked up from your work you were in almost total darkness. The only way you'd seen the logs in front of you was from the suit compensating for you.

Down below, Melanie, Kim, Jess and Brad were finishing up their game, they'd declared the next goal would be the last of the day. That did suck as far you were concerned, but you'd get your chance to play with them sometime later; a few days or maybe weeks, but you'd get your chance.

Down below, Melanie started looking for you, you started to work you way around to get down, grabbing your bed to take it with you. With bed in hand you gradually glided down into the grass, it was taller than you were, but that didn't stop you from enjoying a view of the game from the goal posts, a set of empty cardboard boxes.

Up ahead, Brad was making a run for the goal, coming in fast, he shot the ball right at you! "Ah crap!" you yell, jumping off the box, forgetting about the bed you'd had sitting there. Ouch and oof were your only thoughts as you hit he ground rolling and heard the ball smash into the box behind you; turning to look you saw the bed you'd been building had be obliterated.

Ooh that ticked you off like nothing else could. The suit responded to that quite quickly, surrounding you in armored plating, the HUD on your eyes start projecting data for fighting, info on shields and armor strength, energy levels and more.

You jumped and shot into the air, hovering in front of Brad, he looked at you with absolutely no idea that it was you, the suit had your head covered in a helmet, with a visor that was entirely obscuring your face. "Next time, do you think you can come any closer to killing me?" you say sarcasticly.

"What?" Brad said, unbelieving of what he had almost done, he seemed to start to stammer, but that wasn't going to get anywhere.

"Calm down, just be more careful' you say, the armored plating retracting as you calmed down, in the end all that was left were the wings, stabilizers and boosters. Descending you turn a bit to see the bed you'd built totally destroyed, which left you with another night in a sleeping bag and a stumbling around.

Before you touched down, the suit popped up a notice on your hud, a human car was coming up on the house. That'd be your parents coming to drop off some of your stuff; which Melanie still didn't know about, and this'd definitely be something she'd wanna know about.

"Melanie, could you come in for a minute" Melanie's dad bellowed from the house, no doubt to tell her about your new arrangement.

"Coming dad!" she called, then to your friends, "I'll be right back"

"Now what?" Brad asked, there wasn't exactly a lot they could do with three anthros and a human.

"Back to soccer?" you offered, with the suit and its armor you could play, you just needed to have it out, as fast as it was, it still couldn't pop out in an instant's notice like would've been needed a minute ago.

"How? You said I nearly killed you a minute ago" Brad said, not wanting to repeat anything like that again any time soon.

"With this" you answer, shooting upward, a thought sets the suit to change. Parts shoot off all over, your surrounded in a sphere of parts orbiting around you and sticking themselves on in a specific order. In the end you were coated in armor from head to foot, there was no back booster, just repulsers in your hands and jets along your legs.

"What's that gonna do?" Brad persisted, skeptical that there was enough to that suit of armor to protect you from anything more than a piece of paper.

"Fine, I'll prove it. Someone try and make a goal" you say, cutting the thrusters and slamming into the ground, right between the 'goal posts'. You knelt down from the impact, but then something would have to give with the highspeed touch down.

Off in the distance you saw Kim with the ball, trying to make a long shot on the goal and obviously going easy on you. Reguardless of how easy she tried, the ball was still rocketing in. The suit provided you with its tracectory, you moved to stop it, thrusters on full you hit the ball, killed its force towards you and sent it flying back into the other goal.
113212121112122222211111111112111111211.title: Darkness Descends, play time ends

choices: A bit of Fun n' Games
1132121211121222222111111111121111112112.content:
Your friends left while you settled in with what your parents brought, after the mess last night, you and Melanie had concluded that you'd use that elevator in her desk for a room. It didn't have a lot in it and there was plenty of room, it seemed pretty much ideal to you.

At the moment you were moving up the stairs, the last boxes of your stuff strapped on under your wings. This meant loosing some speed, but that wasn't much of a problem since you weren't going far. At the stairs, you just hovered straight up to the balcony on top, then straight around the corner to Melanie's room.

Your giant friend was sitting on a wheeled chair trying to organize the little mess of boxes holding your things, so far she wasn't succeeding in making sense of what any of the boxes were or had in them. That made you smile, you'd always had a really screwy system of organizing things and now it paid off, at least to some extent it was paying off.

Coming up behind her you descended and lowered your last boxes onto the desk. With that load dropped you set down and started setting things up, searching through what you had at hand. Among the things you found at the start were a carpet, your game systems, computer, TV, a folding table and a desk. Though you lacked a bed, which would be quite a problem since the one you had outside had gotten destroyed.

"Everything but a bed" you said to yourself, "that and the kitchen sink."

"Why would you want to have the kitchen sink?" Melanie asked, genuinely confused by the reference. Apparently some things were exclusive to humans.

"Its a human joke" You answer continuing to work, "don't worry about it."

A long while later you had a room set-up, flat screen TV on a tall stand next to your desk, PC hooked up on the desk along with all your other geeky things. Table and shelves with books and quite a supply of geek gear, but that's the kind of stuff that you'd grown up with. A lot of it would probably confuse the Anthros, they weren't quite as technologically advanced as humans.

"All set?" Melanie asked, looking down at your room, at least room as far as you were concerned. Albeit it was probably the only room that moved up and down.

"I think so" you say...
1132121211121222222111111111121111112112.title: Another Night with Melanie

1132121211121222222111111111121111112112.content:
You've gotta get changed for bed, its late and sleep is going to be necessary. School was tiring as heck and at the moment it was doing a lot to drain you each day to keep up with the Anthros.

"I'm gonna get ready for bed" you say, walking over and hitting the button to go down. As soon as the elevator's done you take off the suit, it seems unwilling, but at the very least it's still listening into your thoughts for when you need it.

"I'm gonna wait til' later, I'm staying up tonight" Melanie said, at least you wouldn't have to wait on her all clear.

You walked over to a trunk and pulled out your red night clothes from before. Sure you were called a red rat, but you were sure you'd find something to get Melanie with. As soon as you were dressed you put the back plate of the suit back on and flew up and out, leaving the room down.

Up top you zipped into the bathroom and quickly brushed your teeth, at least for now it'd be easier than having Melanie help you, especially with her tongue baths. As for cleaning tonight, you had a simpler and better solution.

With a few quick steps you stood next to the faucets, they took a bit of work to turn; you grabbed them and with quite a deal of work turned them, almost instantly a steady stream of water flooded out. A nice temperature, luke warm water and perfect for you.

"Bonzaie!" you call, jumping into the sink and enjoying the water flowing over you, it was cleansing, relaxing and enjoyable after all this. As soon as you finished you took off and buzzed back into Melanie's and now also your room.

She was...
1132121211121222222111111111121111112112.title: Getting Ready for Bed

choices: What school?!? Its the week end!
1132121211121222222111111111121111112112.content:
Melanie didn't seem to notice you hovering in, she was busy with some sort of game; from here it looked like it was something like those cheap toys from fast food places. Whatever it was, she seemed to be taking wacks at it and getting angrier each time she missed.

"Hey, what's that?" you asked, approaching the... whatever it was that Melanie had, as you neared you saw white, grey, black and red things popping up and down, up and down; rather randomly and at the moment in such a way that Melanie just couldn't hit them.

"Wack a Rat" Melanie answered, missing yet again. You noticed that when she was mad her ears stood straight up, swiveling a bit from side to side rather rapidly. Of course, her whipping tail was a much bigger indicator that she was getting ticked; and it was an indication to stay in front of her.

"Ha ha, very funny" you say, Melanie was still on the rat thing, which was going to wear out eventually. Though you were still wearing red. No doubt, tomorrow you'd wear something else, maybe zebra stripes or some other weird thing, but it definitely would not be red!

"It's fun" Melanie replied, then with a smirk, "and harder than getting the real thing."

"We'll see" you say, 30 meters or so off the ground near the edge of the bed. You friend seemed to catch on, sitting down her game and starring up at you, apparently trying to find some way to catch you; something that wouldn't be happening today if you had anything to say about it. "that is see if you can...catch me before I get back in the desk."

"Your on" Melanie answers, jumping in your direction.

You cut the jets and drop like a lead weight, making Melanie go flying over you to land on the floor several meters away. She rolled and came up crouching, while you were on the floor just ahead of her. The suit comes through for you, showing a good escape path, and you take it.

Boosters to full you rocket along the floor, under he tv stand, and out behind it you pull up rolling to the right. Over the TV you stop and check on Melanie, now standing and coming your way. The tigress starts to reach up for you, as she's just about to get you, the boosters shoot to full on the thought. Suit, wings and all rocket up, you nail the ceiling, push off and bolt back down level with the desk; Melanie's cat-like reflexes might be fast, but this time they're just too slow.

Your 'room' is just ahead, you come in, hit the desk and go into a flip. You flip two or three times to land standing in the center of your little area and to have Melanie starring at you; if looks could kill, you were a dead man.

"I think this rat just won" you say smugly, unfortunately Melanie isn't quite so happy.

"Your also the first winged rat I've ever seen" Melanie shot back, "sounds like a cross of a rat and a bat."

"Maybe" you say, sitting down in your computer chair, "we'll see when I beat you to school tomorrow."
1132121211121222222111111111121111112112.title: Cat and Mouse

1132121211121222222111111111121111112112.content:
"Well, I don't think you'll be beating me tomorrow" Melanie said smiling, somewhat mischieviously, "tomorrow's saturday my little ratty friend. No school!"

This took you by surprise, you flew over and looked the calender over, Melanie was right; tomorrow was indeed saturday. Woo hoo for two days of no school, and maybe if you were lucky a third from an in-service day; something many schools seem to take at least in the beginning of the school year.

"So, what're we doing tomorrow?" you asked, home for you was still miles and miles away; not exactly an effective trip to be making.
1132121211121222222111111111121111112112.title: What school?!? Its the week end!

1132121211121222222111111111121111112112.content: Melanie's taking you on a really interesting trip for the weekend, it'll be a day, but still interesting....
1132121211121222222111111111121111112112.title: Other

1132121211121222222111111111121111112112.content: Where is she taking you?
1132121211121222222111111111121111112112.title: Other

1132121211121222222111111111121111112112.content:
After Melanie told you that "where you were going was a surprised" you gulped at the thought. You walk over to Melanie. and look up to her as she starts to playing her game of "wack a rat". "why is it a surprise" you ask. she dosen't say any thing but she get's a grin on her face. uh oh you think when suddenly Melanie started rubbing your stomach gently just like she did after you got hit by the door, on your first day. "Melanie...what...are you doing" you try to say but, your starting to get sleepy. You then close your eye's and fall asleep.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
When you wake up you look up and to see Melanies face above you, which makes you jump. She just chuckles while lifting you up. When you wipe your eye's open you relise that the suit that you had on wasn't on you. "Melanie, where's my suit" you ask. "I took it off, you don't need it today" Melanie "I wanted to carry you to where we're going". You try to argue but Melanie just gave a face at you that said "don't ask any question's" so you keep your shut, because you don't want to anger her. Like she'll get mad at you she never gets mad at you you think to yourself. She brings you back to your room and tell's you to get ready. You watch her walk out of the room, you decide that it would futile to try and complain because she probably wouldn't tell where your going today either way. So, you get dressed and then go up to the elevator. Once you get to the top and pics you up in pad, and walks down stair's.
"Hi Melanie" Melanies Mom said "do you want breakfest" "No Mom we're in a hurry" Your vision is blured by how fast she runs out the door and to her bike. She slid you in the basket, and pulled it out of the bushes. She then get's on and pedal's in the opposite direction as the school. "Melanie!" you yell but instead of answering you she looks down grin's and keeps on pedaling. By the time you guy's stopped you almost were asleep.
"Hey you sleepy rat don't go back to sleep yet" Melanie said with a snicker. "Sorry a anthro fifty two feat tall tigeress woke me up with her breath" you said back getting a snicker out of Melanie. She then grabs you, and lets you slide into her left pad. to you for some reason it was softer to you than yesterday. She then lift's you up to see a sign that say's "Junk Yard" "Uh...Melanie...this is a Junk Yard" you say with confusion. Melanie senses your confusion and walks into the junk yard to see that all there is is junk. She then takes you farther into the junk yard and then you see...
1132121211121222222111111111121111112112.title: Or the local Junkyard?

1132121211121222222111111111121111112112.content:
Another tiger anthro you think to yourself. Melanie walks closer to the Tiger who seemed to be working. When he noticed Melanie he turned around. "Hey cousin" he said with a smile "Hey Mark"Melanie said smiling back. He look's down at you with a curios "Who's he?" Mark said point at you. "This is my friend, John"Melanie said "Hi" you said. "This is my cousin Mark who works here at the junk yard, I figure since your going to be staying with us you might want to meet him" Melanie explained. "Hey John, nice to meet you" Mark said while holding out his hand. You shake his hand, still a little confused "Hi...Mark, so why do you work here?" You ask him. "I don't know, I needed some money and well this was the only place hiring at the time" Mark answers you while his eye stares across the piles of junk that inhabit this place.
Melanie looks down at you. "So is this all we had planned, Melanie" You ask her. "No I was hoping that we could all hang out" Melanie said while now staring at Mark like it was a question to him. "Um...Yeah sure" Mark said while taking off his work clouths. "isn't your boss going to be mad" You ask him. "No, they don't even come down here, all I have to do check out and we can go" He answered with smile on his face. He then walked over to a small shed like building, and came back out in a minnute or so. " Ok we can go" He said.
We walked out of the junk yard. Instead of getting on her bike, her cousin grabbed the bike put in the trunk of a black mustang. He then walked to the driver's seat and got in. Melanie walked to the back seat's sat down closed the door. She then set you down and buckled up. She then grabbed you and held you tight, not tight enough to hirt you but enough so that when we started or stop all of a sudden at any time you won't fly and hit anything that could kill you.
"So, how did you guy's meet any way?" Mark asked
We Then looked at each look at each other, and then we start our story. Melanie even told how she gave you a tongue bath, and how you woke her up at night, but also about how she got you sick by her once greasy paws. We still hadn't moved at all, and it was about noon.
"Wait, you gave him washed him with your tongue?" Mark asks. Melanie nods, and after she nods Mark start's cracking up laughing. Melanie tryed to keep herself from laughing to but she couldn't hold it in. She then started bursting out laughing. It's like Mark sent a desease of laughter to Melanie. When Mark calmed down he turned his head and looked at both of you. "So what do you want to do?" Mark asked.
1132121211121222222111111111121111112112.title: another tiger anthro

1132121211121222222111111111121111112112.content: " lets go and get something to eat, I'm starving," said Melanie as her stomach let out a vary loud grow. " I know the perfect place, there food is wonderful." Mark responded. He put the car in gear and started to move forward. Getting fast enough that you were pined down to Melanie's paw/hand. " this is like riding the Gravetron at the amusement park," "what is the Gravetron we don't have that ride here," said Melanie with a slightly puzzled look on her fur covered face." It is this ride that spins you so fast that you are not able to move," "cool, I wish I could ride that." the rest of the car ride was quiet. Then you came to a vary large restraint. The three of you went over to the table and started to read the menu. About five minuets later the waiter who was a giant anthro raccoon "hello my name is Robert and I will be your server to day, have you decided what you want to eat," "yes, I will have a hot dog with mustard, fries, a Large soda," said Mark " and I will have a stake with a side salad and water," "and I will have a cheese burger with a small soda." you say. The waiter turned around and answered back " it will be here shortly."
1132121211121222222111111111121111112112.title: Get lunch

11321212111212222221111111111212.content:
"We're headed for FCS, family consumer science" Melanie said, "humans used to call it home economics."

"Great, I can get fried up, baked and sewed to a doiley" you reply, not exactly enthused about going to a class like FCS, you'd always found that stuff boring anyways. On the way, you thought of some of the cartoons you'd seen and among the most common things to happen was someone getting hit over the head by a frying pan; at that thought, the suit, which you now knew was called ALSS, re arranged a bit and dumped a helmet off on your head. Along with dumping a ton or so more bits of itself into your head, this time it mentioned a strength enhancement system, an exosuit type thing. The parts running down your arms and legs would make you stronger.

The two of you reached the class,late, but the principle must've called ahead so you wouldn't get any trouble from the teacher, an elephant of some kind by the looks of it.

Melanie grabbed an apron, it was more like an enormous curtain, and headed for a group in the kitchen area, it was the start of school, but they were already cooking; back home you wouldn't start cooking for at least a week. Either way, you fly after Melanie over to one of the kitchens, one of four for that matter, this one in fact was right against the window on the far side of the room.

You buzzed over and watched what the animals were setting to work on, whatever it was it'd be vegetarian. Looking down you saw pots and pans on the stove but they were all empty, then you noticed the anthros had gathered around something.

Well, if every else dubbed it so important, then it must be something you'd need to know as well, with a roll and a flip you buzzed over to the group and landed on Melanie's shoulder. For a second you felt like a parrot on a captain's shoulder, but then a parrot here was much, much, bigger than you were. Down below it was yet another giant piece of paper, a recipe for some sort of soup; made of vegetables and soy. Oh joy.

"Your on stove, your own clean up, your on this and your on that..." a Lizard said dividing up the jobs until he came to you, "what're we going to do with you?"

That was rather insulting, size was a problem yes, but if you could fly around, there would certainly be a way for you to do about anything the anthros could. "Give me any job, I'll find someway to get it done" you answer, the Lizard gives you a doubtful look, you hold your ground.

"Fine, your gonna help cook." the Lizard said, "lets get to work."

Luckily you were working with Malanie, otherwise this might've been much harder. You took off her shoulder and followed her across to the stove, then landed on the counter. Melanie towered overhead, reading an ingredients list, though she hadn't read it aloud it seemed she wanted this to be easy for you. Taking a close look up, you tried to decypher what was written on the back, the ALSS helped, it read it and put it up on your eyes.

Before Melanie could even get started, you buzzed off to begin grabbing what was needed...
11321212111212222221111111111212.title: Home Ec.

113212121112122222211111111112121.content:
"Lets see here, top of the list... two oranges" you say to yourself, well at this scale an orange was nearly as tall as you were, so again their was a challenge, or was there?

You found your oranges, hovering over them you gave it a thought and as always the suit complied with something that fit the bill. On either wing a grapple shot down and pulled the oranges up under you, with a boost from the after burners the flight to Melanie was fast. Over the counter you dumped the oranges and headed for the next thing on the list.

"Next up" you start, "an egg? Why an egg? This is soup." Complaints aside, you fly to the fridge and pry the door open, grabbing on and pushing away with the jet pack. The enormous door drifted off and you buzzed in, quickly snagging an egg from the carton, carrying it in your arms, this had to be put down a bit softer. Buzzing tight against the counter you hovered for just a second, someone remaining on your belly as you sat the egg down then buzzed back off.

"Artificial chicken broth" you read off the screen, "oh joy, wonder what that's made of." That was sitting out on the other side of the kitchen. Shooting ahead full speed, you rocket by it, grabbing it as you go. It weighs an infinite ton for a second, but then the ALSS compensates and really holds it for you. Shooting towards Melanie you bolt up and over her shoulder to bomb the huge container down behind the oranges.

"Ok, what's next" you say, hovering over the pots out in front of Melanie. Unfortunately you'd only seen part of the requirements.

"I got the rest" Melanie answered, indicating a 'small' pile of boxes next to the stove, "they were all in the cabinets."

"Great, lets throw this junk together and see what we get" you say.
113212121112122222211111111112121.title: Continue

1132121211121222222111111111121212.content:
Before you can even start throwing things together, a loud bell sounds. The sound startled and scared the living heck out of you, just one problem; it wasn't the class bell.

"That's the fire bell, everybody out!" the teacher called, "lets go lets go lets go!"

"Well that's not good" you saw, Melanie nods her head in agreement and begins heading for the door, there was already a crowd gathering and it was time to git while the getting was good. As you reached the door it was getting hard and harder to stay airborne, fur, scales, tails and more blocked your sides, sometimes the way up, and others the way down.

This wouldn't work.

ALSS detected the problem and immediately began to change itself. The wings on your back became shorter and more triangular shaped, a delta wing, though it was much lower than before, starting where your back did and not even reaching your shoulders. The boosters on the back of your legs expanded down to boot jets and the repulsers in your hands seemed to be getting more power.

This would work, more compact, more manueverable. Hands at your sides and palms down you pumped all the power you had into a dead vertical climb, arching over through a roll you headed along on the way out far overhead of the Anthros. But, you'd lost track of Melanie, probably giving her a heart attack; and no doubt digging your grave a couple miles deeper.

Eventually you reached the door outside, though you'd have to dive to get out without taking out the glass overhead of it. A swift roll dissipated much of your altitude and got you low enough to squeeze through, the second you reached the outside you climbed and hovered, looking for Melanie.

After what seemed an eternity, you spotted her in the grass past the parking lot, you made your way over to her going full speed ahead, after burners blazing away.
1132121211121222222111111111121212.title: Saved by the Bell

choices: "I...think the assembly is a good idea."
You stare up at Melanie and slowly shake your head, eyes wide.
1132121211121222222111111111122.content:
Melanie froze as she swung the door open, faced with about four or five adults. Her instant reaction was one of paranoia and fear, which was reasonable, considering it was your reaction, too. Both of you looked to Principal Tabbins for help on the matter.

As it turned out, she wasn't the one to speak up first. It was a rhino dressed in a police uniform. This only made you even MORE nervous. Had you broken some Anthro law you hadn't heard of? When had you done it? Were Anthros not allowed to touch you? Was everybody you've ever known here going to jail!?

"You're John, right?" he said, stepping forward. Because of the structure of his face, and the level Melanie was holding you at, you couldn't see his entire face - just his mouth. And it was pretty distracting.

"Y-yes, sir, I am," you squeaked, shivering. "...H-have I done something wrong?"

His mouth curled into a small smile and he gave a low chuckle. "Melanie, could you raise John up to where I can see him?"

Melanie gulped and nodded. "Yes, Mr. McRottie," she said in a shaky voice, lifting you up to where you could see his eyes. To your relief, he didn't look angry at all.

"Relax, both of you," he laughed lightly. "You aren't in trouble. We're here to talk about you and John. Specifically, how to make you both feel more safe here."

Now that you knew you weren't going to have to be a fugitive, you relaxed. Melanie did the same, subconsciously lowering her paw a bit which caused you to stumble.

"So what measures should we take, Mr. McRottie?" you asked.

He smiled at the use of his name. "Well, you've already done some of it, from what I saw in the lunchroom. Since you're much smaller than Anthros, it's easy for them to dismiss you as an object or lesser being." That caused you to frown a bit. You didn't like thinking about that, and it obviously made both you and Melanie uncomfortable.

"Which is why," he continued, "it's good that you've been making your own choices. You haven't allowed anyone except Melanie to pick you up without permission, and that's asserting the fact that you're equals."

"What I've been thinking of doing is having an official welcoming assembly," Principal Tabbins said from her desk. "Where we formally introduce you to the entire school, and answer the common questions. That way you might not be approached so fervently as the hall monitors have told me." She chuckled herself. "I've been hearing you two have been causing quite a roadblock with the crowd of students around you."

You looked up at Melanie. She was probably referring to that 'protective' formation Melanie, Jessie, Kim, and Brad had made around you.

"Alright..." Melanie said. "What do you think about the idea of an assembly, John...?" she asked, looking down at you.

One look in her eyes and you could tell she was nervous about the idea. You didn't know why, but you didn't dare point out her fear in front of everyone. What was she scared of...? It was just an assembly...in front of everyone in the school...with all their eyes focussed on

Suddenly you understood Melanie's issue because it became YOUR issue, too. That mental image haunted you...everyone staring straight at you...with a sort of distant curiosity...the way someone would look at a museum exhibit...
1132121211121222222111111111122.title: ...Officer, am I being detained?

choices: ...to warn you about an anti-human activist group in the area."
...to equip you with some protective measures!"
11321212111212222221111111111221.content:
You took a deep breath and thought about it. Sure, it was pants-wettingly terrifying thinking about being in front of literally everyone in the school. But it was for your greater good, and it might stop you from getting mobbed, and give you the chance to lay down some ground rules.

You look up at Principal Tabbins and give a slow nod. "...I...think the assembly would be a good idea."

Principal Tabbins smiled, and sat down at her desk. "Great! We can have one last period today, if you like."

That soon?! A pang of fear hits you, and you suddenly blurt out, "No!"

All motion in the room stopped, and your face turned red as it became painfully obvious everyone was staring at you. "Uhh...I...need time to think about what I'm going to say...to everyone..."

"Hmm...I suppose that's reasonable," the ocelot said with a nod. "Perhaps sometime tomorrow, then?"

You nodded. Crisis averted. "I just need some time, that's all." You looked up at Melanie. "WE need some time."

"Alright," Principal Tabbins said. "Come see me before school, and we'll arrange a time, alright?"

Melanie took a deep, shaky breath. You cringed - she didn't seem to like this idea... "Alright."

The room was silent for a moment. But then something occurred to you.

"Oh, uh, Mr. McRottie? Not to be offensive or anything, but...why are you here as a police officer?"

"Ah, yes, thank you for reminding me," the rhino said. "I'm here...
11321212111212222221111111111221.title: Procrastination!

113212121112122222211111111112212.content:
"Melanie, could you set John down on Principal Tabbins's desk, please?" Mr. McRottie asked, pointing to the desk. Melanie stepped forward, and set you down. Once again, you looked up at her. It was clear the idea of the assembly still hadn't left her mind, and you were pretty sure the two of you were going to have a very long talk afterwards about it. You gave her an apologetic shrug, and look up at Mr. McRottie.

The subject of extra protection piqued your interest. Y'know, because not dying is a nice thing to have. He reached into a pouch on his belt and pulled out two items, setting them out in front of you. One was a pair of boots with a strange curve on the heel. You frowned. They looked kind of feminine...but also somewhat familiar. The other was...a police uniform? You looked up at the rhino questioningly.

He pointed to the suit first. "This is to protect you from more unsavory types. It's made of similar stuff humans have in their police force, but tweaked for more force than bullets. So it won't withstand something like a human shooting you, but it'll keep you alive if someone squeezes you a little too hard, or pokes you with their claw with too much force."

You look up at Melanie and grin. "Oh, I can see this becoming very useful."

This didn't entirely relax her nervous disposition, but she did have a small smirk playing at her lips as she held back a sarcastic reply. "Go on, try it on."

You went to pick up the suit, and were instantly surprised by its

"Wait. This thing must weigh like forty pounds!" you protested. "How am I going to get around in this?"

Mr. McRottie let out another chuckle. "Trust me, you get used to it. But you're right, it's going to be hard to move around in. So only wear it in places where you feel you might be in danger."

You held the suit over your head and slipped it on. It sagged on your shoulders, and made you feel like you were chest deep in a pool of molasses. You tried to raise your arms, but couldn't get them past your shoulders.

Melanie giggled, bending down to look at you. "I'm going to have to get you started on a training regimen!" she purred, her tail flicking back and forth in amusement. "What do you think about that, John?"

"I'll only do it if you do," you said with a smirk. "Who knows? You might need it more than I do!" You crossed your arms...or tried. The restrictiveness of the suit meant it looked kind of stupid. Melanie laughed a bit.

It was at that moment you noticed you had something in the belt. Taking it out, your eyes widened.

"...You're giving me a taser?" you asked incredulously. "Isn't this...y'know, super dangerous?"

"To humans, it can hurt, yes," McRottie said. "But that kind is meant for anthros that get a little too frisky. It'll pack about as much force as a semi-strong bite. Just enough for them to drop you. I want you to use it conservatively, and responsibly, alright?" He looked at you seriously.

You nodded. "Cross my - wait a second, DROP me?! Isn't that even worse?!"

He laughed a bit. "That's where the boots come in," he said as you put the taser back and began taking off the vest. "First, put them on."

Walking over to the black and white boots, you studied them. They were more like braces, really. They were mostly white with black highlights, as well as a curved piece of what looked like plastic. You swore you recognized them from somewhere... You shook your head and slipped your foot inside. You frowned. The heel wasn't aligned with the ground, making you feel like you were wearing high heels. The curved piece bounced a bit, giving you a light agile feel. "What are these?" you asked as you slipped on the other boot.

"Those are Long-Fall boots," he said, snickering a bit. "Now, John, I want you to jump off the desk."

"...Excuse me?"

"Jump off the desk, please."

Melanie stepped forward. "M-Mr. McRottie, I don't think that'd be a good idea."

He let out another chuckle. "Those boots will protect you from a fall much higher than you'd normally be able to stand. As long as you land on your feet, those boots will absorb the brunt of the landing."

You gulped and looked over the edge of the desk. The floor seemed to expand below you, and you got an intense feeling of vertigo.

Suddenly you felt a poke to your back, and you gave a surprised yelp of fear as you plummeted off the side of the desk, careening towards the floor below. You faintly heard Melanie yelling in shock. Screaming yourself hoarse, you watched the ground soar up to meet you. You got ready to land, bracing yourself for unbearable pain...

With a shudder, the braces hit the ground, cushioning the impact. You planted your hand on the ground to lessen the momentum further out of instinct, and slowly got to your feet.

"John!" Melanie scooped you up and raised you to her face, giving you another helping of vertigo. "Are you alright?"

"Y-yeah, I'm...I'm fine," you said dizzily, holding your head. "Be a l-little gentler about the elevator ride up, though, mm'kay...?"

Her cheeks went red from embarrassment at that. "R-right...sorry..."

"The boots do have their limitations, of course," McRottie said. "They can't help you if you don't land on your feet. And of course, the higher up you fall from, the less the boots can help you. The braces are made of...some science-y stuff I can't remember the name of," he said, scowling as he tried to remember. Then he shook his head. "Point is, it's strong, so it won't break easily. I know because I tried to break it on suggestion of your human scientists. Couldn't do it."

You took the boots off. "...Did they have to make them like heels, though...?" you mumbled. "Well...thanks," you said, looking up at him. "These should really help, Mr. McRottie."

He smiled. "It's no problem. Now, off to class with the both of you."

"Yes, sir!" you both said, Melanie picking up your suit off of the desk as you stuffed the boots into your backpack as best they could fit. Melanie turned and walked out of the office, giving the both of them a wave.

"Well, it's off to Literature with Ms. Gotec," you said. You remembered the reaction Jessie, Kim, and Brad had given you when you said you had that class...and to be honest it didn't fill you with a lot of confidence. What was it going to be like...?
113212121112122222211111111112212.title: Aperture? Is that you?

choices: Oh, the suspense is killing you! (Surprise #2)
1132121211121222222111111111122121.content:
"So," Melanie said, not looking down at you choosing instead to concentrate on the hallway in front of her. "...An assembly, huh? Pretty exciting stuff."

You took a deep breath. "Okay, Melanie. I'll tell you my honest feelings and you tell me yours at the same time, okay?" She gave you a reluctant nod. "One...two...three."

"I'm terrified." "It's a bad idea."

You looked up at her in confusion. "Wait...so you aren't scared of going up in front of every single student in front of the school and introducing the sole human in this entire town to them?"

"Well, now I am!" Melanie exclaimed, gasping in fear. Then her shoulders relaxed and she let out a small sigh. "No, no, it isn't that. It's just...are you sure introducing yourself to the entire school is a good idea? That's a lot of people, and...not everyone here is entirely supportive of this diplomatic venture."

You frowned a bit. "...I didn't think of that. You'd think they'd send me to a school more supportive of this...are you sure that I'd be in danger about this?"

"Well, I mean..." Melanie stopped walking for a moment and leaned against a locker. "No, I don't think you're going to die, per se, but...I just think that it'd do more harm than good, that's all."

Thinking about this for a moment, you sat down on the pads of her paw. "I think we should be careful about what we say, yeah," you said slowly. "But I think this is something that needs to be done. We can't just go on pretending that I don't exist to half of everyone here, right? It's kinda counterproductive that way. We're supposed to integrate me into the community, right?"

"Yeah, you're right," Melanie said with a nod. Then she looked down at you and cracked a grin. "So, you're terrified, huh?"

"...Shoot, I thought you forgot about that," you mumbled.

Melanie laughed. "What, a couple thousand eyes the size of passenger cars staring at you freak you out a little bit?" she giggled, poking you with her paw.

"Please," you said, rolling your eyes. "Your eyes aren't the size of passenger cars - you aren't an anime character!"

"We should get to Ms. Gotec's," Melanie said, changing the subject. "That reaction the others had didn't exactly fill me with confidence..."

"Yeah...do you know what species she is?" you asked.

"I've heard that she's a pygmy goat," Melanie said slowly. "But usually the last names aren't THAT obvious."

"What do you mean?" you asked. "Like...Gotec? 'Goat'ec?"

Melanie laughed a bit. "Yeah, that. If my last name was a pun, I'd either change that, or my species!"

"Oh, come on. It can't be that bad."

Melanie raised you to her face. "What if your name was Hugh Mann?"

You couldn't help but cringe. "...Alright, you win this round."

She smiled victoriously, and began walking again, going up the stairs to the second floor. "So those boots look pretty good on you," she giggled. "Very flattering."

"Ugh, don't talk about those," you groaned, rolling your eyes. "Yes, they'll save my life, but is a life where I need to wear those a life worth living?"

"Asking the tough questions, I see!" Melanie laughed. "But truly, what is living if you aren't constantly wearing high-heeled science boots?"

You cracked a smile. "I guess you'll never know. You don't have access to such boots of science."

"Consider me jealous of your life-living ways," Melanie said.

Eventually Melanie arrived at the gigantic door to Ms. Gotec's room.

"Well...here she is...shall we?" Melanie looked down at you.
1132121211121222222111111111122121.title: ...Boots and Cats and Boots and Cats and...

choices: "I think I'll just chicken out on this one"
11321212111212222221111112.content:
"How about we uh....raise the stakes John" Melanie says with an evil grin on her face. She starts to lean over you with the same look and slowly taps her index finger paw on the desk

"Raise...the stakes...how?" you ask. Shaking in fear of what she could possibly be thinking of.

"Hmmm....well, how about..." She stops and thinks for a moment and scratches her head with the paw she used to tap the desk with. "How about.....I win this next round you be my personal servant for the week? Hehe" she said with an even more intimidating look on her face.

She was really starting to creep you out, so finally after staring in those sneering eyes for a minute you barely manage to make out "and if-if I w-w-win?"

"Well, why don't you make up something?" She asks, her face turning from evil to slightly confused. "But don't worry, its not like you WILL win, but don't worry I won't be too harsh on you when your my little servant boy". She giggles as her face turns back to its evil state.
11321212111212222221111112.title: ..."Hey John, you want to raise the stakes?...

113212121112122222212.content:
Black was a little bit more helpful for you as you were on the black side. Doing a little working out you realized that if Melanie was 5ft 6 in. and the chess board was still like this size to her, the queen and king would be a foot tall. You could barely see what move Melanie made, you could remember the 3-move-checkmate your dad had taught you when you were small...er.

"King pawn to D-5." You shout over the pawn. The Melanie's massive paw loomed over you for a few seconds then she picked up the pawn and moved it two spaces ahead. Now you could see in front of you, but not to the sides. Then you saw that her pawn was ahead of yours so you couldn't move it. She had moved some piece to your right, then you moved your Queen to D-2. Then Melanie realized what you were doing, this game didn't last long, Melanie had got you in checkmate after about 10 turns after she had realized your plan. When she had you in checkmate you were about to leave the board when a giant paw blocked your vision.

"Where'd you think you're going, isn't it that when you get the King in checkmate you have to knock him over?" She had a grin on her face which you didn't like, but then she decided to take pity on you. "I guess your tired, eh?" She lay down her paw for you to walk on, she then yawned. This knocked you about a bit, then she started looking around.

"What are we going to do as a bed for you?" She looked around then she gasped. "This'll be perfect!" She had a [choice] in her hand.
113212121112122222212.title: She is good at chess

choices: Math was fine, Something happens in Melanie's next class
1132121211121222222121.content:
"How about this shoe box?" Melanie held it up for you to see that it could work. "Ok melanie, but what about for a bed?" "hmm.... hold on a sec." At this she sets you on the bed with the shoe box and leaves the room. You observe the expanding landscape of a nicely smoothed bed sheet all around, apart from the shoe box that cut off your view of the nearest edge of the bed. 'This is my highschool life,' you think to yourself, 'being room mates with a giant tigress anthro.'

"Something on your mind?" The looming voice behind you causes you to jump up a little. "you really do scare easy," responds Melanie with a smile. "And you have the ability to sneak up on others without making a sound like most other big cats." " Big cat huh?" She kneels down and stares at you at eye level. " Was that a compliment or an insult?" She asks as her warm breath rolls over you. You hold your wits even though you are somewhat nervous in the back of you head screaming that this might not be a good idea, you stair back without filinching. "It's a compliment of course, i mean who in their right mind would ridicule some one as kind as you?" After making this coment she lefts her smile higher untill you can see her cleaming white teeth, yet you dont flinch.

"Thought so, and your starting to get over your verves and fear but your still a little mouse to me," she comments with a teasing note, "Any ways i brought you your bed. Take a look." It was a sponge with a felt clothe over it and another felt clothe ontop, one thing was for sure it would keep you warm on the cold nights. "Great, where should we put it now?" She looks around the says, " How about under the bed so no mid-night incedents occur." "Incedents?" you ask. She, somehow, turns a little pink from a blush and says, " I roll around in my sleep." "Oh..." is all you can say. She slowly sets your bed in the shoe box then picks you up and sets you in the box as well and sets you under the bed. "Good night," you call out and is responded with a "night..." You stip into your underwear and get into your sheets and close your eyes.....

"Come on ___________, time to get up." A strange yet familiar voice calls to you. There is a furry weight on you, kind of like the weight of an overgrown cat. You open your eyes to an expansion of orange and black fur leading up to that of an enormous face of a tigress anthro. You give a short yelp, and if not for her paw ontop of you, you might have fallen out of your bed.

"You forgot about yesturday? after all you went through," asks Melanie. You shake your head in agreement then pick your self up and hurridly get dressed into your cloths again. " We need to get you a couple more outfits," she states flattly. Thustly she lifts you and your backpack up and takes you down stairs.

From down stairs the aroma of breakfeast snakes up to your nose and it smells delicious. After a quick meal Melanie lifts you up again and curls her fingers around you, and pressing you into her pad. It's loose enough to not hurt you but tight enough to prevent you from sliding around as she runs to school.
1132121211121222222121.title: Spending the Night

11321212111212222221211.content:
There was a small assembly before Maths, but it was just about the schools code of conduct and how they should follow it. Maths was horrific though. There was a supply-teacher and 'his' name was Mr. Caninous (Can-ee-nous), he was a German Shepard he let anything happen in the class.

During the class, students would walk up to Melanie, poke her on the back, then another would prod you hard or knock you over...something like that. After about ten times, she wouldn't fall for it...at one point even Mr. Caninous tried to swipe at you (apparently due to your small size, you distract everyone else). Melanie growled at him a little...

The rest of Maths was very difficult, with sly comments coming from both the teacher and the students...you didn't like this at all, but wanted to lay low, so you'd ignore this and pay attention to what you were learning, which was nothing. Right after Maths, Melanie patted you on the head and said,

"Don't worry Jon, he is rarely here, and when he is, all the students absorb his carefree teaching style and do whatever they want...next time, I'll hit 'em for you." She joked, you laughed a little then looked on from Melanie's paw, you didn't see any students...were you late?
11321212111212222221211.title: Mr. Caninous

1132121211122.content:
You sit up in Melanie's paw and look where you are. You immediately see the second story windows of your house in front of you, and you are glad that you are home. It's kind of scary that Melanie is almost as tall as your house when she sits cross-legged, and you hope that Melanie doesn't try to enter what must be like a dollhouse to her.

The first thing you want to do is see your parents, so you ask Melanie where they are. "They're with my parents making dinner," she says, and points away from your house. You do not believe you had not noticed this before, but there are two other enormous tiger anthros in your backyard! One of them looks burly, and is barbecuing what smells like chicken on a truck sized grill. He must be tough if he is cooking without a shirt on. The other tiger is wearing a sweater and long tight jeans, and looks like she is chatting with two humans in her paw. You realize that those must be your parents, and this is confirmed when Melanie gets up and walks over to her mother.

"Mom, John woke up and wants to see his parents." Melanie brings her paw to her mother's which must be twice as big! You walk over to your parents and give them a big hug. You are a bit embarrassed that Melanie and her mother are watching, but you decide that it doesn't really matter right now.

"It's so good to see that you are alright!" exclaims your mother. "I'm just glad that there are anthros like Melanie's family that don't feel sore about people."

"You mean that Melanie's parents are also into the whole integration thing?" you ask. This time, the response comes from above.

"Yes, Zacharius and I are both fervent advocates for human-anthro integration," says the larger of the two tiger females.

"Oh, sorry John, we should introduce you. This is Mr. and Mrs. Prusten, Melanie's parents." Mrs. Prusten extends an index finger to you and you shake it.

"The pleasure is all mine, John," says the tiger. "Now, why don't we start dinner, I could eat a horse." You are itching to say that she could probably eat ten, but you don't want to be rude. Melanie extends her paw to you and beckons you on. After you step on the padded palm, you are lowered down to a checkered cloth that completely covers the backyard. There is a place set for you, thankfully human-sized, but right next to you is Melanie's place, which is in a size that suits her larger body. The burly male tiger serves the barbecue chicken, giving heaping portions to his family and relatively meager portions to yours. As you start eating, your parents and Melanie's parents start to talk about the integration project. It sounds a bit boring, but you might find out something interesting. On the other hand, you also want to get to know Melanie more. You decide to...
1132121211122.title: Barbecue

choices: "I really don't know, how about somthing else?
11321212111222.content:
While the adults talk, you try to carry on a conversation with Melanie.

"So...I have a question, please try not to take it the wrong way...ok Melanie?"

Melanie sorta smirks happily.

"Why sure, whats up John?" She asks.

"Um...uh, whats it like being you...uh...yout kind...no what. Uh..."

John couldn't stop studdering since it was such a hard question.

"John, relax...I'm very fond of these kind of questions. To be honest, theres not much a diffrence between our kind and yours. Besides the fact that we are animal based and have wacky mumbo-jumbo thats deep within our genetics."

Both them laughed at the same time.

"No no, not just that, but what about lifestyle? Besides school?"

Melanie looked at John and smiled

"Not much a diffrence there either, anthros have always been very high class to be honest. We actually take etiquite classes to assure we know how to act. We also, and you'll get sorta confused with this, will take a human respect class. This class was just mandated recently when the integration program started."

John was surprised that such a girl knew so much about this kind of stuff.

After a while, the adults where finished talking and John and Melanie had carried on a conversation like old friends.

"So, what do you want to do now?" Melanie asked

"Dunno, its only 6:30..." John sort of replyed as he looked at his watch

Thats when John saw his soccer ball laied against the back door to his house.

"Hey, Melanie, wanna play soccer?"
11321212111222.title: Alot in common

113212121112221.content:
You run across the picnic cloth to the soccer ball, excited that Melanie shares so many of your interests. You pick up the ball and head off to the side of your house. Melanie only needed to take a few steps to get from the backyard to the side yard, but she still looked eager to play with you.

There are two goals set up; you never bothered taking them down before. As you get ready to drop the ball and start playing, you remember that Melanie is still much taller than you. She could easily traverse anywhere on the field with one small step, and a single foot paw could easily block the entire goal! Melanie sees you hesitating, and immediately knows the problem. "Don't worry, John, I'll go easy on you."

You feel a bit insulted, since you are a pretty good soccer player, and never needed anyone to ease up, especially not a girl in a dress. You thank Melanie anyway, and drop the ball on the ground. You immediately kick the ball right into Melanie's ankle, which rebounds the soccer ball to the side. Running after the ball, you are about to hit it, but Melanie sweeps her foot slowly, drawing the ball way to the other side of the field. Lightly tapping the soccer ball with her toe, Melanie scores the first goal.

"Hey, I though you said you would go easy on me!" you shout up to your feline friend.

Melanie shrugged innocently. "I was. I could have sworn that humans could run faster than that. I guess that humans aren't even relatively as fast as us anthros. Oh, sorry, don't take that personally."

"It's okay, I won't," you reply, since she does make sense. Not only is she ten times taller than you; she must have the speed and strength of a tiger to boot. Even if she were the same size as you, she could probably beat you easily at soccer. You drop the ball again, and this time you kick at an angle to not hit Melanie's foot. You run after the ball and Melanie's other foot descends between the path from the ball to the goal, so you feint a kick to the side. As Melanie starts lifting her foot, you score the second goal.

"Hey, your pretty good for a human!" says the giant tigress. You nod, but you can tell that she was letting you have that goal. Now it was Melanie's turn, and this time she was going to impress you with her footwork. Even though the ball was much smaller than what she must have been used to, she still could kick it between her feet deftly and quickly. You are running back and forth between her hind paws as they pass the ball back and forth. Finally, you intercept the ball and kick for the goal, but Melanie blocks the ball quite unexpectedly with her striped tail. Melanie then easily scores another goal.

You continue having fun with Melanie for a long time, even after the sun sets. Melanie lets you win, but also shows off amazing physical ability. Eventually, you grow tired, even though Melanie never even broke a sweat. "I guess its about time to get ready for bed now," you tell your friend, and she replies by picking up the soccer ball and dropping it back by the side of the house. "Um, do you have a place to sleep, because I don't think you'll fit ..."

"Don't worry about me, John, my family brought sleeping bags. Why don't you go inside and I'll just see you in the morning?" You decide to do what your friend suggests and enter your house, where you brush your teeth and put on some pajamas. As you start to get into your bed, you can't help but feel sorry for Melanie, who has to sleep outside like a human's housecat. You wonder if you could do anything to cheer her up, since she has been so nice to you, and even pretty much saved your life today...
113212121112221.title: Mismatched

choices: Let Melanie talk about Sandy and Bronc
Tell Dr. Tabbins that you can pick without a description

"Ok that is fine", Dr. Tabbins said. Melanie looked a little disappointed, but she didn't say anything to object.

"Let's see.... where did I put the names....." The principal searched through cluttered papers to until he found a small piece of paper with two names on it. "Two students have the same schedule as you. Their names are Sandy Shetland and Bronc Magpie. I understand that they are in the same grade as Melanie here, so she can tell you more about them"

You......
11321212112.title: Arrange something wit another student in your c...

choices: ...you meet another kid, who is also headed to his or her desk
11322.content:
You glance up at the 50 foot tall moose boy who stares down at your four-and-a-hall foot tall figure. Being an eleven year old in what is basically sixth grade, the first year of middle/junior high school would be bad enough when dealing with humans a little bigger than you, but the idea of dealing with animals a good ten times your size is quite another matter. Even the smaller ones are intimidating; the moose boy, however, is long and lanky and seems to weigh a thousand times more than you do.

You stammer, "Uh, no I'm--I mean y-yes, these stairs are too steep for me."

"That little dude could fit in my backpack!," laughs a fox as he heads past you.

"Humans!," smirks the moose, who gives a big pat to the fox's back. "Ya gotta feel sorry for them, huh?
See you in science later, Vulpi." He turns back to you. "Well, I can--whoa!"

Suddenly the moose grabs you and pulls you away and you see a fleeting image of brown fur running past.
A steady thump! thump! thump! goes up the stairs, and you look down and see huge brown paws running up the stairs. "I'm gonna be late, gangway!," comes the voice. You realize it's a huge eighth-grade bear, and the fact that the moose pulled you aside means that you weren't crushed by him!

The moose sighs. "Why they put these humans here, when they're far too small, I don't know! Well, whatever your name is, I'll help ya." He pulls you up and hold you tight to his chest; you are carried up the rest of the stairs and then deposited on the floor at the top of the stairs. Your puny sneakers are almost crushed by the passing paws of giant animals, and you retreat to the side of the hallway so you don't collide with them.

"I'm John!," you quickly say to him. "Thanks!"
"Moosalamoo," he replies. "No problem little guy."

Next you enter the classroom and climb up on an immense desk to look up at a blackboard which tells you what your seat will be:
Third row, third seat back. A 48 foot tall raccoon arrives and looks at the board: Fourth row,
third seat back, is the assignment he gets. He looks down at you. "Hey! Sure you're in the right place?
You're a bit little for this school...though you look like you're our age..."

"I am--I'm 11..."
"I'm 12. Well, I can't help it if you humans are on the short side." You look up at him--a masked bandit face on top, with an orange T-shirt and blue jean shorts underneath; a ringed tail protrudes from his back. His paws
on the floor are each longer than you are tall.

"Good to meet ya--uh, no offense but I kinda wish they sent me to a human school. You guys are too big."

"Well, you're here now, buddy, but I'll look out for ya. I'm Procione."

"Hey there, I'm John," you say, shaking his immense paw. You feel his paws then reach around to place you back on the floor and you look up at him. Even his knees are a good 12 to 14 feet up. Now you each head to your desks and...
11322.title: Pulled up the stairs

choices: strike up a conversation with the raccoon, as both of you head to the next class
try to quickly make it out of the room before the huge animals cause you pain
113221.content:
The teacher, a 62 foot tall fox, enters the room as looks at the various students heading to their desks. They are all roughly the average size for animals who are 11 or 12 years old, ranging from 45 to 52 feet tall, with one notable exception--you. The raccoon, Procione, places you on top of your desk and you suddenly become aware that the teacher has stopped by to visit you.

"Well...we have a human this year. Do you know what I think about humans?"

You gulp, worried about what he will say. "W-what?"

He smiled. "They're wonderful. Why, I had a human as a roommate in college. Fun little dude. We looked
out for each other. I'm sure he's a success, wherever he is these days. I feel sorry you're so small, though."

You nod. "A bear almost ran me over trying to get up the stairs--"

"Oh dear. Tall, chubby? A bit oafish?"

"Yes."

"That would be Irssa. He was in this class last year. Tended to run late and almost ran down some students trying to get here on time."

A female student, a tigress, looks over at you. "Hey, you're cute lil' fella."

You blush and say thank you to her.

"Yeah, you'd make a good pet!," she laughs.
The teacher looks over at her sternly.

"Now really!"

The tigress' twin brother comes forward and jokes, "Hey, I love humans...they're delicious!"

Several of the animals crack up. Even the teacher is smiling a little bit.

"All right, all right, class...verrrry funny. But seriously, I want you to treat him--and everyone else
in this class--with respect."

The tiger goes up to you; he towers over you and eyes you with suspicion for a moment but then
smiles. He gives you a friendly pat on the back. "It's OK, lil' dude, I'm just joking." Then he licks
his lips for the heck of it. You laugh nervously.

The teacher heads back to his desk and is about to distribute the books when suddenly there's a knock on
the door.

"Come in," says the fox. A tall, chubby bear opens the door (almost breaking it off the hinges in the
process) and says quickly, "Sorry, sorry but did I leave my book bag in this..."

Procione spots it and hands it over to the clumsy bear. "Here you go. Listen...you gotta be careful
when you go up the stairs," the raccoon tells the bear. "You almost ran over my lil' friend here,
the human...John."

The bear walks over to you and bows, then smiles awkwardly down at you. "I'll be careful, little guy."

Then he exits and you focus on the wonderful world of mathematics. As the class ends you...
113221.title: ...you meet the teacher

choices: a group of giant animals walking over toward you with smirks on their faces
the fox who teaches Math walking over to say hi to you
1132211.content:
"I have music next," says Procione.
"Me too," you reply.

"So...they were saying you're the first human here. They want us to help you out and be friends. Of
course, not everyone is gonna like you..."

You sigh. "Yes, some animals are just gonna be that way, I guess. We can't help being small and having no
fur. I'm glad you looked out for me in there, though."

"No prob. Hey, I feel bad you have to put up with that kinda stuff and it's really nothing for me to help."

You look around at the animals passing by, who give the raccoon a dirty look--since Procione is carrying you
pressed up to his chest, holding you firmly with his right paw. One of them asks if it's a doll and then
shudders when he notices that the 'doll' is alive.

"Ooh, a human...they carry diseases. Get it away."

"Humans taste good with ketchup, or maybe mustard sauce," volunteers one wolf, in jest. (You think.)

"I think the music class is in here," says Procione, carrying you inside. There are various instruments as well as computers which will help each student practice his or her instrument. A 60 foot raccoon enters--the teacher.

"Tell me," you ask Procione as you both sit down, "that teacher in Math said he had a human for a college
roommate. I thought we didn't really mingle in the past."

"We haven't but maybe that human was a gifted student or somethin' and got sent to the university."

"Well, it looks like we have a human--the one and only human here--amongst us," says the raccoon teacher,
walking toward you. Procione seemed gigantic to begin with but the teacher is even more titanic, but he
appears friendly and you relax a bit.

"Yes, sir; I am John Nesbitt from Earth and this is Procione Irnsbo."

He shakes your paws--er, hands. "I don't want to sound like a species-ist," the teacher says, "but we
raccoons can make pretty good musicians. I hope you Earth humans can do the same."

"Oh, we have some very talented human musicians," you tell him. "We have rock bands like U2 and
Coldplay and years ago there was a very good group called the Beatles, and we have all kinds of
different types of music."

The adult raccoon nods. "Instrument?"

"Uh, a little piano."

"'Little' is right," laughs the teacher, reaching over to find an electric piano scaled down to your size. In fact it
was transported from Earth. "How many years have you trained?"

"A couple," you reply.

"And you, Procione?"

"I play guitar," he says, and the teacher reaches over and takes out a colossal acoustic guitar.

Some other students enter the room, including a tall and strong lion.

"Is that a toy of some sort? A robot who can play the piano?"

"That," replies the teacher, "is a human from Earth named John and I want you to treat his as you would
any other fur."

The lion looks down at you and gives a deep laugh. You see his fang like teeth far above you and hope
to heck you don't get on his bad side.

After another hour or so, it's time for lunch period and you and your new friend head off to the cafeteria.
He says hello to some other students but they don't seem to want to sit at a table with him. Instead,
he finds a table and places you on top of it.
