114.content:
"There's no sense pouting about it, Wes. You're going to Tailwind High, and that's final!"

Your dad's voice boomed from the driver's seat of the family minivan. A mix of emotions filled your head: anger, nervousness, disgust, and, you had to admit, curiosity, just to name a few.

You were on the way to be dropped off for your first day at Tailwind High School, a hundred and fifty miles from your home. It was the first day of your freshman year, and while all your friends from middle school were heading to East Jefferson High back in your hometown, your parents, liberal activists that they were, just had to enroll you in the new exchange student program between the schools. It was an idea that you hated; not only were you going to be in the middle of a group of giant anthros, not only were you not going to be able to see your friends until fall break at the earliest, but you were going to be the only human for miles. It was an idea that didn't sit well with you.

"Don't worry about it, hon," your mom said from the passenger seat. "All your stuff from home has already been sent to your host family's house, and we sent them a recipe book with your favorite foods. It'll be just like back home. We'll be sure to email you often and be up to visit for family weekend in a month. It won't be so bad."

You sigh and stare out the window. So far, the streets had been pretty empty, only seeing the occasional feet of a giant anthro passing by. You didn't quite know what to expect, but you knew that it was going to be a tough freshman year.

Finally, the van pulled up to a massive building that looked to be ten stories tall and as wide and long as the Pentagon. You knew that Tailwind was a fairly small school, as anthro schools went, with only about one hundred students across the four grades, but that didn't make the enormity of it all compared to you any easier. The van stopped, your dad jumped out and opened the door for you. You hesitated to jump out. Was this really the best way to start your high school career?

"C'mon, slugger," your dad said (you hated it when he called you that, as you haven't played baseball or any sports since elementary school). "Let's get moving."

You grudgingly unbuckled your seatbelt and stepped out of the car, backpack in hand. Your dad gave you a pat on the shoulder, and said, "You show those Anthros what humans are made of! Make us proud!"

Your mom had gotten out of the car and ran around, throwing her arms around in a tight embrace. "Ohh, my little Wes, how proud we both are of you! You're going to be doing something nobody else has ever done, honey," she said as she planted a kiss on your cheek. "Stay safe, and let us know if you need anything."

With that, your parents both jumped back into the van and pulled away. You watched as the van disappeared into the distance, back towards human civilization and everything that was familiar to you. It took all your strength to fight back the tears that were beginning to form in your eyes.

You turned around and looked at the large building and the grounds that surrounded it. Classes had already started; the school administration felt it best that you arrive after all the other students were safely inside, at least for the first day. You took a deep breath and headed inside.

Once inside, you looked at the map of the building that the school had so helpfully provided for you. You needed to head to the principal's office, which luckily was right next to the entrance you had come in at, though it still was somewhat of a long walk for you. Pushing open the door with all your might, you stepped into the office.

Waiting for you there, sitting behind a large mahogany desk, was the principal, the only anthro you ever really had talked to before, back a couple of weeks ago when this whole idea was first being discussed. He was a tall, svelte, bespectacled ocelot named Jacques, who was well dressed and looked like he was overflowing with confidence. Looking up from the papers he was reading, he noticed you, smiled, and said, "Ah, Wesley, welcome to Tailwind! How was your trip?"

"Okay, I guess," you said. "A little long."

"Well, we're really glad to have you here, believe me." He stood up and walked over to you, each step causing the ground around you to shake slightly. When he got right in front of you, he leaned over and stuck out his massive paw, with the palm facing up. You couldn't help but notice that his claws, which were retracted, could easily impale you in the blink of an eye. You gulped, and stuck out your hand, grasping one of his fingers and offering a quick shake.

Jacques chuckled, shaking his head, "Well, yes, we can shake hands, I guess, but I was actually thinking you might want to...how should I put this?...be a little closer to my eye level. Would you like me to lift you up on to my desk?"

You nodded, and stepped forward onto his paw. "Hang on tightly, now," Jacques said as he slowly started lifting up his paw into the air. You grabbed on as tightly as possible so as not to loose your balance. After a few short, scary seconds, he brought his paw to the desk, and you quickly jumped off.

"Thank you," you said, a little shaken.

"Your welcome,' Jacques said as he sat back down at his desk. "Okay, let's get down to business. You already know your class schedule and have your books, I presume?"

"Yes, it was all in the packet you sent," you said, still trying to catch your breath.

"Excellent. Then the only thing I have left to do is to introduce you to your partner for this year."

"Partner?" you asked, confused. You didn't remember hearing anything about a partner.

"Oh, yes, I guess we never told you." Jacques peered down through his glasses at a sheet of paper. "The host family you're staying with also has a child your age who is just starting at Tailwind as well. Your parents and I thought it would only be proper to have you paired up, at least for the beginning of the year, so you could get better acquainted with how our schools work."

"Oh, okay," you said, again growing slightly nervous. It would be nice to have someone to help you get accustomed to all this weirdness, but something felt slightly off about the whole situation. "Well, who is it?"

Jacques pressed down on an intercom, and said into it, "Okay, come on in." From the opposite end of the office from where you came in, another door opened. You spun around. "Wesley, I would like you to meet..."
114.title: High School

1141.content:
"...Nolan Westfield." In through the door walked a fox, standing nearly fifty feet tall; not nearly as tall as Jacques was, but still big enough to pick up Wes without any problem. The fox had a slender build and clean, smooth bright red-orange fur. White spots dotted his face, and his sharp green eyes were lined by a rim of black fur, which made them look very deep and brooding, and were partially hidden by a tuft of fur that seemed to grew down from his head. Nolan was dressed in a half-tucked-in white button-up shirt with the top three buttons open, revealing the brilliant white fur of his chest, a dark brown jacket, and a pair of tight-fitting dark blue jeans. Wes also noticed the dark black fur around his paws which looked a little like gloves (or boots, in the case of the feet), but was all-natural.

Nolan stood in front of Jacques and Wes, visibly nervous, clutching his arm with his paw. "Wow," Wes thought, "maybe he's as scared as I am about this whole mess."

"Nolan, I'd like you to meet Wes Schafer," Jacques said, gesturing towards you. "He is the one you've heard so much about; he'll be living with you for the next year."

Nolan gave a little wave. "Hello, there," he said, his voice slightly cracking. He looked away, embarrassed.

"Hi," Wes said, waving back. "Nice to meet you." There was something about this Nolan. Wes wasn't sure what it was, but he knew that he was going to like this mysterious fox.

"Now, boys, we've made sure that your class schedules for the year are exactly the same, so Nolan, you'll be responsible for making sure Wes gets where he needs to go at first. Understood?"

Nolan nodded, and reached his paw out. "Would you... would you like to ride in my pocket? I've, uh, tried to make it extra comfortable for you."

For the second time in just a few minutes, you jumped on a large paw and held on tight. You expected Nolan's fur to be harsh and abrasive, like the fur of foxes you'd touched back home, but it was surprisingly soft. Nolan must take excellent care of himself, you thought. He lifted you up and placed you in the highest pocket of his jacket, which, sure enough, had some extra cotton packed into it so it was soft and so you could stand and see out of it. You looked over the edge, peeking down at the ground below. It wasn't until just then that the scale of the situation truly dawned on you.

"Okay, boys," Jacques said, "Have a great year at Tailwind High. And if there's anything that I or my staff could do for you, don't hesitate to ask."

With that, Nolan turned away, and walked out of the office. As he headed down the empty halls, Nolan let out a sigh of relief. "Man, I'm glad to be out of there," he said. "I don't know what it is, but being in that office always makes me freak out."

"Well, Jacques seems like a nice enough guy," you said.

"He is, I guess," Nolan says, shrugging, which jostled you slightly. "I guess it's just the power of it all. I always feel like I'm in trouble, no matter what I'm in there for."

"Yeah, I can understand that," you said.

Suddenly, you heard a loud ringing sound fill the halls. The doors to the classrooms flew open, and students began exiting into the hall. "Homeroom's over," Nolan said. "Time for first period."

You pulled out the schedule from your pocket, trying to remember what first period was. As you opened it, you saw that it was going to be...

114111.content:
You and Nolan went to the algebra class. While going there, you passed a few anthros. Some of them gave a genuine smile, but some shot some dirty looks or glares that sends chills up your spine. When you came into the classroom, the smell of papers attacks your senses. Nolan notices your reaction and asked, "What's wrong Wes? The smell of math too much for you?"."Yeah, what happened in here? In my old school, I am on advanced Math/Algebra lessons but I had never known math can create such an odour."

Nolan laughed, "I know right, the teacher really hates our scores last year and kept putting posters of the lesson topic all over the walls. The paint and papers create this smell. We all got used to it though." It's then when you noticed what looked like hundreds of posters of geometry, algebra, and graphs all over half the white walls of the class. But these posters are as tall houses and as wide as cars. "You guys call this the smell of math?" "Yeah, we called it that as a joke," Nolan answered.

The algebra teacher, an anthro fox teacher with thin glasses, came in, "Hello everyone, my name is Ms.Kiren and I am your algebra teacher for this year." Nolan whispers to you, "By the way, that's my mother. She just joined this school last year." "That would explain why you two look alike.", you whispered back. "As most of you might've noticed, today we have the arrival of a new special student for this school. Welcome to your first class in Tailwind High, Wes Schafer." You added a cheerful wave back to the other students."Now I want you all to treat him and everyone else in this classroom with respect."

"Today, we are going to learn about algebraic expressions and how do we use them in our daily lives. But before we start, why don't we ask Mr.Schafer here as the new student to find out what humans had learned in algebra for the past school years." You were surprised that they were learning algebraic expressions at this year as you learnt it 2 years ago. You answered back, "Well, we've learnt this 2 years ago and last year we were doing the laws of indices and a few others." "Wow! that's what we are going to learn next year! As all of you can see or probably hear, humans' education exceeds ours by 2 years in math. Now I'm sorry to say that we had to make this like a review for you Mr.Schafer, as there are other students I need to teach here." You think of this and you thought it wouldn't be such a burden as your future plans didn't have anything to do with mathematics. "Ohh it's ok, I won't mind."

Moving on to the class, Ms.Kiren addresses you as her class assistant and while the class is going, Nolan managed to sneak an introduction to his best friend next to you, Kala, a female grey wolf anthro.

After the bell rang, you and Nolan checked the schedule for today and found out the next period is...
114111.title: Simple algebra class.

11412.content:
"Alright!" you said aloud, "Geography! That was always a piece of cake for me."

"Really?" Nolan said, "I could never get the hang of it. All those weird places' names to keep track of, and every year something changes. You'll have to help me study." Nolan looks down at you, with a slight smile to his face. You grin, and nod.

As Nolan walked towards the classroom, you looked around. Everywhere you looked you saw anthros, all huge, and all different kinds. There were some reptilian ones, some avian ones, and of course plenty of mammalian ones. What was weirder was that every different type of personality seemed to be represented too. There were jocks, nerds, cheerleaders, stoners, and theater kids. You chuckled, as you thought to yourself, "Maybe Tailwind won't be so different after all."

Finally, the two of you made it to the classroom. Nolan sat down at a desk near the middle of the room, and he picked you up out of his pocket and sat you down on his desk. On it, there was a smaller desk, one scaled just for your size. Sitting next to it was a megaphone; you guessed that was to help everyone hear you whenever you spoke to the class as a whole. You put your book bag underneath the desk, and pulled out a notebook, ready to get this whole ordeal started.

As the rest of the class poured in, you noticed that it was a much smaller amount of students than you normally had in your school. You looked back and saw there were only seven desks (counting yours) in the room. You figured that, with a smaller school, they could afford to have much more detailed instructions. A couple of jockish-type students sat down in the back; one was a muscular mustang wearing a jersey-style shirt and tight black shorts, the other was what looked to be a large, muscular iguana, but at his size he looked closer to a dinosaur to you, who was wearing a black sleeveless t-shirt and khaki shorts. Sitting in the other corner of the back row was a female bear, with a slightly rotund figure and a too-tight t-shirt and skirt.

A few moments later, the seats next to you had been filled. You looked to your left to see a tall, lanky-looking giraffe, wearing a blue-polo shirt and glasses. He looked towards you, and his eyes lit up. Leaning over, he said, "Hey, you must be that human we've all been hearing about!" His voice was very squeaky and nasal sounding. You quickly surmised that this giraffe was one of the nerds of the school. "My name's Wendall. What's yours?"

"Wes," you said, as you secretly hoped he would go back over to his own desk.

"Nice to finally see you. Wow," Wendall said to Nolan as he put his hoof over Wes's head, "he's a lot tinier than I thought he would be."

"Alright, Wendall," Nolan said, chuckling as he gently pushed him away, "don't spaz out."

You shake your head as you turn to look at the seat to the other side of you, where you saw a sharply-dressed female wolf sit down. She turned to you, smiled, and waved. "Hi, there," she said as you waved back. "Nolan, he sure is cute, isn't he?"

Nolan started to blush slightly, as his tail suddenly began to twitch involuntarily. "Uh, Wes, meet Kala, my best friend."

Wes nodded, and Kala leaned down closely to whisper at him, though with as close as she get, he nearly got knocked over by the gust of wind that was her breath. "Take good care of Nolan this year, and he'll take good care of you." She winked at you and then turned back to face the front of the class.

"What was that all about?" you called up to Nolan.

"I'll, uh, tell you about it later," he said as the teacher walked into the room. The teacher was much taller than any of the anthros Wes had yet seen, his head nearly brushing the ceiling. He was a majestic-looking bald eagle, and he looked to be on the older side, though still with enough energy and strength to handle teaching high school. He was wearing a blue sweater vest with a shirt and tie underneath, and brown corduroy pants. The teacher sat his briefcase down on his desk, ruffled a few papers, then stood in front of the class and addressed the students.

"Good morning class, I'm Dr. Kingston. Yes, that's right: Dr. I do have a PhD, and I didn't go through all those years of schooling to have people call me 'Mr.' Now I don't know how the rest of the teachers handle their classes, but in here, you will learn, and you will learn a lot. My goal is that every one of you at the end of the year will know all there is to know about geography, both in the anthro and in the human world."

"Human geography?" the mustang called from the back. "Why would we need to know that?"

Dr. Kingston looked down at a paper on his desk. "Mr. Chad Parker, I take it? Let me tell you why you need to know that. Have you heard of the state of Colorado, in the country called the United States?"

Chad shrugged. "Maybe. What about it?"

Dr. Kingston was now pacing around the room. "Well, did you know that in that one state alone, there rests enough nuclear weaponry to wipe out all the anthro cities in the world twice over?"

Chad gulped. "I--I guess--"

"No, you didn't, Mr. Parker!" Dr. Kingston said, now standing in front of Chad's desk. He brought his wings down forcibly onto the desk, causing a loud BANGing sound. "Most anthros don't know that human technology outpaces our own by a ten-to-one margin. And if you are to become a leader in our society, that lack of knowledge could prove fatal." Dr. Kingston circled his way back to the front of the room. "Now, I don't mean to say that humans are a threat to us; far from it. In fact, the threat is not from the humans themselves, but from our ignorance of their world. It is to that end that our school has agreed to host the first of what I hope to be many exchange students from the nearest human community. Class, meet Wes Schafer."

He gestured towards you, and you sheepishly stood up, turned around and faced the class. After the speech that Dr. Kingston just gave, you weren't sure how to respond, so you just gave a cheesy little wave.

"Wes will be learning with us this year, and one of our own students has gone to his school to learn as well." God, you had forgotten about that. You weren't sure how your school would even be able to adapt to one of these massive creatures. "Nolan will be helping him get acquainted with our culture, so don't be too hard on either of them."

You sigh as you sit back down. You could feel the eyes of everyone staring at you, and you didn't know what to do. Now, you realized, you weren't just a new student in a strange school; you were an ambassador for the entire human race. At this point, you couldn't wait for this year to get over.
11412.title: Geography

1142.content:
"I would like you to meet Valerie" said Jacques.

A female tiger anthro entered the room. You could tell it was female, no doubt about it. Her wide hips, thin waist, and large breasts gave it away. Like most tigers, her fur was orange with black stripes. Her face had four large stripes on it. She had yellow eyes with the slotted pupil as well as many cats do. She wore glasses; not the nerdy kind, the kind that made you look really good. She wore a bright pink shirt that hung slightly over one of her shoulders. The shirt had a black heart in the middle of it. The jeans she wore seemed tight, the style most girls always wore. She seemed as calm as can be.

"You called me in sir?" asked Valerie.

"Valerie, this is Wesley" explained Jacques. "He is the human that is moving in with your family for the year. We thought that it would be in the best of things if you helped him out the first few couple of days."

"That sounds alright."

Valerie walked up and stretched out her paw to Wesley. Wesley noticed that not only does Valerie have retractable claws, but hers are much longer. But thankfully they were retracted. Wesley gently grabbed one of her fingers and shook it.

"It's a pleasure to meet you" she said.

"Me too" Wesley said still pretty frightened.

"Oh come now, do you think I would hurt you? I don't think your parents or my parents would be happy if their son was killed. Don't worry, I will not harm you."

Wesley nodded and decided to take her word for it, not like he had much of a chance. Jacques gave a good luck speech but Valerie left without him finishing it all. Wesley was being held in her paw. He still couldn't believe how attractive she is, even for an anthro. She looked down and spoke, "Since I was supposed to help you, you are in all of my classes."

"Makes since" said Wesley, "Which class are we in now?"

"but first can we go to the caf i haven't eaten in a hour!" he puts you on his shoulder and runs like the wind. as you go down the halls you find that zenth is very popular wonder why. you come to two giant doors and zenith rushes in side grabs a giant to him tray and eats like theres no tomorrow! when he eats a lot of girls watch him dreamily, again why is he so popular? all he is doing is eating. but theirs another thing thats weird all the male anthros are ultra plus size, while all he girls eat crumbs whats with that? your thoughts are interrupted when you hear the rip of zenth's muscle shirt and the sight of one fat dragon belly. when zenth is done with his 6 ton meal his belly is bulging out ward but is still soft and flabby. mot noticing the lack of shirt he says...
1242.title: a chubby dragon guy named Zenth

choices: we need to set up accomodations for your small height."
we wanted you to meet and get used to your roomate."
125.content:
You can see the huge campus in the distance. It would be very hard to miss: the entire campus is larger than the city you were born in. You are very excited that you were chosen to be the representative human for the giant anthro/human integration project. While your friends in high school would often tell stories of how anthros used to destroy human cities for fun, you always believed that giant anthros are just like humans, only bigger and shaped a bit differently. You have seen anthros from time to time, but this will be the first time you will actually meet one.

As you approach the humongous parking lot, you notice that it is for the most part empty, resembling a vast desert covered in thick yellow lines. Well, classes still do not start for a few days, and you were told to arrive one day before the other students, though you were not told why.

Up ahead, standing before the entrance to the school, you see a humongous ocelot waving you towards him. You turn the car around, and drive up until his giant paws completely fill your field of vision. You are suddenly nervous; you were not expecting the anthros to be this huge. You suddenly panic when the car lurches upward; looking to your side you see a giant pink paw pad completely covering the window. Worried that the window will break, you roll it down. Now you can see a friendly face with slit-pupiled eyes smiling in front of your car.

"Welcom to Fangburg U, Lester Smith!" the ocelot growls. You can tell that the big cat is trying to be as unfrightening as possible. You notice that a large pointy claw is sticking right outside your window, so you try to be friendly and give the ocelot an awkward handshake.

"Well, Lester, I am proud to have a human at my school, and I wish you a great four years here! Now, you may be wondering why you were asked to come a day early. This is because...
125.title: Fangburg U

1252.content: You loom to see where your roomate is, although it would be hard to miss. When you turn around, you see your roomie, who is a
1252.title: Anthro Roomie

choices: He keeps you and figures something else out
12521.content:
Over 600 feet of scales, muscle, and teeth come stomping over. The huge gator anthro starts to apologize to the Head administrator, but stops when he spots you. An exceptionally wide grin spreads across his long snout, razor teeth size of your car - or bigger - on full display.
"wow, so you're the human, huh?" he rushes over with an excited gleam and his bright yellow eyes. His massive nose overtakes your field of vision, sooner placed by his giant eye as he examines you up close. " wow, you're so tiny. I mean, I knew you'd be small, but just... Wow."
Doubtless he would have continued to invade your limited personal space, had the administrator not move you and your car back a bit. " come now, give the young man some space, Garth. If you can't mind your manners, then I'll have to ask someone else to help out mr. Smith here."
The gator, Garth, looked distraught at the idea. " wha- noooo!" he practically wines. " look, sir, I swear, I'll behave. I just got a little over-excited is all. Ya know how much I like humans, it's why you chose me to be his roommate. I promise, I won't go overboard, I'll be nice and gentle with the little guy." he almost sounds like little kid asking his parent to let him a new pet. You aren't sure you like this situation and hope that the administrator will choose someone else.
12521.title: gator anthro.

choices: Garth drops the nice act and reveals his true opinion of humans
125211.content: But before you knew it, you and the car are heading back to the overly dramatic carnivore. " alright, Garth, just be careful. Remember, humans are very fragile. You must always think before you act around them, or it could get them killed." and with that, the administrator sets your car down on Garth's outstretched, scaly hand, is Long Claws curling up around the sides. "Lester, you needn't worry about a thing. Garth maybe a bit..." the administrator cast he glanced at the beaming gator as he searched for the right word, " enthusiastic... But is one of the most human friendly students on campus and I would trust no one more to see to your safe and easy transition into our school." gave one last smile, which you did not return, before excusing himself and leaving you two Alone Together.
125211.title: He gives you to Garth

choices: Garth makes you get out of the car
1252111.content:
You say you were concerned would be an understatement. This gator was big even compared to other anthros, and he seemed way too friendly to be safe with such a drastic size difference. As he continued to quietly observe you in his palm, that big, toothy smile never leaving is scaly face, you are reluctant to risk leaving your car. True, it's not really going to keep you any safer then if you were out in the open, but you were content for the moment to remain in your false sense of security.
" hey, little guy," Garth finally spoke, apparently tired of waiting for you to do something, " you gonna to come out or what? Kinda hard to get properly acquainted with ya stuck away in there." a huge claw from his other hand comes up and taps at the side of your car, gently rocking it.
So much for being excited to meet giant anthros, you're Frozen in Terror after seeing that massive claw come so close, so fast. You just couldn't get over the size, one wrong move and you were dead. That said, it was a little surprising how little the car had been affected by that tap; it may have rocked a little, but besides that it was fine.
You debate for a few moments longer about what you should do. Garth seems pretty nice, should you get out of the car and properly introduce yourself to your apparent roommate?
1252111.title: Garth continues to be nice

choices: a little assortment of furniture made especially for you
12522.content:
When you turn around you notice a huge brown wolf. He seemed to have a friendly face. When he smiled you could see his huge teeth which scared you as much as when the car was picked up. Your car was placed down back into the baron car park. You opened the door and walked out. It looked like your room mate was at least a mile or so away. the steps were huge and fast. This scared you a lot when you were smaller than the soul on his boots. Your heart was beating very fast and you were sweating a bit...

"No worries Lester, I won't hurt you, by the way my name's Jack. I know that this must be daunting for you, I will look after you and keep any hostile anthros away." He said, you looked up at him while he smiled, friendly, down at you. Then he knelt down and offered a huge paw for you to climb upon.

"F...f...Thanks." You squeak. You don't realize that you're shaking until you sit in the palm and the Jack starts walking. You wonder if they have prepared anything for you...or if its just a rush.

This question is answered when you reach the room you'll be staying in. When you are escorted in there is Jack's bed, wardrobe, mirror and many other things...and for you there's...
12522.title: Jack

choices: Strait, maby even bi who knows
125222.content: You look and see a small matris, closet, computer, desk, a small bath tub, and even a refigerator. All coniviently placed on his dresser. "wow! how did you get this stuff." you ask. "Well about a smester ago when we heard that you were coming, we placed a order to the human world and I plaiced it here with extreme caution, It was like building a modle ship! So are you going to bed soon?" he looks at his clock. 'Yikes! Its 11:00! Time realy flyed!' you think. You strip off all your clothes and climb in bed. Jack blushes but its ok you know he`s....
125222.title: a little assortment of furniture made especiall...

13.content: Anthros in this universe average one thousand times taller than a human. At this size, the tallest human skyscrapers will barely reach their knees! Next, decide what kind of school you have been enrolled in.
13.title: Over a Mile

choices: He is taking you to meet your roomates.
He is giving you a tour of the campus.
134.content:
Despite flying in from your hometown, it was still a four-hour drive from the airport through the forests where the North Paw High School was, where you would be staying for the bulk of your high school life. As much as you doubted them, you couldn’t help but think about the stories you have heard from your friends, even though none of you had ever seen an anthro before. And now you would be boarding with them several thousand miles from home.

Your parents had told you about how “mentally-stimulating the experience would be” while ranting on about “what a big accomplishment this was for human-anthro relations,” but once the school came into view on the horizon you began to have doubts. It took two more hours before you actually reached the school grounds, and by then you were frozen in awe at how large it really was. The road seemed to spread past the miles-high trees like an ocean as your parents drove down the miniscule extension reserved for humans. Pulling into the parking lot, you were harrowed by the fact the curb towered high above the car. In the back of your mind, you tried to piece together just how big the anthros would be.

Finally reaching the drop-off point, your parents helped you unload your things and give you a few pecks on the cheek. They reminded you to visit them next summer before driving off, leaving you alone on the curb of your new school. Shouldering your duffel bag, you worked your way up a ramp and finally onto the pathway. You looked around in amazement, seeing the massive double-doors of the main office in the distance. You were both relieved yet a bit disappointed when you didn’t see any anthros hanging about. You prepared yourself for the long arduous task of reaching the door when you saw a figure looking at you through the glass.

A smile crossed the well-dressed anthro’s face as he stepped out onto the sidewalk. You quickly figured him out to be an ocelot as he filled your line of vision. By the time he actually reached you, you were stunned when you realized that you were shorter than one of his toes. He kneeled down before you and held out one furry finger for you to shake.

“You must be Evan Larkham,” the ocelot greeted. You managed a quick nod, still taken aback at his size. “Welcome to the North Paw High School.”

He laid his hand on the ground, prompting you to climb on. You felt yourself raised to the ocelot’s chest where he proceeded to talk to you while returning to the administration building. “We asked for you to come here a day early so we could discuss your accommodations,” he explained. “We figured it would take some getting used to traveling around campus yourself, so we decided to room you with a few freshmen who volunteered to help you out.”

He pushed past the double doors and stepped into a massive lobby of sorts. He approached the unattended admissions counter and picked up what you assumed were your transfer papers before proceeding down a hallway.
134.title: So Far From Home

choices: "How about we help you unpack and show you the dorm room?"
"I'm hungry.  Why don't we show you the cafeteria, Evan?"
1341.content:
You did not like the sound of rooming with high school freshman. Sure, you understand that you need to stay somewhere, but from what you know about yourself, fourteen-year-olds can be rowdy at times. At this size, you fear that even the smallest bit of roughhousing can cause you serious harm. As you near a room where you hear the loud yapping of two giant anthros, you quickly get the ocelot's attention by jumping up and down on his padded palm.

"Is there a problem, Evan? I was just about to introduce you to your roomates."

"It's just that I am just getting used to this whole idea of rooming with giant anthros, and I'm nervous. Are you sure that it's safe?"

The ocelot let out a hearty laugh, causing you to lose your balance and fall flat on his palm. Picking yourself up, the administrator explains that there is nothing to worry about. "Of course we didn't choose just any students to be your roomates. These two are star pupils; they were on the honor roll in junior high and have very many hours of community service between them. Here, I'll let you see for yourself what they are like."

Turning a door knob larger than any water tower you have seen, the ocelot opens the door and walks in. The talking you heard instantly stops, and two hulking behemoths get out of their chairs and walk towards you. As impossible as it may seem, you realize that the ocelot holding you is actually pretty short as far as anthros go, since the teenagers are both about a head taller than him.

The first student was a huge anthro canine, with grey fur specked with red and an athlete's build. After he extends a fingerpad many times your height, you shake the wolf's hand.

"Hi, you must be Evan. I'm Windsor Timbers, but you can just call me Windy." The timber wolf attempted a friendly smile, but the glistening house-sized fangs made you even more nervous than you already were. Apparantly, Windy noticed this, and quickly removed his teeth from your view.

The other student was a reptilian, with silvered horns and claws and covered in goldish colored scales. He is also wearing glasses, and you note that the lenses are thicker than you are tall. You shake his incredibly sharp index claw, and the gold dragon speaks.

"It is good to meet you, human. I'm Gregor, by the way." Unexpectedly, Gregor reaches a bit farther and wraps his huge fingers around you. You are then carefully carried into the dragon's golden palm, easily the size of two football fields.

"You boys should spend this time getting to know each other," says the ocelot. "Remember that the other students will show up tomorrow, and class begin the next day, Monday."

When the ocelot left the room, you half expected yourself to be ripped to pieces by your roomates. But of course this does not happen; both the tremendous timber wolf and the gigantic golden dragon continue to treat you respectfully. The two look at you standing in the dragon's hand, and you can tell by their looks that they are just as amazed at how tiny you are as you are astounded by their enormity. Windy is the first to speak up.
1341.title: Introduced

choices: They take you down to the cafeteria for a snack.
They show you where your classes will be.
13411.content:
Gregor carried you into what looked like the bedroom. You noticed a bunk bed at least two times taller than any skyscraper you've ever seen sitting in the corner. He set you down on top of a desk next to the bed, making you feel like you were standing in a giant mahogany desert. Turning around, however, you come across a perfectly-sized bed and dresser sitting nearby.

"Here's where you'll be sleeping," Windy said. "I guess you can unpack now."

Giving him a quick nod, you place your duffel bag on the bed and begin to sort out your belongings. As you decided where everything would go, Windy and Gregor crouched down on either side of you, watching you with a curious spark in their eyes. Their unwavering stares began to grow somewhat unsettling, so in an attempt to take your mind off of it you start a conversation.

"So," you began. "How do you feel about entering high school?"

"I'm pretty excited," Windy said. "But I'm also a bit intimidated."

"Yeah," Gregor agreed. "I mean, you don't know how it's going to turn out."

"Still," Windy added. "I can only imagine what it must be like for you."

Once you've finished up, Windy lowered his massive handpaw for you to climb on. The three of you then headed for a third room, which you quickly made out to be a bathroom. Setting you down on the white tiled counter, Windy then nudged a small (at least to him) plastic container towards you.

"You can use this as a wash basin," he explained. "And there's another one in the shower."

You placed you toothbrush and towel on the edge of the swimming-pool sized container before climbing onto Gregor's hand once again.

"Just let us know if you need anything," Gregor said friendlily. "We'll try to help you as much as we can."

You thanked them for their kindness, and for the first time since you got here you began to feel more relaxed. You were glad that your roommates were so nice, and you began to think that it might not be so bad after all...
13411.title: Friendly Chat

choices: "Do you mind if we eat now?  I haven't had a good meal all day."
"So, what do you guys like to do for fun?"
134112.content:
Traveling in Gregor's massive palm, you leave the bathroom, and also the dorm room. Windy fishes around in his pocket and procures an enormous key, with which he locks the door.

"So, Evan, I think it's about time that you saw the rest of North Paw High," spoke the timber wolf. "Our schedules were modified so that at least one of us is in each of your classes, so you shouldn't have to worry about getting around too much." You feel a bit relieved; it was just now that you realized the possibility of going to a class of unfamiliar titans who might not be as friendly as Windy and Gregor.

The first stop is only a few doors down from the dorm, though it would take you half an hour by car to travel the relatively small distance. "This is the student lounge," spoke Windy, who was enthusiastically taking on the role of your guide. As you were carried inside, you saw a cosy looking room with couches and ottomans surrounding a table. "This is where students living on campus can study in groups, or they can just hang out." You absorb the friendly environment of the room before you are whisked away. Soon, you are back at the entrance to the building. "Right now, we are in Sylvan Hall, where all of the on-campus students live, and also where the administration is. Down those stairs is the cafeteria, which we will show you at dinner."

Windy then opens the exit to Sylvan Hall, and he and Gregor step outside. However, since you are much higher up than you are used to being, you are quite cold, and start to shiver. Gregor notices this, and decides to hand you over to Windy. Now standing in the hand of a warm-blooded anthro, you feel much better, and thank Gregor.

"It's really no trouble at all, Evan. Now, do you see that large field to the north, where that little shack is?" You look past Windy's padded fingers, and are amazed to see what must be the largest field ever. It seemed to stretch for thousands of miles, easily larger than most human countries. "That's Mastiff Field, where all of the outside activities and physical education take place. I don't know much about human schools, but anthros place a very large emphasis on physical education and health." You think about this; you have noticed that Windy and Gregor seem to be in excellent shape. "We have two PE classes a day; one in the morning and one in the afternoon. The field is very big because the whole campus has PE at the same time."

You try to imagine all of those giant anthros in one place, but you cannot piece the image together in your mind. Meanwhile, your two roomates continued to walk down the campus paths. You notice that they are walking very slowly for their size, at a "mere" 500 miles per hour. That's when you remember something from junior high school, that the speed of sound is somewhere between 700 and 800 miles. Even at a casual pace, creatures this huge would cause a sonicboom just by walking. You are sure that such a thing would not affect them, but it could cause you irrepairable hearing damage. You realize that these two must have thought of everything when they agreed to help you out.

After a twenty minute walk, which could have taken three if you weren't slowing your new friends down, Windy and Gregor stop near an impressive building with a green roof. You notice that you are starting to feel a bit more used to the large size differences. Windy cleared his throat, which you could feel rumbling through his huge body. "This is Muzzle Hall, where all of the natural sciences and mathematics are offered. Math classes are on the first floor, biology is on the second, and physics is on the third."

You suddenly whizz to the left, and see a similar looking building with a red roof. "Right next to Muzzle Hall is Gossamer Hall, where the social sciences and related classes like philosophy and language meet." Whizzing left again, you see a much larger building down the path, easily the size of the three other buildings combined, and that's not even including the impossibly large structure next to it.

"Finally, this is the Behemoth Building. This is where art classes are held, and is also where the teacher's offices are. And next to it is Behemoth Auditorium, where the faculty make schoolwide announcements and where the art students hold their performances. Well, that's the tour, I guess," concluded Windy.

"Wait, I think that they will also have the school dance in there," added Gregor, winking his enormous eye at you. Right now, you try not to think that far ahead into the future.

Slowly, you and your two enormous new friends start heading back to Sylvan Hall. The sun is still up, but you stomach is growling a bit since all you had to eat today was airline food. However, your friends didn't seem to be hungry yet. They looked at you, in Windy's palm, as if they had always been your friend, and you almost felt like you belonged. After the twenty minute walk back to the door, you ask your roomates a question.
134112.title: Colossal Campus

choices: They meet a few other anthros on the way to the cafeteria.
1341122.content:
You decided to wait a while. You didn't want to impose yourself on them just after meeting them, and you felt you could hold out for another hour or so.

"I'm kind of an artist," Gregor said as he locked the door behind you and Windy. "I like to draw and paint when I have some time. I think it relieves stress. I also play chess and basketball."

Windy placed you on your bed before he spoke. "I like to build things just because I think its fun. I can cook a little, but I don't think I can practice on campus. I'm a pretty good track runner, and I try to go bowling whenever I have a chance."

You nodded as they elaborated on their interests. It was interesting to you how similar their lifestyles were to those of your friends back home. You could imagine Gregor dribbling down a basketball court and Windy hitting a strike at a bowling alley. Apart from their size and shape, they weren't really all that different...

Your thoughts were interrupted when your stomach made a large growl. You tried to hide your hunger from Windy and Gregor, who had taken seats on the bunk beds.

"You're hungry, aren't you?" Gregor inquired.

"What makes you say that?" you try to fake.

"Anyone could have heard that growl," Windy pointed out jokingly. He hopped off the bed as Gregor climbed down from the higher bunk. "You should have just told us."

Needless to say, you were somewhat embarrassed, but you were glad that Windy and Gregor took no offense in it.

"I'm getting hungry anyway," Gregor stated, holding his hand out for you to climb on. "Let's go."
1341122.title: Not So Different After All

choices: going back to the room and washing up
13411222.content:
As Windy and Gregor carry you down the stairs to the cafeteria, your ears pop from the pressure change. The air is a bit stagnant, which is expected several miles underground. The cafeteria is extremely huge; you cannot tell where the walls are. Most of the plateau-like tables have mountainous chairs placed on top of them, and there seems to be nobody around. However, as your roomates walk over to the counter to the right of the entrance, you realize that there are two other huge anthros wearing huge aprons; one is a plump badger lady and the other is a younger ferret woman. Gregor leans on the counter, holding you a bit outward and Windy addresses the badger lady at the register.

"Excuse me, miss, the three of us would like to eat now." The badger woman looks confused, but then, looking closer at you in Gregor's palm, exclaimed, "Ah, I see, you must be the two boys who are helping the human out this year!" Both of your friends nod their huge heads. "Well, since the students aren't due to come until tomorrow morning, we don't have the full menu up yet, only basic meals. Are hot dogs or hamburgers okay with you three?"

You are a bit surprised that hot dogs and hamburgers are part of an anthro's diet; your friends all told you that they eat all of their food raw. Windy ordered a double hamburger without cheese, and Gregor ordered three hot dogs with extra mustard. You notice Gregor reach into his pocket and pull out paper notes that could cover a city block, and the badger lady returns coins that could fit a whole house on one of their faces for change. As the ferret woman starts cooking the food, Gregor carries you off to the soda fountain.

"I hope that you don't mind sharing with us," spoke Gregor. "Its just that the food here does not come in portions your size, and I'm sure Windy or I wouldn't miss a crumb or two." You completely understand Gregor, but asked him how you would be able to pay for all of your supplies when anthro money is so big. Gregor just laughs as a waterfall of cherry soda cascades into a massive cup. "Don't worry, the program you are in has already paid for all of your books and stuff like that. If you do need anything, I'll be happy to pay for it; I don't see how anything you could need would cost more than a few cents, anyway." You laugh along with Gregor, then watch him fill another cup with hundreds of gallons of fruit punch. You suddenly find yourself underneath thousands of tons of bevarage, as Gregor lifts one of the drinks above his palm with his sturdy clawed fingers. He is clearly making absolutely sure that he has a firm grip, since dropping something that size would mean the end for you. You assume he has the other beverage in his other hand, since you can feel the golden dragon start to walk somewhere.

You feel much safer when the huge cup is lifted off Gregor's fingers. Replacing them now are a massive finger and thumb from Gregor's other hand, which gently lift you onto a soft napkin. Looking around you, you see that Windy has brought all of the food to a table, which you are now on. The fast food is enormous; the hot dogs are the size of thirty story buildings, and the hamburger is larger than a stadium. Windy lightly scrapes his burger with a claw, then places a hunk of ground meat twice your size next to you. You taste the meat, and it does taste just like a regular hamburger patty. You look up to thank your two friends, but instead you are caught up in fascination.

The way that Windy lifts that burger and bites off nearly half of it scares you a bit. Boulder sized beef bits cling to the sides of his mouth as he savagely chews the burger. Gregor is not much better; his draconic snout is long enough to nearly stuff a whole hot dog in his mouth at once. Huge globs of mustard dribble off his chin as he devours the food. If you weren't so hungry, you would have likely been turned off by these bad eating habits. However, you remember that even though they are so polite and gentle with you, they're still only fourteen or fifteen, and since when does anyone your age eat fast food politely?

Already having polished off his burger, Windy starts to chug down his cherry soda. Gregor seems a bit disappointed and instead addresses you. You notice huge chunks of meat in between is pointy teeth. "Well, I guess you won't have cherry soda. How would you like some of my lemonade now?"

The burger is making you thirsty, so you nod to Gregor as you chew a bite. You see Gregor pick up a straw and dunk it in his lemonade. Then, putting his thumb on the top of the straw, he carries the straw over your napkin and starts to lower it down. The sweet drink is just above your head, so you tilt back and swallow large gulps of the lemonade. When you are finished, your face is covered in the sticky beverage. Gregor then lifts the straw over his head and releases his thumb, causing a stream to pour into his mouth.

Just then, you hear an extremely LOUD noise that shakes the table and sends you bumping into your burger hunk. Looking up, you see Windy covering his mouth with his massive paw. "Um, excuse me?"

The three of you laugh. After finishing the delightful meal, Windy suggests...
13411222.title: Dinnertime

choices: you wake up, in windy's paw
you wake up before Gregor and Windy
134112221.content:
You agree to that, your face is starting to get sticky, and you don't want that happening now, don't you? You climb onto Gregor's palm and you are carried to the bathroom, were you clean your face, you notice the amount of water they use to wash up would drown a city, then it hits you. If you accidently anger an anthro, it could crush you before Windy or Gregor could save you! You would probably have to stay on everyone's good side.

After a while, Windy yawns, that yawn is powerful enough to suck in several skyscrapers.

"I think we are all getting tired." Gregor says, you nod, as you now feel the day taking it's toll on you. You are placed on your bed, Gregor shouts lights and the lights go out, you had brought several books with you to read, and your Nintendo DS and LOZ PH and Pokemon Diamond, but you are too-tired to play or read, you here goodnights, you pass them back, you would never know about the events going to take place tomorrow...
134112221.title: Back to the dorm

choices: They want to introduce you to their girlfriends.
The principal is holding a school-wide seminar on humans.
1341122211.content:
"Wakey wakey, little guy!" You stir a bit, not really realizing what's happening, when suddenly you feel a great pressure on your abdomen. Opening your eyes, you see Windy's face loom overhead, his huge finger prodding you awake. "Good, you're awake! Today's going to be a busy day, little human, so get ready quick!" The timber wolf gingerly pick you up between his claws and places you back on your bed, and you start getting dressed as fast as you can. Thankfully your dresser is enclosed; both Windy and Gregor were already fully awake and watching you get ready with great interest, and privacy was a welcome commodity. You throw on a black T-shirt and long blue jeans, then step out. The gold dragon surprises you by swiping you into his clutches rather fast.

Fortunately, they remember to walk slowly. You notice that the dorm rooms now all have students inside them, due to all the luggage strewn about haphazardly and a few late risers tossing in their sheets. You can't help but ask; "What's the big rush, guys? Classes don't start until tomorrow."

"We know that, human, but there's somewhere we just HAVE to go now, and you're invited too!" Windy speaks enthusiastically. His tail is wagging back and forth fervently; he must be excited. "Sounds like a big deal!" you remark.

"Oh, it is!" replies Gregor before telling you what you're doing this morning.
1341122211.title: Awakened

13411222112.content:
"The principal is holding a school-wide seminar on humans!" He exclaims, "We are very excited about learning what your species is like!" You think to yourself 'So, I am a novelty here, just a pawn to help humans and anthros get along!' You sit comfortably in the palm of Gregor's hand. Then you come up with the idea They might just want the pupils to know of my exsistance and to take extra care!.

When this is over is all you care about, this really boring seminar.

13411222112.title: BORED

135.content:
You were looking out of the window of the bus you were on. You were in the human section of a massive bus for anthros. Such a fate came when you had to live on Gao-L the anthro planet. It had been a thousand years ago when this planet had first been discovered and the titanic inhabitants of the planet hadn't always had the best relationships with humans. At one point both species were at war, but a comet called the Nemesis based by Earth and caused abnormal weather conditions that albeit temporary, forced some humans to take refuge on Gao-L.

You let out a sigh. You were a descendent of humans who moved to the planet and spent your life living in the domed cities the anthros built for human visitors. However, now you were heading to Laird-Tech, a college for giant anthros. You were one of only a few students selected to take part and you were almost there. You look up to see the bus driver, a gigantic gorilla was finally reaching the school. "Here we are. This is the last stop for humans going on campus."

You immediately get out of your seat and take your bags from the overhead compartment before walking out of a ramp with the rest of the human students. Soon you're in a human sized waiting room looking at your watch and let out a yawn. It was only 9:00 in the morning. The anthros like to get up early it seems. Soon you hear your name called. "Jimmy Devlin, come in now." You run into the main waiting room and see that you're on a giant counter, you look up and see the R.A., a gigantic Chinese dragon anthro with bright black scales, looking down on you holding a clipboard in the air. "Welcome to Laird-Tech Mr. Devlin," he says. "First year in an anthro college." "That's it," you say nodding your head. "Major, undecided. I'm going to try several classes this semester to see for myself."

The dragon nods his head and then gestures for you to walk forward and immediately, he snaps a photograph of you and soon you're given your student ID. "There you go Jimmy," says the R.A. "And let me be the first to welcome you personally to Scarlet Glen. Your room number is 322A. I'll personally escort you to your new roommate." "Thanks." You say.

The dragon picks you up and walks you up the stairs as you hold up your student ID. You couldn't believe it, you were officially a college student and one to giant anthros. It makes you wonder. Soon, the R.A. reaches your room and knocks on the door. This was it, you were going to meet your new roommate. You cross your fingers and hope that you'll get along with whoever or whatever the creature is.

The door opens up and you see your new roommate...
135.title: College for Titans

choices: Elisabeth Introduces you to Her Friends.
1351.content:
As the door is opening, you hear footsteps that sound thunderous even for an anthro. Your new roommate must've been not only unbelievably huge, but also unbelievably heavy. The door opens up and you see that your new roommate is a girl anthro. She was a titanic hippopotamus anthro with gold-colored skin and long orange-blonde hair. She was wearing a black shirt with a blue jacket and skin tight jeans that looked ready to break off. Since the girl was a hippo anthro, she was massively obese, especially in her belly and butt. You look up in awe and see that she has a blue heart shaped tattoo above her right breast.

"Jimmy Devlin," says the R.A. "Meet your new roommate Elisabeth Wakeman." You look up nervously at your new hippo roommate and wave before she looks down and smiles before she totally gushes over you. "AAAW!" screams Elisabeth in a schoolgirl's voice that forces you to cover your ears. "So that's a human? He's so adorable. Nice to meet you." You hold out your hand as Elisabeth reaches out the tip of her finger for you to shake. That's when she grabs you and pushes you against her the side of her face as you grunt. At least she's friendly.

The dragon R.A. nods his head. "I'll leave you two to get acquainted. Classes don't begin until Monday so you two have plenty of time to get to know each other. Good luck in the school year." As the R.A. leaves, Elisabeth puts you on the side of a table and lowers her head to your level. "Sorry about that," the hippo giantess says. "But I've never seen a human up close before Jimmy. You're just so cute, I could just eat you up." Elisabeth then teases you by opening her mouth big enough to hold a city and you see large hippo teeth as big as skyscrapers.

Realizing she's scaring you, Elisabeth shuts her mouth and blushes. "Oh, I'm sorry little guy. I just lost myself." You let out a laugh. "It's okay Elisabeth. I just didn't expect my roommate to be a girl." Elisabeth giggles as she starts to hang several posters. As she does, she gives you a view of her titanic rear, each cheek a moon in comparison to you. She's wearing white panties with blue hearts on them, but that doesn't stop your nose from bleeding.

You quickly turn your head before your roommate could notice you staring at her generously sized rump. "So," says Elisabeth. "What major are you in?" "Uh, I'm undecided. You?" Elisabeth puts her hands on her hips and smiles proudly. "I'm in the law department. One day, I'm gonna be a cop. Elisabeth puts her hand over her heart and you imagine her in a cop's uniform and then have to grab your nose. "Geez," says Elisabeth. "That's some nosebleed you have Jimmy. I know something that's good for that."

Elisabeth reaches into the fridge in her side of the room before taking out some grapes. She plucks one off and then puts in in front of you It's four times bigger than you, but you don't want to be rude so you start to bite into it. You then see Elisabeth toss the rest of the grapes into her maw and swallow them whole. You're slightly worried before Elisabeth lets out a feminine belch and response. "Excuse me about that. And don't worry. I'm a vegetarian. The only way you'd wind up in this mouth is with a kiss." You let out a blush and then you get back to unpacking.

Elisabeth realizes that you’re in her mouth and then gives a look of shock before she holds up her city-sized hand and then spits you out. You stand up covered in hippopotamus spit as you look up at your girlfriend and see her golden cheeks turn bright red. “Oh my ghost! I am so sorry, Jimmy! I could’ve ate you just like those grapes!” You just wave up at Elisabeth. “It’s alright, Elisabeth. I gotta say, you’re a good kisser. You just have to be more careful.” Elisabeth then lightly kisses you, not enough to suck you into her mouth but enough to cover your head with her monstrous lips. “I can’t believe it,” you say. “I finally get a girlfriend and she turns out to be a hippo.” Elisabeth lets out a laugh. “Oh, you tease.”

Suddenly, Elisabeth gives a look of shock and spanks herself. “Oh my gosh,” she said. “You have got to meet my friends.” “Your friends?” you ask. “Oh,” says Elisabeth. “Don’t worry. They’re all pleasant and they’re as big as me. They’ll love you.” Before you could say another word, Elisabeth plucks you up and then tosses you in her cleavage where you’re wedged between two monstrous breasts that were larger than mountains. With each step, her breasts shake and you almost fall asleep in your girlfriend’s cleavage right then and there.

It isn’t long until Elisabeth stops moving and you realize she must’ve met up with her friends. You look out and see that there were 4 anthro girls as colossal and fat as your hippopotamus girlfriend. All five of them were ungulates just like Elisabeth. First of them was a giant two-humped camel girl with blackish brown hair and violet fur. She was dressed as a goth girl and had black lipstick on. Her fishnet stockings were struggling on her arms and legs not to snap off due to her immense mass.

The second girl was an orange-red colored rhinoceros giantess who was wearing a white shirt with a white ascot, an indigo blue jacket and a black skirt. She had short bluish black hair and was wearing a pair of glasses as well as a pair of pearl earrings. She was studying a book before she took her head out of it and turned it in the direction of Elisabeth. “Hey, Elisabeth.” She said before returning to her book.

The third of the girls was an obese sheep giantess with aqua-colored wool all over her body and curved black horns but also with long blood-red hair that had rainbow highlights at her sideburns. She was wearing a black and white spotted shirt and skirt. From the looks of it, the girl knew how to dress and she was still applying makeup on.

Last of the girls was a yellow-green furred cow woman with viridian spots. She had long carrot-red hair and a blue tattoo of a cow’s head over her left eye. She wore nothing but a pink jacket, a yellow tanktop and a biker’s cap because she had a large udder that made it impossible for her to wear pants. This cow giantess gave a sly smile as she looked at Elisabeth and walked her way forward.

“My, Elisabeth, you’re in a very good mood today.” Elisabeth gave a laugh. “You’re as observant as always, Delilah.” The rhinoceros girl then smirked. “Well,” she said. “Why shouldn’t she be? We made it into college. Though, with some of us, it was more obvious it would happen than with others.” The rhino girl was speaking to the sheep who gave an indignant look her way. “Don’t even try to look like a college student, Barbara. We both know very well that you’re mainly here to play pranks.” Barbara gave a smirk at the sheep. Elisabeth let out a laugh. “Looks like Barbara is still picking on Celina.” You look through your massive hippopotamus girlfriend’s breasts and see that it’s perfectly clear that she’s got quite the colorful bunch of friends. “So, come on, Elisabeth,” said Delilah. “What’s up.” Elisabeth smiled and then shook her breasts, causing you some mild discomfort as you fell deeper and deeper into the hippopotamus’s cleavage. “Oh,” said Elisabeth. “I just met my new roommate and he’s so cute, I decided to make him my boyfriend.”

The girls look at Elisabeth in surprise. In the process, Celina accidentally applies lipstick to her cheek and Barbara falls flat on her large rhinoceros rump right before the goth camel girl stares at Elisabeth. “Congratulations,” said Delilah with a stomp. “That’s awesome. I wish I could find somebody as easy as you. What is he? A mammoth? A wildebeest? Oh, I hope not a crocodile, your folks would have a fit.” Then the cow woman grunts as the camel pushes her out of the way. “That’s odd,” said the camel giantess as her own enormous breasts and belly push against your girlfriend’s own, a sea of purple fur in front of you. “Why would they assign a boy to be your roommate?” Celina, Delilah and Barbara realize this and then stare at Elisabeth. “Angela’s right,” said Barbara. “That does sound suspicious.” At this point, you were at breast level to 5 giantesses who each stood 8000ft high. “Exactly when are we going to meet this mysterious man?” asked Celina. Elisabeth gave a smirk. “Right now.” “Elisabeth?” you ask. “What are you... urk.”

Wasting no time, Elisabeth reaches down into her massive cleavage and picks you up between two of her skyscraper-sized and very thick fingers. She holds you up in front of the massive faces of her four friends. “Ta-da.” All four of the giantesses look in surprise as they see you on the tip of Elisabeth’s finger. “Jimmy,” said Elisabeth. “These are my closest friends, Angela, Barbara, Celina and my best friend, Delilah.” Barbara adjusts her glasses before she realizes what’s going on. “That’s right,” she said. “The university just recently started to accept humans.” “Aw!” screamed Celina forcing you to cover your ears. “You are so lucky, Elisabeth. He’s just so tiny and cute. I wish I had a bite-sized human as my boyfriend. He’s so cute, I could just eat him up!”

You then look in fear as Celina shows you her massive teeth and opens her mouth wide. After spending some time inside Elisabeth’s mouth, you did not want to see the inside of another anthro’s anytime soon. However, you then see Barbara, Angela and Delilah lower their heads to your level and lick their lips. “He’s so small, you actually could swallow him up,” said Angela. “I’d bet he’d taste scrumptious.” “Hey, human,” says Delilah teasingly as she opens wide. “Be a good boy and get in my mouth.” “Hey!” yells Barbara. “No fair. I want to eat him.” “Oh,” said Angela. “I’d just love to have a tiny human running around inside me.” What these massive girls were saying scared you. They were actually joking about eating you.

Elisabeth however, comes to your rescue and gives a loud snort. “Knock it off you girls,” she said. “You’re scaring him. And don’t even think about it. He’s my boyfriend and if anybody is going to eat him, it’s going to be me.” Elisabeth’s friends just laugh out loud. “Come on, Elisabeth,” said Delilah as she shakes her huge udder. “We were just kidding.” “I wasn’t.” Said Angela. Elisabeth then gave a blush. “Actually,” she said. “Just now, I almost did eat Jimmy. I kissed too hard and accidentally licked him into my mouth.” You rub the tip of your girlfriend’s lower lip. “Accidents happen, Elisabeth.” Elisabeth’s friends all laugh at that. “Lucky,” said Delilah. “I bet it felt good having such a tiny man in your mouth like that.” “I’ll bet you could fit three human cities in that mouth,” said Barbara. “He’s so small, he could live in your mouth.” The girls all laugh and you laugh as well. At least Elisabeth’s friends were nice enough.

“Speaking of which,” said Celina. “It’s almost suppertime. You two have got to join us for dinner, I know a place in the area that serves the best..."
