141.content:
You do not know what to expect now. Just a little while ago, your mommy and daddy kissed you goodbye, handed you your lunchbox, and dropped you off at the bus stop. You remember what your mommy said to you, "Have a good first day at kindergarten, Mikey! Be good for the really big animal people!"

You have seen the really big animal people before, but you did not think that they could see you. Their heads go up too high to see, and you can only see up to their ankles on cloudy days. Also, people have told you that the big animal people usually stay very far away from regular humans.

Suddenly, the Earth shook! You start to shout and feel like crying, but you want to act like a big boy, so you don't. You look out very far, and instead of the hills, you see a really tall mountain. However, you see the curve at the end, and you realize that the mountain is in reality a gigantic claw! You tremble, and suddenly two hard things squeeze your sides! You feel your body go way, way up high, above the clouds, until the suburb below you looks very small. From this height, you can see the whole claw is larger than the suburb. You are very afraid now, but a calm voice talks to you.

"Don't be afraid, Mikey, I'm not going to hurt you. I'm Miss Talons, and I will be your teacher this year. Now, let's go to the school and meet your classmates." The enormous claws that were squeezing you suddenly let go, and you fell onto a leathery surface. Looking up, you see that Miss Talons is an...
141.title: Titan Teacher

1411.content:
You look at the giant head in front of you, and you see that Miss Talons is a really big bird lady. Her face is covered in big brown feathers, and her beak is thick and really sharp. She looks at you with kind, pretty green eyes, though.

Suddenly, the surface you are standing on starts to move around! You turn around and see four mountains start to fall towards you! You try to run away, but the mountains are far too big for you to go anywhere. You then realize that the mountains are actually fingers, and soon you do not see anything except for very long and very thin lines of light in the sky. You can still hear Miss Talons, though.

"Don't worry, Mikey, I'm just making sure that you do not blow off my hand while I fly to school," your teacher says. Soon, you feel her hand move around a lot again, and this time you also hear loud beating wings. Soon, you also hear a very loud exploding sound, and you wonder what that could be. It is too dark to see anything, but Miss Talons must be moving fast, since you feel yourself being tightly pressed against her scaly palm.

After what must have been forever, you hear another explosion, and you find out that you can stand up again. The mountain-fingers lift up off you, and you are amazed to see a huge building in front of you. It is so big, you are sure that a bazillion million people could fit inside. "Wow!" you cry, "That's the biggest school ever!"

"It's really not that big, actually," says your teacher. As you look at other buildings that are even bigger than the kindergarten, Miss Talons walks through the front doors and towards a super big classroom. You are even more amazed to see even more really big animal people, except that they look like they are your age! All of this hugeness is making you feel very tiny and scared, though, and you do not know if it is a good idea to play with them.

Miss Talons suddenly says something in a much louder voice. "Attention, class, will everyone please sit in a circle? I would like to introduce you all to our new, special student!" All of the really big animal kids stopped what they were doing and obediently sat on the floor in a circle. All of them looked very excited. Suddenly, you feel yourself go way, way down as the teacher sits down in the circle.

"Alright, everyone, please meet our human student. Introduce yourself, Mikey."

Miss Talon's huge hand extended into the middle of the circle. You suddenly feel very nervous to have so many different kinds of huge animal people looking at you. "Um, hello, I'm Mikey," you manage to utter.

"HI, MIKEY!" all of the students yell. You have to cover your ears from the noise. You look at the big group of your 4-mile tall classmates. They are all smiling at you ...
1411.title: Flying to School

14111.content:
Looking up at the super big animal kids, you see all of them looking at you like you are their friend. A few of them are even waving hello. You smile back to them, because you like being with friends!

"Now, class, let us all introduce ourselves to Mikey," says Miss Talons. "I would like you to pass Mikey around the circle, and tell him your name and species. Remember, though, that Mikey is a human, so you all have to be very gentle and careful when handling him." You do not know what a 'species' is, but you are probably going to find out soon, so you do not ask your teacher any questions. You feel the world move as Miss Talon's hand maneuvers to her right. Soon, you see another hand above you, except instead of having yellow scales, this one is covered in white fur and has big black mounds on the palm and fingertips. Very carefully, you are pressed against two of these mounds and lifted off of your teacher's hand. You feel yourself flipped sideways, and find yourself lying on a giant thumb, looking at a cute, fuzzy face of a giant boy animal.

"Hello, Mikey, my name is Boris, and I'm a polar bear!" You wave hello to Boris, and he wiggles a finger back at you. Suddenly, everything goes black again as Boris places his pointer finger back on your body. As you move to the right again, you realize that "species" must be a word for "kind of animal".

Next, you are placed on another black surface, but this one feels slippery and rubbery. Looking up past shiny, smooth mountain-fingers, you can see a pudgy face of a fishy girl.

"Hi, I'm Ambergry, an orca," she says shyly. You do not know what an orca is, but her toothy smile reminds you of a dolphin, so you think that an orca is kind of like a dolphin. Next, you can see a big orange blob falling down onto you, and you want to tell the teacher that this animal kid is not being gentle like she said. However, the orange blob is very soft and squishy, so you aren't hurt one bit. The blob is very sticky, too, so when the blob lifts up, you are stuck in place and do not fall down. Replacing Ambergry's hand is now is a funny looking boy, with a very green face and giant red eyes that look too big even for him.

"Ooh, ooh, I am Thadius, and my species is a, is a, is a Tree Frog!" You can tell that Thadius is what your mommy would call "Hyper" by the amount of energy he has. The next student has a hand that looks kind of like your teachers, but it is brown, not yellow. One of the really big claws gently scrapes you off of Thadius's sticky finger, and then wipes you onto a palm. You look up and jump back at the scary fangs on the big animal's face, but when you heard her soft, soothing voice, you forgot all about your fear.

"Hi, little Mikey, I'm Nagatha, a rattlesnake." You then hear a loud rattling noise come from her wiggling tail, and see that Nagatha is showing off her rattle. You can see that her tail goes right up to belly, without any legs. You think that its funny and cool that giant snake people get to have arms but no legs, and tell her so. She lets out a funny giggle and pats your head with one of her claws before she hands you over to the next animal kid.

You find the next kid to be very funny looking. The hand you are placed in has very big claws, even bigger than Miss Talons' talons, but on a hand that is too small for them. You can see his face covered in greasy black fur, most of which is behind giant glasses, along with tiny looking beady eyes. But the funniest part of his face is the nose, which looks like it is covered in little fingers! You try hard not to laugh at the giant animal boy as you look at his nervous face.

"Um, hi Mikey, I'm Spangle," says the funny kid in a nasally voice. "I'm a star-nosed mole." You could hear several other students snicker a bit, but you do not, because you don't want to hurt his feelings.

You look back at the circle and noticed that Miss Talons is sitting across from Spangle, which means that you have met half of your new students. So far, you like all of the students you have met so far, and are actually excited to meet the rest. You wait anxiously as Spangle pinches you gently in his big claws.
14111.title: Passed Around Class, Part 1

141111.content:
Spangles lifts you up and drops you in the next child's hands. You look at the kid's face to see that it has a beak like the teacher's, but the color of its feathers, and its hand are different. Instead of the scales like the teachers, you see brown feathers covering a hand-like structure. "My name is Josh, and I am a red-tailed hawk." you look at his arms, and you think those are his wings (Josh is a different style of anthro, kind of like Falco from Starfox.). You smile at him, and he seems happy. He then gently drops you onto a hand much like Boris', but smaller and completely black.

"Hello there Mikey, my name is Catherine, and I am a black cat." She rolled her R's a bit when she introduced herself. Her eyes were a very bright green, and you told her you really liked how shiny they were, and she took the compliment very well. You asked her about the things coming off her nose, and she told you they were whiskers, which helped her sense things.

You are then shipped off to the next kid. His hands were a lot like yours, but unlike yours, its hands were completely black, like Catherine's hands. You looked up to a face that resembled the structure of your own. "Hi, Mikey, I'm George, and I am a gorilla." He then tickles your stomach as lightly as he can, and you giggle. George hands you off to a green hand.

As soon as you are on the next kid's hand, the green scales turn into scales that are the color of your shirt. You look to see a face that resembles Thadius, but with a smaller mouth, and eyes that aren't absolutely huge. "Mikey, my name is Camilla, a chameleon. I can change the color of my skin to resemble my surroundings." That explains the scale thing. You tell you think the whole thing is really neat. Her hands are then replaced by another paw-like hands, except the fur on these were gray.

You look at the kid, and you see a long muzzle protruding from the rest of his head, with teeth on the sides that scared you because of their unbelievable size. He sees this, and then hides his teeth in his mouth. His claws look a little sharp as well. "Uh, sorry, uh, my name is Ralph, and I am...a...uh...gray wolf." His voice sounded very nervous, and you could tell he was really shy. You flash him a reassuring smile, and then you are picked up again by the teacher.

"Alright class, now that introductions are finished, let's move on to our first activity for today..."
141111.title: Passed Around Class, Part II

1411112.content:
"So, who can tell me something they know about humans?" asked Miss Talons. You immediately raise your hand, and surprisingly, so do all of the super big animal kids. "Yes, Catherine?"

"Humans are really, really, really small!" shouts Catherine. Most of the other kids now put their hands back down, but you do not agree with what Catherine says. Before the teacher can call on you, you shout back to Catherine, "No, people aren't small, they are normal sized!"

"Nuh-uh!" disagrees the black cat. "If humans are normal sized, then why aren't they anthro sized?"

"'Cause anthros are really big!" you shout back. Both of you are then hushed by the Miss Talons. "Please, indoor voices! Listen, Mikey, to us anthros, humans are indeed very small, but that does not mean that you aren't normal sized as well. Normal sized can mean different things for different races." You nod your head, glad that your teacher is so smart. "Now, does anyone else know anything about humans?"

This time, you hear a rattling, and notice Nagatha bouncing up and down with her clawed hand in the air. She speaks after she is called on, "Humans live in a place that is just for them."

"Very good, Nagatha." Miss Talons reaches behind her with the clawed hand not carrying you, and she passes out piece of paper with maps of Earth on them. She lays one of them in her lap for you to look at. Right now, she is pointing at a small spot of green colored land much smaller than the tip of her finger. You notice that the rest of the land on the map was colored red, and places with water were colored blue.

"Now, class, this is where the humans live, in the green area, and the anthros live everywhere else in the red area." At first you do not think that's fair, but looking at how big the animal people are, you reason that they need a lot more land to hold them all. Miss Talons then starts to talk about how humans live in cities, farm for food, and have a civilization. All of this stuff you already know and find boring, but all of the other kids look very interested, by how their eyes are so wide. However, by the words the teacher is using, you find out that she is saying that humans live a lot like how anthros do, and you are surprised that animals people that are so big live so much like humans. You continue listening throughout the whole talk, which is several hours long. You do not remember ever being able to pay attention to a grown up talk for so long, so you think that Miss Talons must be a very good teacher.

After the talk, Miss Talons tells everyone what is next.
1411112.title: Humans 101

choices: Boris, who is alone on a swing set
Catherine and Ambergry, who are playing jump rope
14111122.content:
All of your super giant friends squealed in glee and ran outside. You followed them as Miss Talons carried you outside through a back door. When she lifted you way high so you could see better, you could see everyone playing on a giant playground having lots of fun.

George was on the monkey bars, which was kind of silly, but you saw that he was very strong for a four year old, since he could lift his whole body onto the giant metal bars with only one arm! Nagatha was with George, winding her body into twisty shapes as she climbed up high. However, those bars must be much too big for you, so you look somewhere else.

Spangle and Ralph, the shyest kids, are playing in a really big sandbox quietly, building a sand castle. You think that it is really neat that a little animal kid can build a sand castle that is much bigger than a real castle! However, whenever you go into a sandbox, sand goes up your shorts and makes you all itchy, so you look somewhere else.

Thadius was playing catch with Camille and Josh, and you are immediately scared by the how fast and how big the ball is. Such a big ball might squish you! You look away from them as Thadius tries to pry the ball from his sticky hands.

Finally, you see something that looks fun for you, and you ask Miss Talons to bring you there to join in. Your teacher happily brings you to...
14111122.title: Playing with the Big Boys?

141111221.content:
Boris was going very high in the sky on the swing set, and it looked very exciting! The polar bear boy slowed down when he saw Miss Talons walk over, and he looked very happy when he saw you on her mountain-claw. "Hi, Mikey, do you want to play with me?" spoke Boris.

"Yes, that sounds very fun!" you yell up to him. In no time at all his huge thumb and finger scooped you up like a speck of dust and placed you on the swing set. You felt like you were in a desert made of red plastic, since the spot is still warm from Boris sitting on the swing. "Miss Talons said that I can't make you go as high as I did without you falling off, so I'm going to push the swing softer, okay Mikey?" asked your super huge bear buddy.

"Okay, as long as I can go really high!" You see the tip of Boris's black paw pad far away come very slowly closer to the edge of the swing set. When he touched the swing very softly, you were off like a rocket! "Wheee!" you cry as the swing goes far forward, then starts to go back. However, when you look up, you see that the swing is barely moving at all to Boris. The polar bear boy is laughing heartily, "Wow, Mikey, that's really neat that I can make you have so much fun while doing so little!" Boris lightly touches the swing yet again with the tiniest twitch of his paw, and you go even farther forward. After a few more tiny touches, you start to feel yourself rising and falling several feet as well. However, when you look up this time, the swing still looks practically still.

While you are having a lot of fun on the swing, what is even more fun is Boris's reaction. Although he is only poking the swing as light as he can with his finger, he looks very happy and laughs very loudly. You know that he must be happy because he is so surprised that he can make a human have so much fun doing almost nothing at all. You find this very interesting as well. What is nothing to an anthro can be everything to a human at this size.

When the bell rings, Boris brings you inside. Right now, it is time for...
141111221.title: Push Me!

choices: Miss Talon comes in and says time for Drawing
Miss Talon comes in, but Ambergy can't stop looking at you
141111222.content:
Over in the distance you can see Catherine and Ambergy playing jump rope, you ask Miss Talon "Can you take me other there, please?" She looks back and says "Sure," she quickly sets down again and both girls say "Hello, Miss Talon." "Hello girls," you emerge and say. They both look at you and ask "You wanna play jump rope with us?" "Sure." you reply.
A few moments later the bell rings again and all the children head back to class, Miss Talon says "Come on I'll give a lift back to class." You reply "No thanks Miss Talon, Ambergy and Catherine said they'd be extra careful not to drop me, is that okay." Miss Talon looks at you and then at the girls and says "If its okay with you its okay with me. Now you girls be extra careful okay." "Yes, Miss Talon." they say in unison as they head back to the classroom and sit down at their desks and set you down onto Ambergy's desk.
141111222.title: Catherine and Ambergry, who are playing jump rope

choices: "and besides I wouldn't eat you if you were the last thing on the planet."
Ambergy picks you up and says "This is when you apologise."
1411112222.content: Miss Talon comes in and says time for Drawing, all the children start to draw. Though every now and then you catch Ambergy looking at you, you lean back to her and ask "So what are you drawing Ambergy?" she looks up 'sort of' and goes "Huh," "Can I see what your drawing" Ambergy just looks at you and says "Sure, don't laugh though." you look directly into her eyes and say "I promise I won't laugh at your drawing," she shows you and its a picture of what you assume is 'you, Catherine and her just playing together' "Hey, that's a nice drawing. Ummm....What was I going to ask you again?" she just says "Well my mommy says, if you can't remember it can't of been that important." you start to scratch at your head trying to remember, and then it hits you "Ambergy?" "Yes," "What is an orca, you know to humans?" she was about to answer when the bell rang for lunch. and ambergy asks "Can I have lunch with you?" you look at her for a moment and say "Sure, but my question..." "Oh right its a killer whale." you ask her "What do killer whales eat?" "Ummm...Just about whatever will fit in their mouth's. Why?" you look at her in shock at this point and say "Does that mean your asking me to lunch, was infact asking if you could have me for lunch!" "What? No! I wouldn't do that, I brought a lunch with me from home....."
1411112222.title: Miss Talon comes in, but Ambergy can't stop...

choices: ... will you sit with the 2 of us?"
14111122222.content:
… this is when you apologize.” As Ambergy just looks at you while holding you in front of her face. As you look Ambergy in the eye and say, “I’m sorry if I hurt your feelings, Ambergy… so-o-o-o… lunch.”
As Ambergy lowers her hand from her face though continues to hold you gently, heads towards Catherine who was already there and had already started her lunch… as she places me down on the table they were sitting at and I simply say, “Hello, Catherine…” as she swallows down what was left of her lunch, and gives me a little wave.

Not long after Ambergy finished her lunch the bell *rang, and the 3 of us (yourself, Ambergy and Catherine) headed back to class with you being held in Catherine’s hand.
As on the walk back to class I notice that they were whispering to one another… and constantly looking down at me until Ambergy said, “Okay I’ll ask him…”
14111122222.title: Ambergy picks you up and says "This is when...

choices: Catherine picks you up and holds onto you for the rest of the day
Ambergy picks you up and holds onto you for the rest of the day
141111222221.content:
"Why not I've been doing that all day haven't I..." I answered.
As Ambergy started to blush a little, when we got back to class there was me sitting on the desk out of tired being so tired from what has happened through out the rest of the day.
And al the girls are doing is looking down at me every now and again and 'giggling...' whenever I looked back up at them. Even if I did have a pain in the back of my neck.
141111222221.title: ... will you sit with the 2 of us?"

choices: Jean,A Kind but Hyper Racoon Girl
144.content:
You really couldn't believe this.You sat in the back seat of your family's old beat-up minivan,with your Mom and Dad in the front seat,driving you to your first day in High School.But,it was going to be rather different.A high school with Anthro's 10,000x the size of a human.

Yeah,a new planet was found that contained the titantic beings.It seemed the World Leaders wanted to create a link between the two planets,and chose one person to go to High School on the other planet.Against impossible odds,you were chosen.Great.....

Finally Dad pulled the minivan to a stop in front of a massive plain."Son..."He said,turning around to look at you."....Erm,good luck."He said,giving a weak smile.Yeah,best pep talk ever.Your Mom seemed to be crying.You opened the door,and stepped out.

Dad and Mom gave you one last wave goodbye,and drove off.At first,you just stood there for a few minutes.Then,the ground began to shake violently.A mountain in the distance moved closer.Wait,that wasn't a mountain,it was the footpaw....or claw...of an Anthro!!
144.title: High School,Start!

choices: She picks you up gently and takes you to High School
She picks you up gently and takes you on a tour of the school
She picks you up gently and shows you to her friends
1441.content:
"Ohhmigosssh!"

The phrase 'Oh My Gosh' all jumbled together,you recognized it due to being used to hyperactive speech,considering how fast a cousin of yours talked on her cellphone.What caught you off guard was how...loud the voice was.The voice of your first Anthro....it sounded feminine,but it was so booming....imagine a giant's voice from a children's voice television show,and magnify that by 10,000 times.Your very first meeting with an Anthro was a female,and a hyperactive one at that.

You couldn't help but stare in amazement.The furry mountains in the distance,which were supposed to be the anthro's footpaws,covered many miles in just a few seconds.It would have taken you hours just to walk half the distance this Anthro's single stride just took.This female Anthro brought her footpaws down right in front of you,creating booming quakes that nearly rocked you off your feet and shook the land around you.You looked up,mouth agape with the amazement from earlier.You couldn't even barely see past her footpaws.They were simply grey-furred walls that rose for thousands of feet.

"Hello!"The Giantess Anthro spoke down to you in that fast speech of hers."H-hello...."You replied,giving a weak wave upwards.You couldn't even tell if she could see the wave,let alone hear you."I can't believe it!Your the human everybody's talking about!And I was picked to be your 'Partner'."

You really hoped you would get used to her fast speech soon,or it would get annoying quick.

"I'm Jean,a Raccoon.I'm glad to meet you!!"She giggled.You said your name just to be polite."And uh...I'm a human."You guessed it was customary for Anthro's to state their species after their name.

"Okay,let's get going!Our Freshman year starts soon!"
1441.title: First Meeting

14411.content:
Bending down,Jean reached toards you,giving you a good view of the rest of this titaness.She indeed was a raccoon.Her fur was dark grey,with variations in shades here and there.Her face,so high above,so much higher than the clouds and the moutains,looked almost cute with the 'mask' that formed on her face.Her ears were perked and pointy,and she had a athletic build.

Her hand descended upon you,you gulped in fear despite how hyperactively kind she seemed.You expected a painful and rough ride,but no...Jean was so gentle,as if she dealt with somebody your size all the time.She clasped you between the black claws that grew from her fingers,making you think more about the Anthro body.a perfect blend of human and animal.She had a human hand,but furred and she even had a pad where her palm was.She gently placed you on said paw pad,and brought her hand closer to her face.

"Shall we get going?You're going to love High School!"She said,with a giggle added afterwards.Jean began walking towards the High School,a mere three minute walk for her,three months for you.

She arrived on campus,her backpack slung over her shoulder,and you on her landscape-sized pawpad.

What's your first period class?
14411.title: High School Days

144112.content: You asked "What's our first class?" In a load booming voice Jean said "Our first period class is..."
144112.title: Reader's Choice

choices: You have to stay in here.
1441121.content: “...Gym. Let’s go!” She begins walking through the hallway with her hand cupped around you securing you on her hand. Since she was absolutely gigantic you could feel every step she took, making you jump into the air a few inches every few seconds. While making your way to the gym Jean shows you around the school, showing you every class and other rooms.”that’s the science class, and beside that is the lab. Also I had this question I wanted to ask you...” You respond with “What is it?” “Well, how does it feel being that tiny? Knowing that one of us could crush you?” “Well I’ve never been scared of it, because I can’t be crushed or die really” Jean looks at you with shock “ So like I could land on you while we like, do some sports and you’d be perfectly fine?” “Yep, I’ve even been swallowed once before, and had to come out the “natural” way.” Jean looks forward absent mindedly and says quietly “woah...” no doubt thoughts flying around in her mind.Eventually you felt her movements slow as you realize you were in the change room, and that you were being raised towards somewhere. “Erm... I don’t have any pockets or anything to put you in, so...
1441121.title: Gym class

choices: You exchange stories about each other on the way to class
1442.content:
All you could do was stare at the huge grey-ish mountains approaching you, the ground shaking violently. You were able to somewhat make out what those large as they came closer, and you came to a conclusion that they were in fact....TALONS! "Is this...anthro.....a.......?" Your thoughts were interrupted by a voice of some sort.

"Where is this......?" You heard a raspy, rather awkward sounding voice in the distance. But all you could do was stand there and take in the sight of two pairs of large bird claws stamping in your very direction, the sunlight partially reflecting off of the claws, making them shine a little. "Uhhhhh.....hooman? Hewman? Uhh, haman?" The strange voice questioned with a confused sounding tone to it.

"And how do you pronounce this name?" The voice questioning itself again. The glimmering talons now closer to you.

"What am I doing here?!" You ask yourself in a panicking tone. "There's a giant bird walking towards me, with no idea how to pronounce my name or species, and is UNAWARE of the fact that I'm in his path! I gotta get outta the way!" You said to yourself snapping out of the trance the giant shining claws have put you under. With the claws now at a dangerous distance you try to thrust your body out of the bird's deadly path, you fumble on your clumsy self and fall flat on your back. Once again, you hear the strange voice "He should be right here, where is he?" The bird asked himself again, his steps becoming more slow and soft.

As you lay on your back, what you see is something completely unimaginable. A giant colorful body, mixtures of red, blue, yellow, and green, and a large white beak with some black mixed in, with two large eyes looking at what looks like a piece of paper in his feathered hand, still unaware of the small creature he is about to step on. Despite your current situation, you just lay there and stare at the beauty of this god-like avian.

"Maybe this guy's further ahead" The raspy voice said, the voice being no longer distant "Still don't know how to say this name...."

Then, the booming of his steps picked up again and just like that you snapped out of your little bird watching session.

"Gah! I forgot! Giant talons of doom!" You shout.

But it was too late, a glimmering clawed foot hovered above you, and all you could do was stare at it, getting in every detail of the rough-skinned looking foot as it closed in on you, noticing some small twigs and leaves stuck in the creases of the giant's toes.

"Not like this!" You sob, bracing for a painful end to your young life.

With your eyes tightly closed you feel a powerful tremor and loud sound of cracking.

"Am I.....?" You whimper, afraid to open your eyes.

Just then you hear

"Well, he should be RIGHT here" A familiar voice said in a confident tone.

After hearing that you quickly open your eyes.

"Huh?!" You gasp to yourself. "I'm not....dead?"

You hastily gather your bearings and observe your surroundings and notice that you appear to be in some cave, or at the bottom of a ravine because you see light shining through the top. Then it hit you.

"Oh jeez! Don't tell me I'm......" You try not to accept the truth until you look up and see the a colorful head looking around curiously in the opening of the ravine.

"In between his toes...." You sigh to yourself. Then something else strikes you as you look at the walls that are his toes.

"Man...I'm so small....well....at least he stopped walking for now."

You look around your new environment. "How can I get this guy's attention?"

Being trapped between two toes surprisingly gave you much needed pacing space. Then after a moment, you come up with a plan.

"Ok, what if I tried this?" You walked over to the "walls" and began poking and gently sliding your fingers across the gray rough surface.

"Hehehe..." You hear a laughter building up in the bird's voice.

"Ohh you felt that huh?" You chuckle to yourself as you continue.

The "walls" started to slowly move up and down and the laughter from above intensified.

"Hehehe who's doing that? Heheehe"

The bird looked down raising the foot that had imprisoned you and at last, you saw the light again.

You sighed with relief as the colossal toes released you and the outside world was now visible once more.

"OH! I'm so sorry!" The avian's voice boomed as he noticed you standing where his foot was. "Are you the...uhh hewman?" He asked nervously taking a few big steps back.

You looked at the nervous face on the colorful bird, his pupils wide and his beak gaping looking down at you.

"Uhhh...Yes!" You shout trying not to quiver in your voice.

"Oh! I am so very, very sorry!" The bird apologized again, carefully kneeling down to get a better view of you.

"Heh it's nothing! I'm Jeremy by the way!" You hold out your hand to the majestic being.

"A handshake? Oh! Yes! Sorry!" He holds out a massive blue feathered finger for you to grab.

While you were trying to shake the feather that was bigger than a house, the bird spoke again.

"Oh where are my manners? I'm William! It's a huge pleasure Jeremy!" He said cheerfully.

"Likewise William!" You reply, letting go of his finger.

"I hope your travel here was not too tiresome." William said, the voice forming a more formal tone.

"Well it was long...but I hope it will pay off in the end as we learn about each other." You politely reply.

"Yes of course! Don't worry Jeremy! You're journey will not go in vain!" William reassured you.

"Well I guess we should get going" You suggest to him.

"Ah! Yes, let's be on our way!" He said with haste in his voice.

"Keep in mind though...this place is..well...different than your schools Jeremy" William began to explain to you. "By protocol I must...carry you, if that is fine, to your classes and keep a constant watch on you."

"Not a problem at all! I completely understand." You told William. "I know they can't have a little bag of flesh running around getting stepped on...heheheh" You joked with him.

He smiled "Well then, Let's be off!" He ordered, laying his feathered hand on the ground before you. "Hop on! No time to waste!" He ordered again.

You climbed onto his hand, feeling the soft feathers as you get on.

"Ok, next stop...." He said, slowly standing up. "History class!"

He turned around and began walking with you in his palm.

"And we're off!"
1442.title: William,a rather Snobbish Parrot Boy

choices: "Class, allow me to introduce our new student!"
14423.content:
After a few minutes of awkward silence while being carried on a large red plane of feathers surrounded by five blue mountains, with the constant sound of an ambient rumbling, you decide to break the ice.

"So William..." You begin, turning your attention to the giant face looking straight ahead.

"...Tell me about yourself" You finish speaking your request.

Then, a pair of giant eyes look down on you, the beaked face still with its attention forward.

"Well...." He starts to reply in a slight raspy tone. "My name is William, as you already know...heh" He lets out a few small chuckles. "I'm seventeen years old..." He continues. "And not to brag but I'm part of a special club here in the school that's exclusive to high class avians such as *ahem* myself." He stated with some cockiness leaking from his tone.

"Oh boy..." You murmur to yourself. "That explains the clothes I guess." You mumble again examining what you can of his clothing. You had to admit though, this bird dressed pretty classy. A sky blue polo with what looked like a gold and brown coat of arms being held up by two magnificent looking birds at the top right of the torso. Dark brown slacks that look pretty costly, and in fact while you he was picking you up, you noticed a huge chrome band around his left wrist, that could very well be a fancy watch of sorts. You had a feeling you weren't the only reason why he dressed that way. You return your attention to the giant watchful eyes and listen some more.

"And also," He continues. "The leader of the club is an eagle named George, and guess what?" He asks.

"Uhhh...What?" You reply, bracing for another harmless bragging.

"He's the teacher of the history class!" He exclaims happily. "And when he heard I was going to be the partner of an alien, he said he was going to make a special welcome for you!" William happily shouted. "I might have ruined the surprise but I thought since you're most likely a nervous wreck about this whole thing you could use some comforting words." He says smiling at you.

"W-wow...I uhh, don't know what to say. Thanks!" Just like that, your almost overwhelming anxiety vanished and for once you felt safe standing on this giant parrot's hand, and the rumbling footsteps didn't seem to bother you anymore. You just smiled at him and actually sat down in his titanic palm and relaxed for once.

William chuckles. "Feeling better? Heh. Just sit back and enjoy your ride on the SS William!" He jokingly orders.

You laugh a little with him and begin to lay down in the feathered plane, your arms crossed behind your head when suddenly you remember.

"Oh yeah!" You shout. "Forgot to tell you a little about myself!" You remind William.

Just then, a loud ringing noise, making you cover your ears begins to go off.

"Oh! That would be the bell!" Williams states as the deafening ringing stops. "We better hurry!"

Shortly after he said that, the rumbling you heard was becoming even more constant, and less ambient, yet it doesn't feel like William is moving faster. You look forward and what you see at the end of the seemingly infinite corridor of giant lockers paralyzes you. Doors that could very well match the size of Mount Everest begin to slowly open, followed by louder rumbling and what sounds like a thousand voices talking. Then you see it, dozens of colossal beings pour out of the doorways. You can make out some of the creatures as they walk through. Cats, some dogs, a crow with its arm wrapped around a hawk's shoulders as if they're good buddies, a lion talking with what looks like a bright green lizard and some other unique animals, all walking to their destination without a care in the world. You wish you could say the same for yourself.

"Don't worry, history class isn't that way." A raspy voice you've come to love assures you.

You sigh and relax in his palm again. "That's a relief!"

"In fact, it's in this room right here!" He states again, presenting you to a door with a thin but very large window revealing some desks with some anthros already filling in some spots, a bookshelf with a globe on top of it, and a poster with what looks like the flags of Earth's countries being displayed, with an eagle wearing an outfit similar to William's sitting in a desk with mountains of paperwork on it.

"That's him! That's George!" William excitingly told you. "You'll get along with him just fine, trust me!" He said while using his free hand to open the door.

The door made a slight creak that was probably nothing to William, but to you it was pretty loud. You feel a cool gush of air overcome you as enter the room, followed by the attention of the well-dressed eagle and some other anthro students turning to you and your friend.

"Hello Mr. Getty!" William shouts to the majestic bird raising his free hand as a greeting.

The eagle examines him for a moment and notices you in his hand. "Well a fine 'hello' to you too William! And a very special 'hello' to you little guy!" He says in a smooth and polite tone. He gets out of his desk then approaches you and William then offers a gigantic brown feathered finger as a handshake. "It's a huge pleasure to meet you! I'm George! But you can call me Mr. Getty in case you didn't hear William." He chuckles and smiles at you with a large yellow beak.

"Hello Mr. Getty!" I'm Jeremy! You can call me 'Little Guy' if you want though!" You joke with him as you try to shake his building of a finger.

"Heheheh" Mr. Getty lets out a few laughs and looks at William. "So have you two been getting along?" He asks.

"Yup!" William says gleefully.

"That's good!" Mr. Getty replies. "Now I'm pretty sure you two want to get settled." He says pointing to a desk in the front row, near his own desk. "There's your desk William, along with yours, Jeremy."

"Thanks Mr. G!" William shouts as he makes his to the desk.

As you neared the desk, you saw some anthros looking at you, one of them being that very same crow with his hawk friend sitting next him. As you both make it to the desk, William lowers you onto a vast emptiness of dark wood, a few inches from your desk. You look around the room a bit before sitting down, you notice the 'Earth's Countries' poster along with a city of books lined up in some shelves. Then you feel a slight tremor that almost makes you lose your balance, an avalanche of colors descending from a distance. It was only William taking his seat as gently as he could.

"Sorry." William says, adjusting himself to the chair.

"No problem." You reassure him as you sit down.

Then, the booming ringing sounded again. Once again you're covering your ears wincing, trying desperately to block it out when all of a sudden everything goes black and the sound is now toned down to a bearable volume.

"What the...?" You opened your eyes. "What happened?"

The ringing noise then stopped and you felt another tremor as light began to fill your vision. A bunch of colorful mountains begin to move away from you, followed by a familiar voice.

"Oh man, that must have been really loud for you! Sorry about that." William says in a concerned tone. "Did that hand thing help with the sound?" He asks.

"Y-yeah." You tell him. "Thanks, pal. Don't worry. I'll get used to it."

"I hope so!" He says, looking over you as if he was your parent.

As the time passed, more anthro students fill the room, all looking at you as they walk by. All you can do is hope this year goes by painlessly. At least you have some new friends to help you out.

14431.content:
Looking up you see a large hoof that must go on for almost half a mile. Up further you can see jean covered legs stretching up to a white muscle tee. This Anthro is tall, maybe 6'9" in their measurements. After only a few seconds the Anthro began squatting down in front of you and his thunderous voice booms: "Hey there, you must be _________. I'm your partner, welcome to High School buddy!" The Anthro then gently picks you up and begins bringing you to his face. The hand you are sitting on is more comfortable than you had expected. It isn't a hard hoof-like thing, instead it is similar to a human hand but it is fur-covered and a little harder, well maybe not harder but the flesh feels more... compact. Soon you are in front of the giant's face and his large brown eyes are focused on you. You are more than a little nervous and he must have noticed it too because he starts patting you on the back with a finger and tying to comfort you.

"Hey I'm sorry little guy, I know it must be scary to be that small compared to me, but you need to get used to being handled, anyway I'm Ethan." The titan smiles and extends a finger from his free hand, presumably for you to shake. You reach out your hand and grab the appendage but that is pretty much all you can do because of the sheer size of it. Ethan lets out a chuckle and lightly moves the finger for you. Anthros must have great self control.

"So you said you're my partner, what does that mean?" you ask.

"Well you see the school selected me to carry you from class to class, protect you from any hostile Anthros, you know things like that."

"What do you mean hostile Anthros?" You ask feeling a little nervous.

"Sadly there are some Anthros that don't want humans as their equals and will probably want to make you feel a little less than welcome. But don't worry, most of us aren't like that. Besides, to get to you they'll have to go through me." Considering his height and build that was very reassuring. Suddenly the bell starts to ring
"Looks like it's time for home-room, lets go." Ethan says as he walks toward the building.

Maybe this wasn't going to be so bad after all...
14431.title: Partners

144312.content:
As you and Ethan walk to the building, an anthro husky and an anthro cheetah approaches both of you. "Heh hey look Otto, the HUMAN has arrived!" said the husky with a cocky tone in his voice, "Humans? aren't they those little bags of flesh that tend to get stepped on alot?" replies the cheetahas they both aproach you and Ethan. The two cocky anthros finally get to the both of you, the husky staring at Ethan and the cheetah staring at you.

"Hey Ethan....can I hold that human for a minute? I just want to see him, hehehe" says the husky snickering. "Not on your li..." Just then the cheetah swipes you from Ethans hand, you didn't feel a thing it was so swift! As your being held by your will in the cheetah's paw your still trying to absorb whats happening. "What the...?! Give him back!" Ethan shouts to the cheetah with an angry expression on his face.

"Go Otto! run away with that ounce of flesh!" The husky said starting to block Ethan from any movement. You feel intense rumbling in the cheetah's paw as he runs away to who knows where. You cant see anything, the cheetah closed his paw he was carrying you in but you still feel the rumbling. All you hear is loud rustling of the cheetah's cloths as he escapes with his "prize".

"Hahahaha, when Damian gets here we're gonna have LOADS of fun lil guy!" the cheetah says opening his paw back up so you can see again. What you see is something you would see in a nightmare, rows and rows of grey lockers, tiled floors and wood benches, you finally realise your in the locker rooms! Minutes later you hear thundering footsteps slowly getting louder with every step, you pray its Ethan but it's not, it's none other than that cocky husky.

"Awsome! I see you got the flesh bag here safe n' sound" the husky says pleased with the sight of the cheetah holding you. Right now your not sure what to be anymore, confused or really scared, just then the husky says "Otto....we still a half hour of fun with this guy til' second period. "What should we do Damian?" The cheetah asks looking at you with an evil grin.

choices: Max, the Husky, cheerful to a fault, this athlete shares your math major.
Chester, the black cat, somewhat shy but a biology major like you.
Jasmine, the dragon.  She, like your father before you, is a poli-sci major.
145.content:
You couldn't help but be nervous as you stood by the cargo container that contained your belongings, your stomach turning bellyflops from both nervousness and an empty stomach.

Once more, while you waited for your contact the occurrences of the last few years rattled around in your head. The enormous alien visitors who, after finding Earth, became your home planet's greatest benefactors, gladly supplying the tiny world with the natural resources Earth had all but exhausted. Your father, the diplomat, had been one of the first voyagers from home to visit their planet, securing the amazing technology for space travel for your homeworld so that a 'hyper space' bridge could be built between the two worlds.

As a show of good faith in the titanic aliens, you agreed, with some pressure from your father to attend college on their world. One of only five students of your scale who were allowed to attend the universities of the titanic planet, to further your studies.

Your senses were only snapped back to the present by the distant sound of a footfall, the deep rumbling vibration still miles off but causing you to, momentarily, reconsider this option. . .

Still, through e-mail, you'd already met your roommate to be, a fur who shared your major and would serve as your 'private limo' to all your various classes. Still, when you caught first sight of him in the doorway you couldn't help but gasp. The photos you'd seen of him did little to ready you for the experience of meeting a 15 mile tall fur.

With a nervous smile, you cup your hand to your mouth calling up to your roommate from the transport platform you've been waiting on.

And your roommate is . . .
145.title: College Life on the Big Campus

choices: "We take you back to our Dorm to get you settled in."
"The dean said we need to stop in the office to drop of your final transcripts."
1451.content:
Max is grinning from ear to ear as those massive ears swivel at the sound of your voice, his every footfall threatening to shake you off your feet as he pads closer.

Towering over you, the canid's tail waggles happily as he waits for the transport's door to cycle open so he can retrieve you. Of course, this gives you a few moments to try and really take in the scale of the big dog.

Big, unfortunately, is something of an understatement. You have trouble even seeing clearly past his ankles, the tallest skyscrapers from your homeworld would just barely clear his toes. Miles of white and gray fur cover the hulking dog, the fur so thick you could easily get lost in it.

With a hiss, the door finally opens, the breeze stirred up by the dog's wagging, miles long tail ruffling your own clothing as you grin bashfully, nervously up at him. The big dog drops to his knees, the impact knocking you right off your feet as you look up at him in awe.

"Hey man! It's great to finally meet you in person!" The dog's voice is so loud it almost hurts even through the earplugs you're already wearing, rumbling deep throguh your bones. The massive dog extends a finger to you in greeting, the black, leathery pad so large your entire house and yard could fit on it with room to spare.

"Hey, Max, it's nice to meet you." You reach up, placing your entire hand against his fingertip in what you hope is close enough to a handshake. "So what's the game plan here?"

Max grins doggishly, his tongue poking out from between his lips as he replies . . .
1451.title: Meeting Max

choices: Bed?  Oh.  I thought you'd sleep with me!
There's a special room set up for you right under my bed.
14511.content:
Every step Max takes is enough to shake the fillings out of your teeth as you sit in his paw, your eyes riveted to the titanic husky that carries you and the cargo container that holds all your belongings in a single hand. . . a hand that could fit your entire hometown in it easily.

It was still taking some time to take all this in. Max, despite his good nature, was a walking force of nature, easily large enough that he would be head and shoulders above cloud level at home. On occasion you'd catch movement at the edge of your horizon, the massive dog's fingers rising and falling at the edge of the paw, twitching at the ticklish sensation you presented.

He smiles widely down at you as you entered the brightly lit dorm room, a happy bark escaping his muzzle.

"Here we are, roomie! Home sweet home." The view, even from between Max's fingers, was breathtaking. The bed alone was large enough to hold the entire island of Manhattan, the thick plush carpeting so dense that skyscrapers could be lost in it's shag.

You force a nervous smile again as you look up towards Max to inquire as to where you're supposed to sleep; the fact that there's only one bed hasn't escaped your attention.

Of course, that smile is wiped away instantly when the colossal dog replies. . .
14511.title: Biggest dorm room EVER.

choices: Straight as an arrow, but loves to yank your chain.
Just as interested as you as you are him, but knows it couldn't possibly work.
145111.content:
The titan husky arches an eyebrow as he holds you before that miles wide face, his teeth (each bigger than a building) visible as he grins widely. "You know there's plenty of room in my bed, lil' man. Why not join me instead of crashing on that little cot they got for you?"

Your jaw hits the floor as you consider the implications of that, your face flushing red as you blush fiercely, hoping the husky can't quite make out just how antsy the mere suggestion of that has made you.

The two of you had been in e-mail correspondence for years before today and, although it's the first time you've met him face to face, the big dog probably knew more about you than your own parents. You were rather frank with him in regards to your own preferences and interests, rather than waiting for it to become a possible issue once you'd moved in with him.

The dog knows just how badly you want him, and it shows in that playful grin. Fortunately, you know him pretty well too, well enough to know that he's . .
145111.title: Keeping up with the big dog

1451111.content:
"just teas'n you know, but it does get cold at night" he said with a pranksters grin, he sets you down and you head to bed for the night...

Next. Day -
1451111.title: Straight as an arrow, but loves to yank your ch...

choices: The big dog's face fills your vision. He's been watching you for a while.
All you can see is an immense pair of footpaws. He had some unpacking to do too.
1451112.content:
"You're so damn adorable when you're embarassed. If I weren't worried about inhaling you, I'd kiss you right now, little man."

The dog chuckled, a low rumbling thunder that rocked you right off your feet, falling onto the expansive leathery pads of the dog's paw. "Okay, okay. Enough with the cocktease act, hon. Set me down so I can unpack before my shorts explode."

Another chuckle rocks your world, half-deafening you as you're lowered all the way to the floor. It takes you several minutes to slide down between his massive digits, jogging clear of his massive paw before it's lifted away, a gentle flick landing the multi-ton cargo container on the floor behind you. It's a good thing it's well insulated or you'd have some broken toys.

You go about busying yourself in the sprawling 'bedroom' under Max's mattress. The whole of New York City could fit in what passes for your quarters, but still you rapidly unpack your belongings into the dressers and shelves provided.

A nice long shower helps ease your nerves a bit after the rigors of extra-dimensional travel and the interesting occasion of meeting Max face to face for the first time, but the moment you climb out, you find yourself staring at the very source of that stress again; the first thing that your eyes meet is. . .
1451112.title: Big flirt.

choices: kiss that great chin. "You're too much, Max.  And you're all mine."
scritch at his cheek with a smile. "Would you mind if we got some food?"
14511121.content:
You can't help but yelp as you step from the shower, fumbling for a towel as you see those great blue eyes watching you intently, a shy smile splitting Max's muzzle as he chuckles. "Sorry. I didn't want to interrupt."

He's just lying there, his chin resting on the floor before you as his warm breath washes over you in short, powerful bursts, each one a warm gust of wind that ruffles your hair as you hastily try to pull on some clothes.

The dog doesn't seem to intend to move as he watches you dress, a cool breeze against your wet skin indicating that his tail is probably wagging quite happily as he watches you fumble to pull on your shirt. You knew you'd have some problems with living with Max, you'd always had a thing for furries and fantasies about giant guys.

But nothing like this. And you NEVER thought for an instant that they could come true.

Yet, right there before you, panting happily as you jog back towards his face, lies the object of your affection, your adolescent fantasies come to life.

The question is, what do you do? Returning his obvious affection could cause problems down the road, no matter how badly you want to, and a physical relationship is simply out of the question. Still, even if you couldn't feel THAT way about the titan pup, you've found yourself a friend for life, given what you know about the unswaying loyalty of huskies.

There's no sense in trying to draw this out, you need to make this decision now, before any feelings are hurt. Smiling as you finally reach his face once more, you . . .
14511121.title: Big Crush

choices: to the bookstore.  We need to get the last of my books for our classes.
Cafeteria.  I need some food in this belly before you start looking edible.
145111211.content:
Even with his chin lying on the floor before you, his lower lip is a good 800' over your head. . . but that hardly stops you from leaning in and pressing your lips to the fluffy chin, planting the tiniest of kisses there.

You're rewarded with a surprised yelp as the titan of a dog suddenly lunges backwards, banging his head on the underside of his own bed with a clang that hurts your ears. You wince as he sits up, rubbing his head and those massive triangular ears with his paw, letting out a whine of pain.

"Oh, damn! Max, I'm sorry! I didn't mean to startle you like that." He had to have clipped his head pretty good, tufts of his fur still drifting slowly to the ground around you from where they'd been pulled free of his head by the bedframe's springs.

The big dog blushed, his ears flushing a bright red as he smiles through the pain, chuckling as he watches your tiny form jogging across the expanse of carpeting towards his knees. "S'okay. . .s'okay, wee man. I'm good. I just wasn't expecting that."

You grin as you reach that demin clad knee, the fabric so thick that you know he can't possibly feel your little hand against his leg as you pat his knee. "Sorry. I got kinda caught up in the moment. . . I. . . wow. This got awkward real quick. Maybe we need a change of scenery. Get out of this room and see the campus. God knows we both have alot to do before classes start tomorrow."

Max grins, nodding reluctantly. "Okay. We do have things to get done, but this conversation isn't over by a long shot. Let's go . . .
145111211.title: Mega Macro Mate? Maybe.

choices: Thankfully, I'm doing most of my studies from the room.  Less hazardous.
Especially when I find myself in a room with, what,  fifty bigguns your size.
1451112112.content:
The big dog sweeps you off your feet and plunks you down atop his head so fast that your head spins, you scramble across the top of his head, through the dull gray fur until you reach the base of one of those towering ears, settling into the warmth of the soft skin there as your guide to the campus carries you to the cafeteria.

On the way, Max tries to engage in small talk, getting more than one odd look from some of his fellow titans since he seemed to be talking to himself, but truth be told you were far too engrossed in the view around you to grasp most of the conversation. Even as the smells of the food started overwhelming you, you hardly noticed that you were in the line for lunch. . . even longer still until you realized that Max had said your name three times.

"Oh, christ. . .sorry, Maxie. I was distracted." You admit sheepishly, rubbing the back of your neck as you lean against that towering ear even as it swivels to catch your reply. "I'm still trying to get used to being the only flea here. . . I haven't seen a single person here yet that my home town couldn't fit on."

Max chuckled as he started loading up his own tray with food. "S' okay. Hopefully you'll get used to this fairly quickly. Hate for you to get so distracted that you can't focus on your studies. I don' want my little roomie to get booted so early in the semester. Who'll I flirt with?"

"Yeah. Who's brain will you melt with your hotness is more like it." You joke, creeping forwards to look down over the big dog's brow, trying to watch what food is being taken. "Don't forget to get me some too, big dog. I could eat a horse."

"Heh. A horse could inhale you. . . especially Mr Phetteler. Teaches basic trig, big ol' draft horse. Makes me look like a pup." Max jokes as he slides his ID card through the reader, paying for the meal before proceeding to the tables.

"Yeah. Classes are going to get interesting. . .
1451112112.title: Fooooood!

choices: very eager to meet the first human. You're practically famous, a tiny alien.
more than a little insulted by your presence.  Like a bug at the dinner table.
14511121121.content:
"I'd be a little worried about going to all of our classes with everyone, but I'll be doing most of my studying from the room, watching the classes over webcam. The Dean insisted, for the sake of safety." Even as you rambled, the big dog lifted a huge concave slab of steel to the top of his head, so immense it took you a few long moments to realize that it was a spoon, the handle vanishing between Max's fluffy fingers.

Climbing into the spoon, you're lowered to the tabletop where Max doles out a portion of his own meal for you; a single kernel of corn, a single piece of ground beef from his sloppy joe. To him it's next to nothing; but you could feast on it for a week straight and never finish.

In fact, you're so focused on the slow, steady actions of your roommate as he portions out your meal that you, at first, failed to notice the other mammoth forms around you, staring in silence at the tiny figure on the table top.

"Guys," Max boomed, gesturing towards you in the spoon, "This is my roommate. Buddy, these are the gang. We've been best friends since . . . god, forever."

An coyote, a dragon, a german shepard, a raccoon and a fox, all looking wide eyed down at the impossibly tiny spectacle before them, a human so tiny that he's almost invisible between the two tiny samplings of food.

With a quiet, nervous wave, you look up a them, squeaking out a 'Hello'.

These had to be Max's friends and, at first glance you can see that this could be a very awkward meal, since they're all. . .
14511121121.title: A light lunch.

choices: I'm going out to party with them tonight,  You're welcome to come.
They've all volunteered to help get you around if I'm not available.
145111211211.content:
From stunned silence to an explosion of constant chatter and joking, the titanic beings around you burst back into motion, ribbing at each other and accusing Max of robbing a very, very small cradle.

The meal seems to fly by as you try to get to know Max's friends; the shy fox who's got his nose in a book for most of the meal, the raccoon who barely sets down his video game long enough to eat. The 'yote and the dragon seem to be racing to make the worst jokes faster, fighting to get poor Max to blush, while the german shepard picks at his meal, he seems to eat even less than you do!

They seem like a good bunch of people, a good sign for you since you're probably going to be seeing these guys alot in your time here. There's something about them that makes you feel right at home, if not a little homesick yourself for your old friends.

It isn't long before the din of the conversation dies down though, each of them having to retreat to their own rooms or head off to the first of their classes until, once again, it's just yourself and Max in the corner of the crowded caffeteria.

"Hope that wasn't too much for you, wee man." He jokes, turning his smiling face back down towards you as he carefully lifts the spoon you're seated in. His ears are still flushed red with a tinge of embarassment as he speaks, letting you climb out onto his paw. "Those guys are like family to me."

"Nono, Max, they're great. Everything you warned me about and more."

Max chuckled, his tail wagging as he slips out of his chair, his taco-scented breath washing over you as he carries you towards the exit. "Well that's good. You'll be seeing alot of them. . .
145111211211.title: Aw! What a cute lil' alien!

choices: I don't think it's the best idea, Max.
1451112112111.content:
"A party? You've got to be kidding." You gawk as you look up at Max, gripping a strand of fur for balance as he starts carrying you back towards your shared room, his every footfall threatening to bounce you clear out of his palm.

"Oh, it's nothing huge. It'll just be me and the five of them. . .and you, of course, if you want to go. We all work with the sudent association to help get everything ready in the dorms before all the other students work here. It's alot of hard work, but it's all done now that school starts tomorrow. We figure we need a night off before classes begin." He pauses, grinning almost wolfishly down at you. "Besides, you can't deny that you need a little something to take the edge off being here with all of us."

Max did have a point. A night of relaxing after all the work you'd done, all the packing and preparations to come live here with them. . . it was well deserved. You were fairly sure you could trust Max, but the others? Would they be as well behaved once they had a few drinks in them? Would it be safe?

Still Max's face filled your vision, the big dog's ears perked with anticipation as he awaited your reply.
1451112112111.title: Party planning puppy

choices: No, Maxie, it's okay.  I . . . don't put me down yet.  Let's chill. In your bed.
I'm sorry, Max.  We both got carried away.  I'm supposed to be a diplomat.
14511121121111.content:
You can't help but laugh, shaking your head a bit at the sight of the titanic dog giving you what you can only think of as 'puppy dog eyes'. "Oh, god. . . I'm gonna regret this, but yeah. I'll go with."

Max all but jumped with joy, a yip of excitement deafening you for a moment even as he rambled on about the party, trying to reassure you how much fun was going to be had. He seemed genuinely excited that you were willing to hang out with his friends, his tail wagging so quickly you can hear it smacking against his clothes.

Of course, you expected him to be happy. . . what you didn't expect was the gut wrenching vertigo as you were lifted over a few miles towards that smiling muzzle of his, his soft black lips parting ever-so-slightly as they flatten you against his leathery paw pad in a kiss that, quite literally, takes your breath away.

That first few seconds of panic were washed away with the the low rumble of Max's breath washing over you as you reveled in the feeling of his soft lips completely covering every inch of your body, your fingers curling against the pillowy surface as you kiss back despite yourself.

But as suddenly as the kiss started, it was over, the dog looking both shocked and embarassed at what he'd just done, his tail tucking instinctively between his legs as he chewed on his lower lip. If only he could see you a little more clearly, he'd be able to tell from the bulge in your now damp jeans that the experience wasn't exactly one way.

"Oh . . .goddamn. I'm sorry. I got carried away." Max's great ears folded, both tinged bright red with embarassment as he lowered you towards the floor, near the edge of the bed. "I shouldn't have done that."

"Nono. It's fine Max. . . I mean I. . . " God, you were so embarassed yourself you couldn't even admit how much you loved that. Thank god he could tell. "We could jus' lie down? Talk?"

For a few moments, your view of the outside world is obscured by the bigdog's thick digts as he closes his hand, leaving you to wonder what he's doing. It's not until you're deposited on his bare chest that you realize what just happened; he pulled off his worn Jersey and tossed it way before settling into the bed.

You can't help but be amazed how much warmer it is in the plush acres of fur that cover the rolling hills of firm muscle that are your roommate. From where you stand on his pectoral, you can feel his heartbeat rumbling beneath you, his nipple rising like a hill of rubbery flesh a few yards to your right as you slowly turn, just in awe of the sight before you. . . then you feel the warm breath on your back.

You spin, looking straight up at that handsome muzzle again as it fills your vision, the big dog watching you intently as he softly smiles. "I hope I didn't go to far. Just thought it'd be more comfortable this way."

You nod dumbly as you take a seat, your voice threatening to leave you again as you croak out a response. "Oh. Yeah. This is great!"

"You know I wasn't kidding earlier, right? About you sleeping in the bed with me?" You hear the THUD of distant thunder as he talks, the vibration of his tail smacking against the mattress again as he makes his suggestion. "I'm serious. I'd love to sleep with my little man at night."

"Well. . . I . . . if you think." You stammer, your fingers curling against the firm, warm flesh you're seated on as your mind races. Would that be safe? Would you be able to resist your own temptations to explore the big guy's body? Would he be able to smell your excitement, your arousal at the mere proposal?

*SNIFFFFFF* Your clothes are ruffled, the fur around you tugged towards that massive muzzle as he smiles widely, his tongue panting cutely out between those black lips that fill your vision. "I'll take THAT as a yes."

Apparently he could smell it. That puts the ball squarely in your court.

Max grins as he lies back, lacing his great paws behind his head, the 'ground' beneath you heaving upwards underfoot, becoming even more firm as the muscle tenses, his enormous, muscular arms appearing in the corners of your vision as you keep your eyes on that handsome muzzle. "Okay. I'll settle for 'yet'. . . but we can still just lay here and chill when we're wide awake. And I won't make any jokes about your use of the words 'long and hard'."

Shaking your head in disbelief, you push your way through the soft, warm white fur that stands between you and the big dog's nipple, climing up onto the fleshy nub before taking a seat, not wanting to vanish from sight if you were to recline in the pup's dense fur. Max grins crookedly as he mentions the boys again, those big blue eyes sparkling with mischief as he watches you get comfortable on the rubbery, fleshy hill that is his nipple, the low, rhythmic thunder of his heartbeat picking up a bit under your feet.

You nod as you close your eyes, lying on your side to look up at that handsome, looming visage that's quickly becoming your whole world. "I'll try, Maxxie, but I make no guarantees that I'll be able to sleep like this. Too much manscape to look at."

choices: "...We all grow much larger throughout our lives."
"...Other members of my species are much bigger than this."
1452.content:
The unfathomably large black panther filling the doorway looks around what must to him be a simple room. To you, however, it might as well be a state, the enormous space so large the walls to either side of your are hazy with distance. This monstrous figure immediately fills the space, though, his titanic body filling the door frame for a moment before he steps up to fill -- then overwhelm -- your vision. The lights shining down on you are cut off by his might, and suddenly everything goes black.

You see on the video feed that's been included on your tablet that Chester is peering down at you, his narrowed green eyes piercing to see the speck that you are. When he finally spots you, he purrs and smiles. Rows of sharp teeth bigger than could be believed are revealed, and that simple pleasant noise is rumbling enough to make you feel like your bones could shake apart.

"Hello, Brian," the big cat purred. "Welcome to the University. I'm Chester."

"Oh I know," you say flippantly. "There's really no mistaking you."

Chester's smile brightens. "Heh, I guess not. How was the trip?" The panther lowers down so that he's squatting, but he's still looming over your platform by a good distance. His chest seems to go on forever, and that's replaces by immense shoulders and then a muzzle that could swallow your entire neighborhood in one go. He's close enough now that you can only see his nose. If you crane your head, you can see those enormous green eyes looking down at you, sharply focused. You have to admit, it's a little unnerving being under the gaze of such an immense predator.

"It was all right, thanks." Despite your misgivings, you steel yourself and step forward. You wonder how you must look to this monstrosity, a speck that takes forever to get anywhere. "It was my first time across the hyper bridge. Really impressive, that."

"Thank you." From this distance, you could see the skin underneath Chester's nose darken a little bit, and your video feed was able to capture the folding of his ears, the lowering of his eyes. It was an endearing gesture, all of the hallmarks of shy acknowledgement. Could it be that he was as nervous as you were? "We're quite proud of it, actually. It took us a bit of time figuring out how to shrink everything to your scale on the other end, but we've got some really great micro-engineers to help us out with that."

"Micro-engineers? That sounds intriguing. Is that what your people call us?" You couldn't help but smile at that. It's not the worst name they could have found for the human race.

Chester shook his head and raised a palm that could squash several city blocks flat without even trying. "Oh no. You guys aren't the first little species we've found. Just the latest. And the most interesting." Again, that darkening of the skin underneath his fur. He must do that a lot, you figure. Only most people wouldn't be able to see it under midnight-colored fur.

You picked your way to the edge of the table and jumped on to the vast plain of the cat's palm. The surface of it was quite smooth and warm, and the irregular terrain of it made for slightly difficult travel. Chester tried to keep as still as he could, but the simple act of breathing caused shifts in the landscape that were difficult to compensate for. "Well, that's really kind of you to say. We find you quite interesting too."

The giant's ears perked. He checked his own small video feed to make sure you were secured on his palm before moving to get your cargo container. "Really? You do?"

"Of course we do! It's not every day you meet bipedal, sentient aliens that look like our animals and blown up to...well, incredible proportions." You manage to make it further in to Chester's palm and sit down in a relatively stable crease inside the leathery palmpad. You tap your tablet to make sure he knows you're safe.

"Heh, well, to us everyone else is incredibly small. It's really a surprise to us that there aren't any sentient creatures who've reached our size." He grabbed the cargo container and rose to his full height. The experience was, in a word, insane. Wind whipped around you as your stomach dropped right to your feet. You were lifted several miles in the span of seconds, and the effect was dizzying. Even though Chester was rising and turning slowly, the way he had been trained, you could tell that being carried by this titan would definitely take some getting used to.

"I'm sorry," the cat said. He must have noticed you in the video feed. "Was that too fast?"

"No," you manage to squeak breathlessly. "This is just going to take some getting used to."

Chester chuckled, a booming rumble that shook your body. "You and me both."

The view as you were carried out of the room was nothing short of amazing. Miles of the room whisked by incredibly fast, so that the sterile white and grey walls of the meeting room became a blur. On one side, there was the impossible size of Chester, his torso rising like a sheer, furred cliff stretching miles above and below you. And on the other side, the room became a gigantic hallway, the ceiling well above even the panther's head and the width of it enough for ten of the cats.

"This is...incredible." You look around, trying to guess at how big the hallway is. Really, it could be the size of your home state. Or maybe even continent. To think that it was just a hallway, something to get you from one place to another, was mind-blowing. Without Chester, using your own legs, it would take you days, perhaps weeks, to traverse it.

"Oh, yes, I suppose it is." Chester's purr was starting to become familiar now, as comforting as it was overwhelming. After getting over the initial shock of his size, you find that you like him. "We have to build most buildings for beings of multiple size ranges, though that's somewhat limited here."

"I thought you said that there weren't any other sentient races bigger than you." You couldn't keep the nervousness out of your voice. If there were other, larger creatures here, shouldn't you have been briefed on that?

Chester looks down at you, his tone and expression as reassuring as a 15-mile predator could make himself. "Oh, we are. You mean they didn't tell you?"

You weren't getting a good feeling about this. "Tell me what?"

Chester's ears flick and he looks a bit nervous. Perhaps he hadn't expected to be the one to tell you this. "I was selected because I was a rather small example of my kind..."
1452.title: The Black Panther

choices: ...I will completely respect your personal space and be as scarce as possible."

1453.content:
The huge dragon hears you call for her, and strolls up to the platform, lifting the whole thing between two of her mighty clawed fingers. Squinting through her thick contact lenses, she finally spots you, and exclaims, "Oh, there you are! It's a real pleasure to finally meet you in real life!" Jasmine extends a mile-long pinky finger for you to shake, and you do, although you doubt that Jasmine could even feel you through those thick scales.

Normally, a guy and a girl would never share a dorm room, but this was a very special case. Jasmine, as a matter of fact, has met your father before, when her own father, a diplomat as well, discussed foreign matters with your dad. From what you know, this dragon shares your major for the same reason as you; you both are interested in diplomacy with each other's race.

"Here, little guy, let me carry all of that stuff for you," spoke the dragoness politely, pointing at your relatively dismal stack of supplies. "Sure, Jasmine, that would be a real help," you reply. Taking a satchel from her pocket, Jasmine picked up the entire pile and poked it deep inside. Then, she scooped you up, but thankfully you aren't riding in that satchel. After putting the platform back down, Jasmine started strolling back to campus.

On the way, Jasmine starts talking about the obvious: how small you are. "You know, I just can't get over how tiny you humans are!" she said while still trying to sound respectful. "When we chatted on e-mail, it's so easy to imagine that you are the same size as me, but when I hold you on my finger like this, it's really weird knowing that you are the same human!"

"Yeah, I know what you mean," you answer. As Jasmine starts showing the kindness that you knew about from chatting with her, you slowly start to feel more comfortable with the fact that your house is the size of a grain of salt to her. "So, Jasmine, I have to know, how is this going to work, us being, you know..."

"Don't worry, I'll try to make you as comfortable as possible while you room with me," spoke the dragoness sincerely. "Of course, this means....
