She takes you to your room.
14533.content:
“It really would not be much of an experience for either of us if we did not associate with each other. Besides, my father wants me around you as much as possible. If anything were to happen to you we don’t want to look like a bunch of clumsy giants that are too dangerous to be around your kind. Plus, I am fascinated by how such tiny creatures are just as smart as us and I want to find out everything about you,” Jasmine explained.

“I’m kind of interested in you too. I never even knew creatures of your size existed,” you responded even though you were a little worried about finding out whether of not Jasmine really was a clumsy titan. One little slip on her part and she could crush you like a flea.

“You’re interested in me? But I’m just a normal old dragon. There is nothing special to find out. What you see is what you get,” she said. Considering that you could not even see all of her from where you were that was saying a lot more than she had intended to. You were uncertain about how she really felt about you, but you were definitely in awe of the giant dragoness and more than a little frightened of her size. It might be possible that she was in awe of your small size, but you doubted that she was even the least bit scared of you. That notion just seemed ridiculous to you.

The dragoness approached something that looked vaguely like an incredibly advanced vehicle to you. Like the dragoness, it was large enough to defy your perceptions and you were unable to even look at the entire vehicle before the dragoness stepped in. “This is a fairly standard transport on my world. The ones on campus have been specially modified for your use so you can get around in the event something happens to me. I hope that you will find them adequate,” Jasmine told you. Then she spoke the name of the campus and you were whisked away by the vehicle. Jasmine had positioned you so that you could see out of a window in the vehicle and things flew by much faster than you thought they would. Whatever this thing was it was faster than any land vehicle on Earth, probably any aircraft too.

Even though you seemed to be moving extremely fast Jasmine was tapping one mile long claw on the dashboard impatiently, causing what felt like small earthquakes to you. “Sorry this is taking so long, but public transportation is just so slow,” the dragoness said apologetically to you. It only took about three minutes to reach your destination and you are fairly certain you had traveled thousands of miles when the university finally came into view. Then Jasmine scooped you back up in one of her claws and carried you out of the vehicle.

“Welcome to your new home for the next four years,” Jasmine said cheerfully as you looked upon the building that dwarfed even the massive dragoness.
14533.title: New Home

145332.content:
You had barely any time to see the sheer size of the university before Jasmine entered through its sliding doors. How so many classes, offices, and dorm rooms could fit in one building, you could not fathom. And each of the rooms themselves were like small countries; the entire building must be the size of a small planet. Jasmine stepped into an elevator, and with her huge index finger, pressed a button labeled 'Special Dorms'. As the floor whizzed upward, you asked your dragoness helper what kind of room you are getting into.

"Well, the special dorms are usually reserved for students with special needs, and are usually singles, but in our case, it's been set up so that a human can live somewhat normally. I'll show it to you when we get there." Jasmine looked down at you with a smile on her face, and you feel reassured knowing that human needs have been taken account for.

The elevator stopped, and Jasmine walked down a many mile long corridor. Stopping at room 5047, she reached her free hand to a wall fixing, which scanned her handprint to allow her access. The door slid open, revealing a nice, modern looking room, complete with a desk with a computer, bed, drawers, and even a separate bathroom. Jasmine's claw lowered towards a bedside cabinet, on top of which was a similar setup, only in your size. It was a bit mind boggling and nerve-wracking, knowing that where you were staying for four years could fit several hundred times over on your roommates fingertip, and that she could easily reach you from where she would be sleeping pretty much every day.

As you unpacked, Jasmine would not stop looking at you work and often butt in to help you. It was quite amazing how she managed to fold your clothing with those huge claws of hers without tearing them to pieces, much less put them away in drawers without completely demolishing any of the furniture. It seems that this dragoness wasn't nearly as clumsy as she led you to believe. You were glad that Jasmine was so willing to help you, though by the look in her eyes, she seemed to enjoy it immensely.

As she finished making your tiny bed, Jasmine turned to you and said, "So, now that your things are all set up, I'd really like to talk to you, now that we've got some free time and nobody else is around." You feel more than a bit nervous, but Jasmine seems friendly enough. "Sure, Jasmine, I'd like that. What do you want to talk about?" Jasmine replies...

She smiles apologetically as her stomach makes a loud growl. At your size its like being next to the engine of a rocket. You cant help but feel a instinctive terror, after all she could easily eat you and barley even feel a thing. She notices your unease and her smile fades... "Sorry" She says weakly "I'm gonna get something to eat, would you mind coming with me?" She asks "I want to keep talking a little more" She explains and you nod yes "Sure." You say simply. She smiles and sets her pinky down for you to climb on, managing to hide a giggle at the effort it takes you. She carefully leans her finger inwards so that you slide into the palm of her hand then walks to the kitchen.

She carefully sets you down and says "Wait right there..." before turning away and grabbing some bread and meats from the fridge and gets to work making a sandwich. However a accidental slam of her hand into the table causes you to fly upwards and land atop her sandwich. She looks back over to where you were and her expression changes to horror. She quickly checks her hand for any sign that she may have crushed you and heaves a sigh of relief when she see's she didn't. She calls out your name and looks all over the counter for you accept for of course he sandwich. With a worried expression she picks up the sandwich and raises it towards her face. Her massive maw opens to reveal a pink cavern filled with countless glistening teeth and ruled over by a squirming tongue. "Jasmine!" You shout in a panicked voice as she moves the sandwich closer to her mouth. Does she hear you?
14533212.title: Hungry dragoness is hungry

15.content:
Sizechanging: In this universe, the giant anthros all have the ability to become pretty much any size they want. At their smallest size, they are about twenty feet, but they can become as big as they want.

Class Project: This universe is different from the others so far. In this one, humans are treated as servants or pets by normal-sized anthros. Interestingly, the anthros have the amazing ability to shrink humans at will. Humans are kept at a maximum of one foot tall, but can be as small as the anthros wish.
The anthros in this universe do not mistreat humans, though. In fact, anthros are not allowed to own a human pet or servant until they take a class in school called Human Care. In this class, the anthros learn how to properly care for and discipline a human. This year, at one school, you will be the class's pet human. The anthros will use you as their learning tool.

New Teacher: This universe is similar to the one in the "normal" storylines, except in this one you are a human teacher for a class of giant anthros.

Higher Learning: In this storyline, humans live alone on the planet Earth, but worship a race of god-like anthros. These anthros really exist; they appear on Earth from time to time to help the human race out. Being deities, these anthros exhibit amazing powers, including the ability to change sizes. The story begins when a group of these anthro deities decide to find one worthy human, namely you, and teach the human about the universe.
15.title: Other Storylines

choices: They show you what anthros are really capable of.
151.content:
This was supposed to be the first day of some new grand project. As the time approached for you to actually go through with this you had started to analyze your reasons for doing this. Had you done this because you wanted to be a part of changing the course of history for the better or were you just doing this to impress your friends? Either way, it felt like it was too late to back out of this now. The anthros’ school was already in sight and it was huge.

It was hard to believe that the anthros had no more than eight students per class in a school so large. Actually, they would have eight anthros and one human in some of the classes now. You would think that they would only need a structure that big because they were having a problem with overcrowded classrooms. Then again, eight anthros might just be overcrowded for an anthro school. There was just no telling since anthros and humans did not talk much with each other. That was why they were trying out this program in the first place.

This was starting out at the high school level since they did not believe those any younger would be responsible enough to make this program a success. There were a few things you are curious about. They say that the anthros can change to any size that they wish, but you have never seen an anthro actually change their own size around you. You would like to confirm that their clothes really do change size with them as they do so. It would also be interesting to see what would happen to a building if they decided to change sizes. If they really could become as large as they wished then would an entire building built by anthros also change sizes with them?

You wondered where you were going to have to park when you spotted a “Welcome Human” sign that pointed you to a parking space right next to the school. That was a relief. Many of the anthro students had already arrived and you had dreaded having to walk through a parking lot with the anthro sized cars all over the place. A problem did present itself though. There were steps leading up to the school that were way too large for you to easily climb.

Then you heard a deep voice from behind you, “Hi, you must be the new human.” You jumped in fright before turning around to be confronted with a 20 foot tall anthro lion with a pitch black mane. He raises his hands, or are they still called paws, in a sign of apology. “Sorry for scarring you, but I’ve been assigned as your partner for the school year. We have all the same classes and I’ll be transporting you to all of your classes if that’s all right with you. My name’s Zen by the way.”

“That’s fine,” you say, “It sure beats walking.” The lion smiled at you and picked you up as gently as he could before placing you on his shoulder. Despite how friendly he was you could not help but being a little frightened of the lion. You had expected one of the nerdy types to be taking care of you, not that a 20 foot tall nerd would not have been at least a little intimidating. However, this lion was built more like an athlete. You would be surprised if he was not on one or two of the schools sports teams. This fear of yours was probably one of the reasons why they had started up this program. If you felt like this about a friendly lion then there was no telling how bad a lot of people felt about the anthros when they had never met any of them. That also made you wonder what the anthros felt about humans.

This day was going to have an interesting start too. Your first class was listed as “Size Changing.” It looks like a few of your questions about anthros were about to be answered right away. You wondered what it would be like for you though. This was obviously just meant as something for you to observe so you could find out about anthros, but how would you deal with having to deal with even larger anthros. You wondered whether they were going to keep it simple or if they were going to try and impress you on your first day.
151.title: Meet Your Partner

choices: The pop quiz goes off without a hitch.
One or more students fail the quiz!
Something else happens before the quiz even begins...
1511.content:
Zen catches you taking a peek at your schedule. Out of the corner of your eye you could see him squinting a little before his eyes widened in recognition. It was fairly impressive that the big lion could actually read print that small. "Ah yes, Sizechanging is the first class of the day. Should be fun!"

"Yeah, sure," you say. He must have picked up on your apprehension, because he roared out a laugh in response.

"Don't worry human. It won't be anything too intense for your first day. You'll just get a good show is all." You can feel the rumble of his voice against your legs, and the way his chest expands with more than a little pride. It was kind of endearing, but didn't do all that much to help you with your nervousness.

"The show's been pretty good so far from where I'm sitting. You guys are like, crazy big." You find yourself blushing even as you say that, and your skin darkens even more when Zen actually begins to purr at the statement. Out of the corner of your eye you can see him wink at you, his muzzle splitting into a big grin that displayed dark black lips and huge, pointed white teeth.

"Just you wait, little guy. You haven't seen anything yet!"

You clutch a patch of Zen's mane as he walks around the edge of the school building to the football field out back. His fur is thick there, but not aggressively so -- he's young enough for his mane not to have fully grown in. He doesn't seem to mind as you get a grip so you can look out at the football field.

Already you can see an enormous tiger towering over the goalposts on one side of the field. Judging from the size of the goal posts -- the tops of which only reach mid-thigh -- you'd have to say he was at least 100 feet tall. His tail flicked behind him as the students gathered in front of him along the end zone, each dwarfed by the enormous cat.

"Oh my God," you say, and you find yourself clutching Zen's mane a little tighter. He chuckles softly.

"Oh, that's just Mr. Hansforth. Don't worry about him; he looks intimidating, and he is a little demanding, but he's a really nice guy as long as you follow the rules." The lion sounds so nonchalant about a tiger the size of a ten-story building looking down at them, but it's the first time you've ever seen such a thing. It's definitely going to take some getting used to.

"Ahhh, Zen," the big cat booms, narrowing his eyes. "So good of you to join us. And I see that you've brought our esteemed human with you." It was hard to tell whether the tiger was being genuinely friendly or somewhat snide. His expression was predatory but unreadable beyond that.

"Yes sir," the lion says, falling into line with the other students. They all look at you curiously. It's a little unnerving being the center of attention in a group full of anthros the size of buildings.

"Excellent," Mr. Hansforth purrs. "Please set him down on the ground. Human, once you're safely standing you will take a spot to my left. That's the safest place to be for class."

You can't help but bristle a bit at the set of instructions. One hundred feet tall or no, Mr. Hansforth was being kind of rude. You do have a name, after all. Still, considering this is your first day, you decide not to push anything. You simply nod and jog towards the looming tiger once Zen sets you down. He looks at you precisely as if you were a mouse darting across his field of vision. If you didn't know any better, you would swear that he had to resist the urge to pounce.

"Very well, then. It is time for roll call. When you hear your name spoken, please remark 'present'. Zen?"

"Present!" the lion calls. He flicks his tail from side to side as he turns to look at you. You know by now that he's giving you a friendly look, but those teeth are awfully large and sharp.

"Melody?"

"Present!" To the left of Zen was a vixen, slightly shorter than him at 17 feet high or so. She was quite...well-developed for someone her age. Her russet and white fur seemed to accentuate the curves that she was growing into, her chest and hips flaring out from her narrow waist. She watches you as well, her slitted pupils narrowing just a bit. There's no way to tell what she might be thinking.

"Towe?"

"Present!" To the left of her was a wolf as tall as Zen and even wider than the lion, if that was possible. He spares a glance at you before turning to face his instructor, his voice and demeanor boasting his confidence as well as his willingness to follow directions. Still, he looked like he could be a handful if he ever decided to be aggressive.

"Ogden?"

"Present!" The rat next to Towe was thin but ripped; lean muscle showed through his grey fur, and every movement he made suggested a quick mind and lightning-sharp reflexes. His dark brown eyes shine as he looks towards you, his whiskers twitching as if he can make out your scent from where he's standing. He comes only to the wolf's shoulder, about the height of Melody.

"Nash?"

"Present." Another rat, this one with the same fur color and bare paws that Ogden sported. She was female and surprisingly heavy-set, as motherly as Ogden was lithe. Still, she wore her weight well, and by the ever-present smile creasing her muzzle another friendly sort. It occurs to you that she and the other rat might be siblings, though you're not sure if that's because it's so hard to tell anthros apart. Best to keep those thoughts to yourself, at least until you get to know everyone better.

"Kendra?"

"Present!" The next student was a very large horse, as thick as Melody in the hips and chest but quite strong on top of that. She looked like she could match the guys in brawn and stamina easily. Her mane flowed down over one light brown eye, and the other was directed at you. She tossed her head and flicked her tail in what you can only assume is a friendly gesture. Good thing, too, because she was several feet taller than Zen.

"And Adjulowa?"

"Present." The elephant thunders the one word, and you felt the rumble of his voice where you stood. He was absolutely immense -- he rose above the goal posts with several feet to spare, while everyone save for Kendra would have to jump to reach the top of it. His big ears were the size of sail's ships, and his body was nothing short of monstrous, with a great deal of muscle and fat. He wore clothes, just like everyone else, but he looked like he was threatening to burst out of them every time he took a breath. He flicked his ears and looked at you evenly, then back at Mr. Hansforth.

"Very good," the teacher purrs. "You're all here. Since this is the first day for our new classmate, I thought today would be a good day to review our lesson from the very first week." The class responded with various sounds of consternation, which all ceased when the tiger held up a massive paw. "But! If you perform this pop quiz perfectly, I will declare Friday a free period."

He grinned as the gathered anthros looked at each other, astonished. They took a few moments to compose themselves, then looked resolutely up at their teacher. Whatever this free period was, it was a pretty big deal.

Mr. Hansforth, satisfied that he had secured their cooperation, continued. "Very well. I would like all of you to grow half again your smallest height at the first speed. I will know if you've gone over that height, and I will know if you've moved too quickly." He held up what looked like a car. To him, it was no bigger than a garage door remote. He stared down at the smaller students, his tail twitching behind him. "Begin."
1511.title: They keep it simple.

15111.content:
It was hard to know exactly what you should be paying attention to. On one hand, you were close enough to touch a towering tiger as big as a skyscraper. On the other, the seven students in front of you were closing their eyes, putting their hands together and then growing right in front of you. You could feel the movement of Mr. Hansforth through the ground under your feet, but there was a growing rumble coming your way from the collected students.

Since Zen was closest to you, you watched him first. He grew just fast enough for you to notice, his heavy mane and broad shoulders rising higher in the air. It looked like his clothing was growing quite as fast as the rest of him. The fabric creaked more and more around his shoulders, and the pattern on his shirt visibly deformed around his rising chest. Around his hips and thighs, his shorts were starting to get filled, the sheer volume of muscle forcing the bottoms to rise over the lion's knees. Even that thin, ropey tail was growing longer and obviously heavier, making an audible woosh as it knifed the air behind him. The grass, long used to such abuse, was being churned around Zen's paws as the lion put on who knows how many tons of additional weight.

Everyone else in the class seemed to be doing the same thing. Melody's face looked the most inwardly drawn, while everyone else seemed to handle the growth with no problem. In fact, the immense elephant Adjulowa looked positively bored doing it. This, even though his own tank-top was threatening to break around the sheer mass of his back and chest. Towe looked around at the other students as he grew, a low growl rumbling the ground as he wagged his tail. He seemed to be enjoying the expansion. So was Kendra, for that matter.

It took a minute before the seven students in front of him were half again as tall as they were before. Zen was now an astounding 30 feet tall, while Melody and Ogden were hovering around 25. Adjulowa was nearly 50, his broad ears right at the level of Mr. Hansforth's hip. He clicked the 'remote' in his paw, then swished his tail with a small smile. "Very good, students. All of you performed perfectly. I'm proud of you."

What followed was a veritable riot of noise as the students celebrated. You have to hold your hands to your ears to keep from having your brain rattled. Mr. Hansforth must have noticed, because he put up a huge paw and rumbled a command that quieted them down instantly. "You're forgetting about our guest here!"

The class looks at you, and so does the 100-foot tiger. You can feel yourself blushing, but hope that no one notices. "If we're going to live together the way it's hoped, we'll have to maintain perfect control in dealing with humans at all times. They're small and fragile, but they're all genuises down to a man." The tiger looked down at his class, holding his paws behind his back. His chest jutted out so far it looked like it would bump his chin as he looked down at the class. "Is that understood?"

The seven students quickly fall back into position and nods, looking up at their teacher. "Yes sir!"

Mr. Hansforth ordered everyone down to their smallest sized again, and ran them through their paces for the rest of the class. It was something like working a musical scale, only you were doing impossible things with it. You had never seen furs grow before, and now, for the next hour, you watched them grow anywhere from 1.5 - 5 times their original size at all kinds of rates. Everyone seemed quite adept at it, which was the most impressive thing. Ogden and Nash forgot themselves a couple of times when they were cracking jokes instead of paying attention, but other than that the hour passed by without incident.

"That....that was amazing!" You say as Zen comes to collect you after class. The lion's ears flick, disappearing into his mane. You've learned pretty quickly to note this as an embarrassed response.

"Aw, it wasn't anything. You should see us when Mr. Hansforth has us doing really hard stuff. Sometimes we have to go out into the wilderness because that's the only place where the entire class can be at once." The cat plucks you up without asking and carries you off to his next class.

The thought of that makes your head spin. Being lifted off and carried against the heavily-muscled lion doesn't help either, but you don't mind, you find. "I...can't even imagine what that would look like."

Zen purred a chuckle. "In a couple of weeks you won't have to. Now, ready to go to our next class? It's..."
15111.title: The Well-Trained Class

choices: The anthros were just warming up
1512.content:
Oddly, your big helper Zen does not enter the huge building, but instead strolls along the side of it to the back. You notice that there are other anthro students standing in a large clearing, and when they notice the big lion you are on they wave to him. Zen suddenly starts to run fast, and you have to grab hold of his jet black mane tightly to not fall off.

"Hey, guys, its good to see you all again!" roared Zen to his buddies. Sure enough, there were seven other anthros there, excluding an older anthro teacher, who looked like a meek muskrat. Zen started off by introducing you to three of his friends from junior high school, and you are glad that at least those three seem somewhat accepting of you. However, it is a bit unsettling that they all are big, burly carnivorous boys like Zen. You learn that the crocodile's name is Albert, the Kodiak bear's name is Theodore, and the wolverine's name is Claude.

Suddenly, a shrill whistle blows, and everyone quiets down. The muskrat raises his forepaws in the air for everyone's attention, then starts to speak.

"First of all, I would like to thank everyone who decided to come here to demonstrate. Before you start, just let me speak to the human, to make sure that he understands what is going to happen." Zen walks over to the muskrat, and seems to tower over him. The teacher lowers his mellow voice a bit, and attempts to calm you down.

"Now, human, please don't be afraid of what is going to happen. You see, anthros like to change their sizes often, and we have heard that you have never witnessed even one size change. These students are all here to help you get used to the prospect of sizechanging, and have all been told to put their all into it so you will be ready for pretty much any type of situation while you are at our school. Before we start, do you have any questions?"

Yeah, right, you only have about five million questions. You do not want to pester the muskrat anthro with so many questions, though, so you try to limit your questions to only a few. "Um, Mr. Muskrat, will the clothes also change size, because..."

Zen suddenly bursts out laughing, practically throwing you off his shoulder. He then answers your question himself. "Don't be ridiculous, human, of course we don't grow out of our clothes, that would just be plain embarrassing!" You suddenly feel as if you asked a very dumb question and you shrink back from Zen's fanged grin. The muskrat tries to calm Zen down, reminding him that a human would not know the answer to that question. You decide not to ask any more questions; clearly the anthros have some control of the size of other objects other than themselves and wouldn't grow out of buildings.

Before you know it, it's time for the growth presentation to begin. It starts even before you realize it, the process is so smooth, but you do see Zen's head start to grow larger and his shoulder getting roomier. His friends and the four other students are also growing at about the same rate. In less than a minute each of the anthros are easily as tall as the school.

"So, what do you think so far?" asked Zen, whose voice has grown louder and deeper. You are completely speechless, and Zen chuckles at your amazement. The giant lion brings a meaty golden paw to his shoulder and gently plucks you off his fur. You notice that you are about as tall as one of his fingers.

"Well, if you are that amazed already, then I'm dying to see how you react when were done!" The lion then starts to shoot upward, along with the others. You notice clouds start to pass as you become increasingly smaller relative to the giant paw. The air starts to get thin, yet you remain warm because Zen's paw radiates so much heat. As you ascend, you notice Benjamin come up to Zen, wanting to show him something. Zen laughs, which sounds like thunder now, and Benjamin lowers two of his claws down to Zen's palm. To your amazement, wedged between the two claws is the school, which looks absolutely microscopic now. Suddenly, one of Zen's claws hooks your shirt and you rise what must be miles higher to your partner's face. "Why don't you take a look down, human?" says the humongous lion in a god-like baritone. Looking down, you are frightened and in awe as you see half of the surface of the Earth below. You do not know how you or any of the anthros are even able to breathe, but you can and you assume that they can too. You notice that the surface of the Earth is distorted; the field that the growth started on seems to take up a good portion of the Earth's landmass. You are relieved, because this probably means that the anthros have the foresight to grow what they are standing on so they do not demolish any countries.

You noticed that the growing has stopped for now, and you look back at Zen. Even though he should look infinetely more menacing now that he could in theory destroy the planet, but he actually looks much kinder now that he is so huge. You don't know if it is because he is trying as hard as he can not to frighten you, or because at this size his roughness is smoothed out over many miles. Zen chuckles again, and this time you feel his laughter more than you can hear it. You cannot imagine that there could be any more growing now.
1512.title: Expect the Impossible

15122.content:
It appeared the anthros had the ability to defy your imagination. Growing to this size was like flexing your muscles was to you. It did not really require any effort at all and they could still keep going. All of the anthros just kept growing and growing as if there was nothing unusual about what they were doing.

You knew they had to be larger than the Earth by now. It was a mystery how they could get this large without you ever noticing an anthro doing it or without them destroying the Earth. Somehow, their gift of growth allows them not to cause any harm to the planet and go unnoticed by the human population after a certain point in their growth. Zen increased in size to the point where you could no longer take in his entire face and he was still growing. Before long you could no longer comprehend how large any of the other students were. It would be surprising if they were not larger than a star.

You stopped thinking about how large their bodies were and just concentrated on a strand of Zen’s fur. It was so thick you could actually fit your entire neighborhood on it. If it were not for Zen’s fur you would not even be able to tell he was growing anymore. By the time Zen stopped growing even a strand of his fur seemed like it would have been able to hold the entire Earth on it, without bending under the weight.

The anthros were simply amazing. How they could do this was beyond you. It was amazing that you could still breathe and not only were you warm, but you were comfortably warm. Zen’s paw pad seemed to stretch on forever and yet it felt soft beneath you. For some reason you felt safe in Zen’s paw even though you were aware he could now end your life without even noticing it. This must also be tied in to his gift. You also began to understand why this program had been started up. It was not for the benefit of the anthros nearly as much as it was for humans. At the size the anthros were now it would not be a problem for them to wipe out all of humanity. This program was in place to make sure the anthros viewed humans as their equals instead of just little pests. You might be wrong, but you have a feeling not all of the anthros in this school are going to be as nice to you as Zen and his friends are.

When Zen does eventually shrink back down to the size you first met him at you ask, “Just how large can you get Zen?”

“I don’t really know. Theoretically there is no limit as to how large an anthro can get. None of us have ever encountered a size we could not reach. It is fun to try sometimes though. I usually have things to do, but once I had enough time to get large enough to see the edge of the universe. It was fun to see that it really isn’t infinite after all,” said Zen.

You could only stare at him in wide eyed amazement. Before you could pull yourself together and ask Zen any more questions the muskrat teacher blew his whistle and said, “Alright, that’s all the time we have for today. I hope you found this class enlightening human. Good luck on the rest of your day here.”

You manage to thank the muskrat before Zen starts walking off in the direction of your next class. That next class just happens to be…
15122.title: What Is Their Limit?

choices: Your score is horrible, you need to be in a "special" P.E. class
You actually scored very well (considering you are a human)
151221.content:
Your big lion helper Zen strolled into a gymnasium, which must mean that your next class is P.E. You consider yourself to be athletic, but compared to all of the anthro boys and girls in the gym, you feel downright scrawny. You fear that everyone is going to look down on you because you are a human and not be able to see how athletic you really are.

Suddenly, a huge white ox in a red muscle shirt and blue shorts stomped into the gym. You could tell that he has already grown himself past his minimum height, and guess that anthro teachers grow themselves when they need to have the attention of their students.

"Listen up, everyone!" boomed the ox in a voice that seemed even louder than it should at his size of seventy or so feet. "Today is the first day of school, and that means that it's time to see how fit you all are. Everyone will follow the test rules to the tee, and no skimping out. I'm going to grow to an extra large size to keep an eye on all of your progresses. First, everyone get a partner!"

Zen gives you a thumbs up, or is it a claws up? Either way, you don't have to worry about finding a partner.

"Okay, first is fifty sit-ups! Choose who spots who, then switch over when you can, now GO!" The huge ox grows even huger, nearly touching the roof of the gymnasium, and starts a timer.

Zen gets down on the ground and places you by his large feet. Not knowing how else you are going to hold him in place, you decide to sit on his feet. Zen is incredibly fast at his sit-ups, and you notice that so is everyone else. He isn't even doing those wimpy half sit-ups that some of your human friends do. Zen finishes in about forty seconds, and doesn't even look tired. You hop off the lion's feet and get on your back. Zen grows a bit and holds down your feet under a single fingerpad, watching you do your sit-ups. Your back starts to ache after around thirty-five of them, and you can't help but slow down. You decide that you should not even try to go as fast as Zen went next time you do sit-ups. You take more than twice the time Zen took, and when you get up, you notice all of the other anthros nearby staring at you. Some were even giggling.

"Pay attention, everyone!" yelled the ox. "Next is forty pushups, now GO!"

You start to sweat heavily as you get back on the ground. Zen has no trouble at all with his pushups and was finished with all forty before you could even do ten. "Are you okay, human? You look awfully beat." You could tell that Zen was not being sarcastic at all, but you did not want to admit that you could not keep up with the other anthros. "I'm fine, thanks," you pant. You finish in about two minutes and pick up your sore body to look at a very impatient looking ox.

"Okay, everyone, last is the one mile sprint! That's equal to six laps around the gymnasium. No growing is allowed, that would be cheating! One more thing, and this is for the human only: you can run two laps, which should be about the same distance relatively. Now, GO!"

You always considered yourself to be a fast runner; you tried to do the "Four Minute Mile" once and only missed by half a minute. Compared to everyone else, though, you feel like a downright slowpoke. Every single one of the anthros laps you five times. One girl, a blur of an anthro cheetah, completes the whole mile in only about ten seconds! At least she looked a bit tired out when she finished. Zen, when he finished after only around twenty-five seconds, still looked as fresh as ever. All of the anthros had finished by the time you completed your first lap, and you are highly embarrassed. Most of the anthros are just staring at you, but at least a few are snickering audibly. This makes you mad, and gives you the strength to complete the second lap faster than the first lap. Your time was still well over a minute, however.

"Okay, everyone, that's all for the fitness test. You can all spend of the rest of the period doing cardio work. However, I need to speak to the human regarding his scores."

Zen notices that you are very tired and scoops you up in his arms before you can say anything. The big ox now shrinks down to twenty five feet, which must be his minimum height, but is still very tall. You think you know what's coming up; your score must be abysmal compared to the rest of the class. The ox looks at your sweaty body in your partner's paws, and starts to speak...
151221.title: Fitness Test

choices: You finish P.E. without any further incidents.
Someone decides to make things difficult for you.
1512211.content:
“Human, your scores are terrible. You need to be in a special class,” the ox says and your heart sinks. Beneath you, you can feel Zen’s muscles tense up. Zen must be shooting him a pretty dirty look because the ox looks at him before turning his attention back to you. “Unfortunately they won’t let me place you in any special class since you have to be in all of Mr. Fen’s classes. You probably couldn’t keep up with the special students anyways,” the ox finishes with a dismissive wave.

Zen turns and walks away without a word. He has seemed pretty friendly up until this point, but that ox really seems to have angered him. Considering you were the one that the ox had just been talking about you were the one that should be angered. What you feel, though, is shame. There is no way you can compete with these anthros. This was definitely going to be tough adjusting too. You had been one of the top students back in your school and now you were on the bottom of the class. Maybe you could do better in some of the other classes. There was something you just had to ask right now though. “Your name is Zen Fen?”

“It’s actually Zenten Ren Fen. My parents decided to be jokesters when they named me.” He sounded a little angry right now so you dropped the subject, but you did kind of like the name.

As Zen walked over to join the other students the cheetah walked up to meet you. She flashed you what you were sure was meant to be a friendly smile. “Wow, don’t you two look in need of cheering up,” she says in a light, almost joking tone. “Don’t worry about the ox human, he was born with one hoof in his mouth. Besides, you’re a lot faster than my old human friend used to be.”

Now that was interesting. She used to have a human as a friend. “Used to?” you ask.

“Yeah, before my family moved out here. He was a little fat, but a nice guy. I also wouldn’t have made it into high school without him. I helped get him in shape for his P.E. tests and he tutored me in math, science, and, well, anything that involved a book. Now that I’ve moved out here it has been pretty hard making new friends with any humans since we don’t normally mix and that I’m now at that size where most humans think I’m going to swallow them the first chance I get. Oh, my name’s Felicia by the way,” Felicia said as she extended one clawed finger in your direction for you to shake.

You took the proffered claw and shook it. It was amazing how friendly Zen and his predatory friends are. Now this cheetah, Felicia, is being equally friendly despite crushing you in that run. If anyone could look down on you it was her. Then you started to think about something. When you had been running it had been all the herbivores that had been snickering at you. The carnivores had just looked a little uncomfortable, as if they were embarrassed about something but did not want to say anything. Even the ox teacher had been much ruder to you than the muskrat, which was an omnivore, had been.

At first you think that it should be the other way around. You try to think about why things have been this way so far. Maybe it was just that herbivores tended to object to change more than naturally inquisitive predators tended to. If you worked out in this school then there could be a whole lot of change on the horizon. The predators might view it as some type of fun adventure while the herbivores could look at it with fear. You hope you are wrong because if you’re right then you have a very large portion of this school that wants to see you fail.
1512211.title: Carnivores and Herbivores

15122112.content:
"So, human, what kind of cardio work do you like best?" asked Zen. "There's the jump ropes, and there are a bunch of treadmills and cycle machines on the sides of the gym." You see the various anthros using the jumpropes that are too long for you, and you would never be able to reach the pedals on the bike machine even at its lowest adjustment. You guess that you don't really have much of a choice but to go on a treadmill.

"Yeah, that's my favorite, too, human!" says Felicia. The two big cats bring you to the side of the gym, and Zen places you on the large black surface on the floor. "I'm just going to give you the lowest speed to start, so tell me if you can go faster," said Felicia. Pressing a button on a panel high above you, the floor starts rolling. Apparantly, the slowest speed is five miles per hour, which is plenty fast for you when you are running for endurance. Felicia still waited a bit more, as if five miles per hour was too slow, but she got the idea and hopped on a treadmill next to you. Her treadmill makes an incredibly high pitched whizzing sound as her legs start to blur once more. You can't help but ask her what speed she is going.

"Oh, only about three-sixty. I don't like to overdo it when running for over a minute."
Your mouth is agape. "Only" three-sixty? That means that she could easily keep up with a drag racer without even trying! To your left, you see Zen pedaling hard on a cycle machine, not going as fast as you would have thought. He must have set the machine for a huge amount of resistance.

You suddenly get nervous whenever a herbivore passes the three of you. Many of them whisper into each other's ears and point at you snickering. However, you are downright frightened when one of them addresses you.

"So, human, you think that you're good enough to hang with anthros?" came a voice high above a pair of thick muscled grey legs. You look up to see an ugly grin underneath a large white horn; which obscured a pair of sunglasses.

"Get away from him, Corniel!" roared Zen, looking at the rhinoceros with fire in his eyes.

"Cool it Zenten," snapped the rhino. "Well, human, I guess you need all the help you can get now. Why don't I help you out a bit?"

"Um, I don't know," you say to the rhino, before Zen growls more. "Nonsense, human. Besides, you aren't even going at a decent walking speed. Here, let me 'help' you with that."

Before you can respond, the rhino slams the panel with a thick fist. Zen roars, and Felicia gasps and leaps off her treadmill as you are flung off yours at an alarming pace. You expect to skid across the floor, but instead you land in something soft that appeared out of nowhere. Slowly rising in the air, you see Felicia's worried face, now greatly enlarged. Not only can she run very fast, Felicia can also apparently change size in the blink of an eye. This wasn't even a slight size difference; you are easily half the size of one of her spots now. "Hold, still, human, I just want to make sure you weren't hurt. As she inspects you closely, you see a large group of anthros surrounding Zen and Corneil. Zen was making a lot of noise, and Corneil kept his horn pointed at Zen's mane. Both were growing in size, and you are surprised that nobody has broken through the roof of the gymnasium.

As the two enemies start crouching to avoid hitting the ceiling, Zen, being a lion, was able to crouch much better, and thus was able to grow larger than Corneil. "Okay, fine, I'm leaving. Don't know why you care at all about a human, though." The rhinoceros started stomping away, shrinking back to his minimum size. Zen was breathing heavily, and growled, "Felicia, is the human okay, because if he isn't..."

"Don't worry, Zen, he's perfectly fine," said the nervous cheetah. Zen held out his huge hand, as large as Felicia is at her now increased height, and Felicia reaches into the palm to place you there. All of the other anthros start leaving as Zen thrashes his huge tail at the crowd.

You look at your frightening lion partner, his black mane resembling a dark forest fire. "Listen, human, I'm sorry if I frightened you, but I had to get Corneil off your back. That guy has some sort of beef with humans like you wouldn't believe."

You are too frightened to say anything, and doubt that Zen could even hear you above his growling breath. After about a minute, he started to calm down, and also started shrinking to his smallest height.

"So, do you know Corneil?" you ask.

Zen growls a bit, but controls himself. "I've known him since the sixth grade. His full name is Corneil Rhinowski. All of the other herbivores kind of look up to him because he is tough enough to challenge the carnivores, and that gives him a bit of a superiority complex. I don't know why he hates humans so much, but he brags about all of the human cities he wrecks each summer. Say, do you know of any cities that were destroyed by a giant rhinoceros?"

"No, I'm sure something like that would have been all over the news," you reply. You shudder at the thought of what an anthro attack would be like though. You imagine Corniel's huge hoof descending on a whole city, or even a whole country, and grinding it into smithereens.

Zen let out the tiniest laugh. "Heh, I knew he totally lying."

Suddenly, a bell rings and you are off to your next class. You hope you do not see Corniel any more today. Zen tells you what the next class is.
15122112.title: Corneil Rhinowski

choices: Zen is actually terrible at art.
You are the best student in class.
151221122.content:
“We’re headed off to our art class next. Hopefully that should give you a nice little break after all the stuff you’ve had to go through during this period,” said Zen. That sounded just fine to you. You are a pretty talented artist, but you had thought you were in pretty good shape too. One of the reasons you had been selected to go to this school instead of someone else was because you were one of the top students in the area, in the nation actually. Technically, you were smart enough to be in college already but your parents wanted you to stick around people your own age. It was kind of funny that they did not care about keeping you around people your own size.

As Zen walked to the art class you were able to get your first good look at the interior of the school. Things looked pretty similar to a less crowded version of your own school. It was not like your school was overcrowded or anything, but it seemed like there could not be more than 500 anthros going to this school while your high school had about three times that number of students.

You noticed that just about everybody was staring at you as Zen walked past them. It looked like you might have been right about the carnivores and herbivores. All of the carnivores and most of the omnivores would offer you a friendly smile or at the very least they did not look like they wished you any harm. The herbivores were a completely different story. They made you feel uncomfortable and happy that you had Zen as a protector.

It did not take too long to reach the art room. The teacher was a colorful parrot that seemed to have put up a fairly large and well drawn “Welcome Human” sign before you arrived. You could have sworn that parrots were herbivores, but it might just be that not all of them are totally against you just like you are bound to meet a carnivore or two that does not like you. “Ah, welcome students and a big welcome to you my first human student. I am Mrs. Pare. This is the first class of the year and I would like to see where all of your skill levels are at. So, today I would like you to create whatever you like and I will look over whatever you done in the last fifteen minutes of class,” she said in a pretty flamboyant manner. It did not seem like Mrs. Pare had any room in her for hate. That might explain why she did not dislike you.

You still had to find a workstation though. Everything in this room was meant for people at least three times your size. “Mr. Fen, I have a workstation already set up for your human partner next to the window.”

“Thank you Mrs. Pare, I’ll take the human right over,” Zen said. Then he looked over at you and said, “It’s nice of her to remember I like to work next to the window. That should make things easier on us in case somebody decides to try something like Corneil did.”

“That sounds good,” you said. Then Zen dropped you off at a workstation with human sized supplies. It looked like you had all new equipment since you were the only human here. Zen quickly went to work on something right next to you and it soon became apparent to you he was only as good at art as the average art student back at your high school. It was nice to know all anthros weren’t incredibly good at everything. You had to decide what to draw yourself though. Then you looked at Zen and he looked like just as good a subject as any. Felines tended to look good in art in no matter what position they were in and Zen was no exception.

You did not have a lot of time to get your little painting done, but you were still proud of it. Zen looked at what you had drawn and then he looked back at what he had drawn. If you did not know any better you would have to say he looked a little embarrassed. “Wow, you’re good, I mean really good. And that is me, isn’t it?” Zen asked.

“Yeah, it’s you. And thanks for the compliment. I was kind of hoping I would be good at something in this school,” you said. Zen looked liked he was about to open his mouth to say something when Mrs. Pare walked over to your workstation.
151221122.title: Better at Something

choices: The anthros' science class is about very simple science
The anthros' science is far too complicated to understand
1512211221.content:
"Well, I guess you are a much better artist than I thought you would be, human," sang the parrot. "There is plenty of room for improvement, but that's the point of an art class!" You are glad that Mrs. Pare at least acknowledges that you have the capabilities of being good at art, unlike that ox teacher who probably saw you as a lost cause. The avian art teacher doesn't say anything when she looks at Zen's picture, probably because she can't think of anything good to say.

Once the teacher had critiqued all eight drawings, there was just enough time to prop them all up together before class ended. Zen's looks much worse than the others, and the look on his large face is one of embarrassment. Your drawing is actually about as good as a few of the others, like a drawing of the school. However, half of the drawings are excellent; these students decided to draw self portraits, and the drawings were almost indistinguishable from the real thing. Not only do you not believe that some anthro students are able to match, possibly surpass the ability of the greatest human artists, but they did so in under an hour using only colored pencils! Once again, you feel put down; these anthros not only beat you hands down physically, but artistically as well.

As the bell rings, you and Zen chat a bit as you head to your next class, Science. Zen tells you how good your drawing was of him, but you still feel badly. "Thanks, Zen, but did you see those other drawings? How will I ever be able to compete with that?"

"Well, I know that you have a better shot than me!" Zen said. You laughed at his joke, and Zen talked more, making you feel better. "Those anthros must be hard core art students to draw like that. None of my friends from junior high are that good. You're probably even better than them, human."

So, you are at least better than some anthros at something. But what of science? You got top grades in all of your science classes at your old school, but could anthros possibly be better mentally than humans? You can only hope that you will be able to handle the science class as Zen pushes the door open. The lion takes a seat near the front, and you are a bit relieved to see that the teacher is carnivorous; specifically a pescivore, as he is an elderly looking walrus anthro. "Don't worry human," Zen whispers from the seat next to your specially made smaller one, "Science should be pretty easy for you." You hope your partner is right as the walrus starts to speak.
1512211221.title: Bigger Expectations

15122112211.content:
Like many science teachers the Walrus is a straight to the point sort of guy. He writes his name up on the board and starts teaching right off the bat. There seems to be something wrong though. Everything looks a little to simple for you. This was all stuff that had been taught a few years ago at your school. You try to get Zen’s attention and by the way his ears swivel in your direction even though his eyes don’t you can tell you have it.

“Hey Zen,” you whisper, “This is a normal class, isn’t it?” You wonder if this is a class for special students. It just does not seem like this class is up to your level.

“No, this is the advanced class. You aren’t finding things too difficult are you?” Zen asked while giving you one worried glance. Now that took you by surprise. This was the class for their best science students and this was the advanced material. You thought that the teacher must be taking things easy on everyone on the first day or he was just taking it easy on you.

Your opinion began to change quickly though. As the class went on you kept answering all the questions while everybody else just stared at you. The walrus asked you to give the other students a chance at answering questions about halfway through the class. Even then you were the one that ended up giving the right answer more than half of the time. While the carnivores in the class looked like they admired you, the herbivores were shooting you some nasty looks. They probably did not enjoy being showed up by you. Fortunately there were only two of them in this class and that made them a little easier to ignore.

You tried to think of why you were so much better in science than even the best of the anthro students were. That probably had to do with your size. Humans just had to be better at things like science to have survived in the past. By the material you could tell that the anthros weren’t dumb. A smart anthro was definitely far smarter than a dumb human was, but a human genius should be able to top an anthro anytime if this was as good as they got. Still, science could just be a weak point for them. You would have to see when the other subjects came up.

It might not be a good idea to be such a shinning student even if you are smarter than the anthros though. The herbivores don’t seem to be taking to well to your performance. You try to imagine what it would be like to have a bunch of 20 foot tall angry herbivores staring at you for an entire class. That would definitely throw you off your game. It was only possible in this class because of all the carnivores. At least you know why Zen thought you would be good in this class.

The bell rings and it is time to move onto the next class. Your teacher congratulates you which makes you feel good after having to deal with being outshone in all your other classes. Zen picks you up and starts taking you to your next class. “Wow, I had heard humans were smart, but that was absolutely amazing. You might want to be careful in math though since Corneil is in that class too. Corneil has been the top student in his math course for the past five grade levels and I doubt he would take it well if you took over his spot,” Zen said.

“What is our next class Zen?” you ask.
15122112211.title: Your Time to Shine

choices: Corneil has a bone to pick with you.
Corneil decided to leave you alone... for now.
151221122111.content:
It looks like Zen's warning was well-timed. The next room was well-adorned with math paraphernalia and the teacher, a kangaroo, donned a small pair of glasses as he welcomed you into the classroom. Zen took his seat on the far right of the classroom, placing you on the desk, and for a few minutes you watched the other students file into the room.

Just before the bell was due to ring, Corneil sauntered into the room. He quickly caught sight of you and gave you a taunting smile. You were glad that the other students had taken the seats around Zen, forcing Corneil to sit to the left side of the room. Trying your best to ignore his stare, you look to the front of the classroom as the kangaroo began his lesson.

Apparently, their math was very much like their science. The lesson involved little more than basic algebra, which you considered yourself highly proficient at. You felt such an urge to show off your knowledge, and despite Zen's warning, you decided to raise your hand on the first question, promptly giving a correct answer to the other student's surprise.

Noticing a worried look on Zen's face, you glance over at Corneil and see a look of absolute rage on his face. The other herbivores were doing the same, and just to be safe you let Corneil have the next question. He also answered correctly, and a spiteful smile crossed his face.

The rest of the lesson became a shooting match between you and Corneil. You would answer the question then allow Corneil to do the same. He would then give you an opportunity, repeating the process and waiting in vain for one of you to falter. The divided students watched the competition as the teacher obliviously continued his lesson. During this, however, you notice a short (compared to them) fox girl in the corner. Every time you answered a question, a smug smile would cross her face. She obviously had something on her mind, and when the lesson was over you proceeded to ask Zen about her.

"Oh," he said. "That's Kira Granger. She was second in math class right after Corneil."

Well, THAT cleared it all up. You looked in her direction as she packed up her belongings, and she flashed you a grin. You couldn't help but feel proud.
151221122111.title: Math and Grudges?

1512211221111.content:
"Wow, you sure showed Corneil a thing or two in that class," exclaimed Zen as he packed his bags. "I bet he'd be so embarrassed, being matched by a human like you." You feel proud of your abilities in math today, but you are getting quite hungry. Zen hears your stomach growling like a miniature lion.

"Well, I bet you'll be glad to know that lunch is next," chuckled Zen as he hoisted you onto his thick furry shoulder. "Let's head off to the cafeteria, human."

However, when you both left the door, you were caught by surprise by Corneil, who had grown to sixty feet and was apparently waiting right outside the door for you. Grabbing Zen in his meaty clutches, he makes sure this time that he can't grow to save you now."

"Listen up, you bug, there is no way I'm going to let a puny human steal my thunder, you hear?" raged the rhino, shaking Zen vigorously and nearly making you lose your grip. "I'm only saying this once; us anthros have been, are, and always must be better than you humans; it's how it was meant to be. I've got my eye on you, human, and the next time I catch you becoming even remotely on par with us anthros, you will be sorry you ever came here."

Corneil Rhinowski dropped Zen to the hallway floor and stormed off in a huff, leaving you terrified and Zen very peeved. "Ugh, that guy is such a jerk! I don't know why anyone would want to hang out with him!" It is then that he notices you in total shock on his shoulder, and immediately changes his attitude. "Oh, I'm sorry you had to go through that, human. I should have realized that even a little spat like that would be so much more frightening for you." Zen's large paw pats your back, and you start to feel better. "Thank's Zen, I needed that," you reply to your helpful feline friend.

"I know what will cheer you up, human; their serving my personal favorite lunch today at the cafeteria! I'll get you some for you, my treat." Suddenly, something odd entered your mind. These anthros seem so humanlike, and yet can be a bit animalistic as well. Do anthros eat food humans can eat, or do they something a bit ... fresher?

At least when you get to the cafeteria, Zen brings you to a table with his friends. You recognize Albert the crocodile, Theodore the Kodiac bear, Claude the wolverine, Felicia the cheetah, and even Kira the fox. All of them seem to accept you like Zen, and you are glad that the herbivores tend to separate themselves from the carnivores in the cafeteria. Zen leaves the table to buy the food, and your friends also seem quite hungry. If you didn't know better, you would have thought that they would try to eat you. Pretty soon, everyone cheers as Zen brings the lunch to the table. All of the anthros' eyes light up as his large paw sets down a platter piled high with...
1512211221111.title: Threatened

choices: a cute sheep anthro who wants to meet you.
15122112211111.content: Thankfully, you see the platter is stacked high with meaty Sloppy Joe's. The guys grab them and start chowing down, one in each hand, meat and sauce getting all over their fur, or in Albert's case, scales. The girls are slightly less ravenous, and only tear into one each. You approach the platter and see each sandwich is teh size of a car too you. "Zen!", you call out. He doesn't hear you, but Kira does. She lowers her head to your level and asks, slightly timidly,"Something wrong,human?" You stammer a bit. Kira is quite attractive, even by human standards, and you catch yourself admiring her sweet face."Oh, it's just, these sandwiches look delicous, but to me, they're kinda..." "Big?" she finishes. You nod in agreement. She smiles and tears of pieces of bun from one of the Joe's, puts some meat in between, and hands you a ragged, but perfectly sized, Sloppy Joe. "Thanks, Kira," you smile, and sit to eat. Eventually, the plate is cleared, and licked clean by Zen. The carnivores sigh with content. "I'll get some napkins for us," Theodore grunts, and walks away. You get out your math homework and find it as easy as the class was. Halfway through, you hear a clomping sound behind you. The others tense up and narrow their eyes. You turn around to see...
15122112211111.title: Sloppy, indeed

151221122111111.content:
The newcomer was covered in short white fur from head to hoof. The hair on her head was thick and curly, accented by a pair of curving horns. Zen grabbed you a bit roughly and put you on his shoulder. "What do you want?", Felicia asked, stepping in front of the anthro. You whisper to Zen,"Is that a sheep?" He whispers back,"Yeah, she is. She was in math with us." "I don't remember seeing her." Zen chuckled. "Probably cause she wasn't staring at you in rage." You smile,"Really? Well...wait, how did you notice her then?" "Predator thing. I notice everything that happens, or doesn't happen." You return your attention to the sheep-girl. She abviously nervous, a prey item surrounded by predators. "Um, I..my name is Natalie, and I was wondering...I mean, I wanted to meet the human...I mean, the new student." She was practically shaking with fear. You tell Zen to let you down onto the table. "You sure? She's an herbivore, she might be with Corneil." "I don't think she'll hurt me. Like you said, she was the only one not hating me in math. Besides, I don't want word to get around the human is scared of a little sheep-girl." Zen chuckles in his throat and lowers you to the table. Natalie sits down and looks at you nervously. "Um, hi, I guess," You offer your hand to her. She extends a finger, you notice she only has 3 and a thumb, and you shake it. "Nice to meet you, human." She relaxes slightly. "So, why did you want to meet me," "Well, I heard you in math, answering all of the problems right, you seemed really smart. I was hoping you'd help me with my math homework." "Hold on, why should he help you, plant-breath?" Albert's jaws snapped as he spoke. Natalie blushed and she cringed in fear. "Albert, it's fine. I'd be happy to help." Natalie smiles and pulls out her workbook.

Just as lunch is finishing, you finish up with Natalie. She turns out to be very sweet and friendly, if easily frightened. "Thank you, human. Maybe I'll see you tomorrow?" "Sure. Is it okay if Natalie sits with us tomorrow, guys?" Albert looks miffed, but the rest seem okay with the idea. The bell rings, and the anthros dash to finish eating and gather their stuff for the next class. Natalie picks you up and asks,"What's you next class?"
151221122111111.title: a cute sheep anthro who wants to meet you.

choices: Mr.K talks about the advantages humans have over anthros.
1512211221111111.content:
"I've got Biology with Mr.Kawkins." Natalie brightened, her long ears quivering. "I've got Mr.K, too! Want a lift to class?" Zen moved in, growling low. "I'm his partner, fuzzy. I can handle it." Natalie shakes in fear and holds you out to Zen. "Zen, it's okay. She can carry me. Just stay close, okay?" Zen gives a strained nod, and Natalie retracts you, placing you on her fuzzy shoulder. She walks carefully out towards bio class, still nervous with Zen so close. The class has a very unique odor, a mix of preservative fluids and old meat, all underscored by the faint smell of excrement. Various cages and aquariums holding animals litter the perimeter of the classroom. A bookshelf to your right is adorned with skulls and jars containing preserved animals. The teacher is an aging crow, and his head jerks to stare at the trio entering. "Ah, good, you survived the school. I was hoping to meet you, human." He extends what you take for a wing, but see under the feathers he has 5 fingers ending in small talons. You shake the hand. "Nice to meet you, Mr.Kawkins." "Just Mr.K, please. I see you've already made some friends here. You'll need them, I tell you. This place is a madhouse." You smile. "Yeah, I've run into trouble at this school several times already." Now Mr.K grins, or you think he does. "Oh no, son, I mean this ROOM is a madhouse. The world out there will seem sane after this."

Natalie and Zen head to the back, sitting in the last row. As they and you take your seats, there's a commotion behind you. Suddenly, a what seems to you like a semi truck leaps of the back counter and lands in front of you. "George! I swear, I'm gonna turn you into a belt one day!", Mr.K yells. You see the truck is actually a gigantic lizard, a grey-green iguana. "Will he eat me!?" You scream."No, son, iguanas, whether our size or your size, are herbivores. George regards you with one eye, tongue lapping out to smell you. "Hey there, buddy." George nuzzles your chest, then whips around and crawls down the line of desks. The remainder of the class files in. "Afternoon, ladies and gentlemen. Today, we will be taking advantage of our new student to compare the human and anthro body." You gape."Zen, human, will you come to the front?" Zen picks you up and carries you to the front. "Now, what is the most obvious difference between these two?" "Their sizes." "Correct!" Mr.K writes of the board. "At their minimum size, anthros average about 20 feet tall, while human males average about 6 feet." He writes these on the board. "That makes anthros a bit under 4 times taller than humans. However, that's hardly all that we differ in. As a whole, humans come from one common ancestor, primates. Anthros, however, have a wide variety of ancestries, evidenced by the menagerie here." He gestures to the students. "What I want to emphasize, though, is what nature adapted each of our groups to. Suppose we could shrink Zen, or grow the human, so they were equal size. Which of the two do you think would win in a fight?" Zen smirked. You grimaced. "Zen, of course," a deer in the front row answered. "Yes, he would. Even adjusting for size, anthros are usually much stronger than humans. They also posess other advantages. Natural weapons, so to speak. Claws, horns, poison, venom, the list goes on and on. We also can protect ourselves from the harsh environments through fur, feathers, and scales." You sigh. This teacher seems to be pro-anthro.
1512211221111111.title: Biology class

15122112211111112.content:
"But, humans have one advantage over us anthros.", Mr.K says as you look up surprised. "That is their advanced intelligence." All the students looked at Mr.K in disbelief that such a creature so small to them has an advantage over them let alone it being intelligence. "For as long as humanity has been around they have found ways to fight all challenges that they may face. They used animal furs to survive the harsh winters, created weaponry to make up for their lack of strength, and found ways to cure many diseases." The students then look at you in awe as if you were sort of incredible being. Mr. K then continues "Humans have excelled in many different subjects such as math, science, literature, music, and architecture."
Mr.K then looks at you and Zen and saws "Oh, I'm terribly sorry, you two can sit down now." As you and Zen walk back to your seats, you felt everyone staring at you. You relaxed as you were placed onto Zen's desk, when you felt a something hit your shoulder causing you to stumble forward a bit. As you look back you see Natalie smiling down at you." Im so sorry, I didn't mean." You stop her right there saying, "It's OK, no harm done" you say with a smile. Mr. K then looks up the clockand notices that there are only ten minutes of class left. "Alright class, seeing as how you're so anxious to meet our new student you may talk with him for the rest of the period." You felt as if a bomb went off in the room as every anthro jumoed out of their seats and surrounded Zen's desk. You were assulted by a million question from your fellow classmates. Most of questions were to hold you, while some of the others were more tame such as your favorite subject or any hobbies you had. I know we have no power over nature about this stuff so why bother? They are fighting about something they can't control. So I hope this answers a few questions. :)

151221122111111121311.title: Decide to show it to Zen

choices: Child Care..."I'll go with child care if I were you"
15122112211112.content:
You watched all the anthros light up happy when you noticed something wrong. Zen had a plate of live cows...still alive. Sitting down in front of you with a noisy bunch. Zen distributed the cows among the whole group with one for you.

"This should be interesting, now we can know how humans eat," Albert said as he held his in his hand waiting to for you. You looked up to Albert then to Zen and faced the cow, letting out a fart before it mooed. Smelling the cows outrageous breath, this was too much for you to handle.

"Is there something wrong human," Felicia said worried.

"What's wrong," Zen said as the whole group shared a worried face. You turned pale, trying to answer back to your friends with a hearty smile. But different thoughts of a carnivorous anthro diet made you feel sicker and sicker. Finally, you blacked out from the stressed.

Your eyes started to open wondering what happened. Looking around, you found your friend Zen sitting at your side. It turns out your in the clinic on a soft bed five times bigger then you. "What you're doing here Zen, don't you have classes," you asked Zen with a hearty smile.

"What do you mean human, its only been twenty minutes," Zen smiled back but you can tell it was a bit hard for him. "Ehh...I'm a bit sorry about that incident, I totally forgot humans aren't capable of eating raw food," Zen said embarrassed.

"Well, it's not that we can't, its that if we could stomach it. A few humans can actually do that but they'll be shunned by humanity a bit," you said trying not to let humans get a bad view by carnivorous anthros.

"Excuse me for this but I find it quite strange how you must cook or do something to your food," Zen said scratching his head. Feeling that he wanted an answer, you amused him.

"Well, I believe the human body is made to adapt to it's environment very quickly. So we got an advantage over anthros at that," you got over carried looking up sheepishly up to Zen. But he seemed intrigued so you continued. "But it takes a human a difficult amount of time but usually in a month it will be just like home if they survive. Like I said...we can eat food raw but it will take time to adjust so we rather cook it even if we're away from civilization. If it was me, the first thing to do would be to fine shelter, then water and when you are settle down then hunt for food. It's a good thing we can go a month without food," You felt a bit too talkative around Zen and ended it there.

Sitting up, you search his face to find that he is quite impress. "I must say human, you maybe a bit weaker no offense but you beat us in other ways. If it wasn't for this size changing, things would be a bit different...for good or bad," Zen said as both of you thought about each other if things were a bit more even when your stomach growled. Hearing it, you held it in pain with discomfort in your face.

"Oops..nearly forgot" Zen said, pulling out a watermelon. Slicing it with his claw, he passed it to you as you started eating.

"Thanks," you said making a pig of yourself.

"I guess you were hungrier then I though," Zen laughed. You were a bit embarrassed but nonetheless you needed food for what's coming up next.
15122112211112.title: Humans and Anthro's are different in other ways

151221122111122.content:
After polishing off your watermelon, Zen hoisted you back onto his shoulder and started heading off to History class. Thankfully, there is no sign of Corneil anywhere, and when you get to the room, you feel oddly safe around the seven other carnivorous anthros. Felicia also happens to be in this class, and Zen decides to place you on a desk between his and hers. The teacher, an old and wise looking condor lady, strutted into the room and started to teach.

"Hello, everyone, I am Mrs. Peckard, and I will be your history teacher this year. We will be covering everything up from the first discovery of the sizechange ability through to the present day. In addition, there will also be some parts where our history intertwines with that of the human race. I know that such material has never been taught before in a general history class, but in this day and age where humans and anthros must learn to respect each other, it is now most important that anthros learn some human history."

Mrs. Peckard started handing out thick textbooks, although compared to the anthros they looked smaller than pocketbooks. The text is very heavy; at least five pounds, and must be at least a thousand pages long. However, when you look through the book, you notice that the type is quite large, and is written in a very clear manner. You actually are quite interested at many of the topics in the table of contents, such as "Growth's Golden Age", "The Hundred Parsec War", and especially "Discovery of the Humans".

The condor lady continued to speak about the class syllabus in slightly more detail. Some things that strike you as astounding about the history is that even in earlier times, the carnivores and herbivores lived uneasily. Apparently, 'The 'Hundred Parsec War' was between the two groups, and somehow was able to be resolved without either side clearly winning. You hear names that are very unfamiliar yet have a ring of accomplishment to them, such as King Lionel III (a great anthro lion who brought all of the anthro tribes together), Lycamedes (an ancient wolf philosopher who proved mathematically that there is no largest size an anthro can grow to), and Sir Penti Reticuli (a python explorer that first discovered humans).

You almost feel sad when the class ends, because you are genuinely interested in all of these colorful characters and wondrous events that you have never heard of before. You tell Zen about it as he lifts you back onto his shoulder. "Wow, Zen, you anthros have a very intriguing history! It sounds a lot better than the history that I learned in junior high."

"Really, human?" replies a slightly surprised lion. "I personally find history to be a bit of a bore. I do kind of want to find out about about the history of you humans, though. I find it hard to imagine history without sizechanging."

This was very unusual thing for your friend to say in your opinion, but at the same time made a lot of sense. Apparently, this concept of sizechanging, which is amazing to you, is an average, ordinary topic for anthros. So much, in fact, that they must see it as amazing that humans DON'T change sizes.

Now that only one class remained before study hall, you feel psyched to go to this last class. You ask Zen what it is, and he replies,
151221122111122.title: Sizechanging through the Ages
